title: Lead Product Manager - USA
description:
**Part-time -** 16 hours per week  
**Remote** 

**Founding Teams** is a new AI Tech Incubator and talent platform. We are supporting the next generation of AI startup founders with the resources they need including engineering, product, sales, marketing, and operations staff to create and launch their products.

The ideal candidate will have a passion for next-generation AI tech startups and working with great global startup talent.

**Job Description: Lead Product Manager**

**Position Overview:** We are seeking an accomplished and visionary Lead Product Manager to lead our product management team. The successful candidate will be responsible for driving the overall product strategy, managing a team of product managers, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative and successful products. As a Lead Product Manager, you will play a key role in shaping the direction of our product portfolio and driving its growth.

**Responsibilities:**

**Leadership:** Lead and mentor a team of product managers, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence.  
Provide strategic guidance and mentorship to team members to develop their skills and drive professional growth.

**Product Strategy:**Develop and communicate a comprehensive product vision and strategy that aligns with the company's business goals.  
Conduct market research, competitor analysis, and customer feedback to inform and refine the product strategy.

**Team Collaboration:**Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, marketing, and sales, to ensure the successful execution of the product roadmap.  
Facilitate communication and alignment among team members to achieve common product goals.

**Product Roadmap:**Develop and maintain a dynamic and prioritized product roadmap that reflects business priorities and customer needs.  
Ensure that the product roadmap is communicated effectively to all stakeholders.

**Strategic Decision Making:**Make informed and data-driven decisions regarding feature prioritization, resource allocation, and product enhancements.  
Balance short-term needs with long-term strategic goals.

**Market Analysis:**Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and market dynamics.  
Utilize market insights to identify new opportunities and guide product development.

**Stakeholder Management:**Build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders.  
Effectively communicate product plans, progress, and results to executives and other relevant stakeholders.

**Performance Monitoring:**Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess product performance and impact.  
Implement strategies for continuous improvement based on data and user feedback.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Product Manager, with a track record of successful product launches.
* Leadership experience, managing and developing a team of product managers.
* Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* In-depth knowledge of Agile development methodologies.
* Familiarity with product management tools and methodologies.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Master's degree in Business Administration or a related field.
* Certification in Product Management.
* Experience with UX/UI design principles.
* Demonstrated success in driving the growth of a product portfolio.
* Experience working in a leadership role within a technology-driven organization.

If you are an experienced and strategic product manager with a proven track record in leadership, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and play a crucial role in shaping the future of our products and leading a talented product management team.

Job Type: Part-time

Expected hours: 16 per week

Work Location: Remote

title: Associate Product Owner - Financial Systems
description:
**Pay Philosophy**
The typical starting salary range **($94,600 - $118,000)** for this role is determined by a number of factors including skills, experience, education, certifications and location. The full salary range for this role reflects the competitive labor market value for all employees in these positions across the national market and provides an opportunity to progress as employees grow and develop within the role. Some roles at Liberty Mutual have a corresponding compensation plan which may include commission and/or bonus earnings at rates that vary based on multiple factors set forth in the compensation plan for the role.

 **Description****This position may require a minimum of 2 days in office depending on hiring location. Hybrid office locations include:**

**Boston MA, Seattle WA, Plano TX, Portsmouth NH & Columbus OH**

  

Member of the Agile squad/team, working closely with the Product Owner I, representing the voice of the customer and the organization in execution of product vision. With guidance, works closely with all stakeholders to maximize the value of development through definition and prioritization of features and stories to ensure alignment with customer and organizational goals. Responsible for researching and defining external constraints on the squad/team (e.g. regulatory and compliance approvals). May perform Product Owner tasks such as reviewing and writing user stories of lower risk and complexity. Participates in defining and prioritizing the product backlog.

 **Responsibilities**

* With guidance from a Product Owner, supports the communication of and alignment to the product vision. May also contribute to the definition of the product vision.
* Supports the use of product level KPIs to drive product decisions. Assists in collecting KPI data and/or reinforcing their use in product decisions.
* Supports creating and maintaining the backlog (including prioritization, and acceptance criteria).
* Contributes to squad/team quarterly planning and sets expectations for delivery of new capabilities, features, and functionalities.
* Participates in squad/team demos, retrospectives, and all other ceremonies.
* With guidance, works daily with the Agile working group, clarifying business requirements, removing roadblocks, constantly communicating, and supporting alignment around product strategy.
* With a guidance from the Product Owner, monitors and maintains the product health, supporting long-term product viability and efficiency.
* May analyze feasibility, cost of delay ramifications, economies, and other aspects of planned or potential changes to the product.
* Conducts research into regulatory, compliance and other industry constraints on the product. Negotiates with squads/teams within the portfolio to ensure priorities are aligned during a sprint.
* With a guidance, supports building the product roadmap at the squad/team level based on strategy and ongoing input from stakeholders.

**Qualifications*** Accounting and Insurance experience preferred. Experience with regulatory reporting a plus.
* Knowledge of Agile development methodologies and project management as typically acquired through a Bachelor`s degree in relevant field (business, accounting, finance, computer science preferred).
* 3 years of experience in business, finance, accounting and/or consulting
* Minimum of 1 year direct experience with agile teams
* Ability to develop strong working relationships and able to influence others and build consensus with cogent arguments
* Experience communicating moderate to complex ideas, issues and designs
* Ability to operate with incomplete information and make timely decisions
* Problem solver with ability to lead a team
* Experimental mindset with demonstrated willingness to learn and experiment

**About Us**
At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow. That's why we provide an environment focused on openness, inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you'll discover our expansive range of roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding profession.  

  

Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a "Great Place to Work" by Great Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of the "100 Best Places to Work in IT" on IDG's Insider Pro and Computerworld's 2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of America's Best Employers for Women and one of America's Best Employers for New Graduates as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity. To learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit: https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion  

  

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits  

  

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status, pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.

title: Product Manager - New Products
description:
**What We Do Matters.**
iMentor is seeking an solutions-oriented, empathetic Product Manager to spearhead improvements to our student mentorship web and mobile platform.  

  

As an organization committed to empowering young people through mentorship, we believe in the power of technology to support the students, mentors and program administrators we serve. The usability of our platform has a direct impact on student engagement and college graduation rates.  

This role reports to the Director of Product and will play a pivotal role in launching and enhancing a new mentorship platform and mobile app. You will be responsible for defining business requirements, communicating effectively with engineering teams, conducting internal user research, and driving the strategic vision for increasing engagement.  

This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic team working on transformative changes to our platform, contributing to better systems that drive connection for students, mentors, and staff. **About the Team:**
iMentor’s Technology Solutions team is a growing group of product, design, and engineering practitioners dedicated to building a polished, powerful, and user friendly web & mobile platform that connects first generation college students with professional mentors. We collaborate with experts in education, analytics, support, and compliance from across the iMentor organization to improve our skills and our work.  

  

While we use agile frameworks, continuous discovery loops, and outcome-focused metrics to guide our work, we put the people on our team first. Our processes and policies - from scrum ceremonies to hybrid work arrangements - will always be shaped to fit the needs of the team.  

All teammates contribute their voices to decisions that impact the team; this is a chance to leverage your insight to have a real impact on students instead of receiving requests later down the waterfall.
### **Responsibilities**

* Conduct research to gain a deep understanding of students, mentor<>mentee relationships, and high school and higher ed administrators, as well as internal stakeholders.
* Develop a strategic viewpoint on the future state of the user experience and the transition from the current state to the future state of integrated systems.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and execute a roadmap for platform and mobile improvements.
* Define and document clear and comprehensive business requirements for new features.
* Prioritize requirements based on programmatic impact and strategic objectives.
* Manage day-to-day internal user support for the platforms integrated into the current ecosystem.
* Act as a bridge between users, product, and engineering teams, ensuring clear and effective communication.
* Collaborate closely with engineering to deliver seamless system integrations.
* Use user feedback to inform and drive product improvements.
* Gain a comprehensive understanding of how data flows between different systems and ensure data integrity and security.
* Collaborate with team to support other product management responsibilities for other areas of the platform

### **Qualifications**

* Proven experience in product management, ideally with EdTech, Higher Ed, or mobile apps for users aged 16-22.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work closely with engineering and cross-functional teams.
* Ability to think strategically and drive product vision.
* User-centric mindset with a focus on improving user experiences.
* Passion for contributing to the growth and transformation of systems for the benefit of students, mentors, and staff.
* Demonstrated alignment with iMentor's mission, values, and commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion.
* Views differences between individuals (race, gender, age, cultural heritage, physical ability, education, beliefs, and lifestyle) as an asset and demonstrates an appreciation of the diversity across the iMentor community.
* Our organization works in partnership with district public schools across the country. In doing so we must meet all compliance requirements of those districts including background checks.
* iMentor is committed to ensuring healthy and safe environments for our staff, mentors, and the students we serve. In order to fully comply with the NYC Vaccine mandate, all iMentor employees (regardless of role or region) are required to be fully vaccinated priority to their start date.

### **Compensation and Benefits**

* $120,000 annual salary
* Up to 100% employer funded comprehensive medical and dental coverage
* 18 days paid annual vacation (increasing annually to 21, 23, 25), 13 paid holidays + your birthday + one floating holiday, iMentor closed between Christmas and New Year’s Day, plus 6-7 sick days annually
* 401K match up to 4%
* Flexible Home/Office/School working arrangement
* Pre-tax commuter benefits
* Dependent care and health care flexible spending plans
* 1 hour of wellness time off per week for wellness activities of your choosing
* Flexible personnel wellness budget for reimbursements or marketplace purchases
* Every staff member is eligible for organization-sponsored professional development annually
* 9 weeks of paid parental leave

**About iMentor**  

iMentor believes that all students deserve an equitable chance to pursue their ambitions. Our program builds authentic mentoring relationships in order to bring greater equity to our students’ educational journeys. Through these long-term relationships, first-generation, students of color from underserved communities increase their access to the knowledge, experiences, and resources required to succeed in college or their post-secondary pathway of choice, and to pursue their career ambitions.  

By partnering with public schools serving primarily first-generation college students and providing every student in the school with a mentor, iMentor supports students’ post-secondary journeys with a level of depth and personalization that cannot be matched by traditional advising models. iMentor’s students are 37% more likely to enroll in college and are graduating college at double the rates of their peers.  

  

**iMentor’s Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**  

We believe that people of all backgrounds deserve equal access to educational opportunities. Recognizing that our country’s history of racism and systemic oppression continues to drive educational disparities for students of color, we give special focus to addressing the economic and racial divides that impact the communities we serve. We are committed to the collective work and intentional investment necessary to consistently move in the direction of educational equity and inclusion. Learn more at www.iMentor.org. **How to Apply** **Visit** **www.imentor.org/****jobs to** **submit a resume describing your interest in and qualifications for this position, as well as a sample of something you’ve built (please submit a public Github URI or portfolio link with snippets on your contribution to the project)****.** Applications will be considered on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.  

  

**iMentor is an Equal Opportunity Employer**

title: Technical Product Manager
description:
Despite our name, Bankjoy is not a bank! We are a silicon valley backed FinTech. Check out our investors Y Combinator and Bessemer Venture Partners and the impressive list of companies they have invested in! We are changing the way community banks and credit unions do business, enabling them to become tech-driven and digital first. Bankjoy provides modern digital banking products including mobile banking, online banking, online account opening, loan origination, and conversational AI. Our mission is to revolutionize banking tech infrastructure by leading digital transformation at financial institutions — big and small.

**This position pays between 115k-130k CAD.**

**The Role**


Bankjoy is looking for a versatile Technical Product Manager/Product Owner to join our expanding team. This hybrid role requires a unique blend of strategic insight and tactical execution, encompassing responsibilities of both a Product Manager and a Product Owner. The successful candidate will oversee the development of Bankjoy's consumer digital banking products, focusing on API integration and services, and will also manage our Bankjoy admin portal for B2B apps.

**In this role, you will:**

* Develop and execute the strategic vision for Bankjoy's Open API platform and the admin portal for Bankjoy apps.
* Manage product backlogs, write user stories, and oversee sprint planning and daily scrum activities for both consumer and B2B products.
* Collaborate with designers, developers, and system architects to create and refine API solutions and admin portal functionalities.
* Engage with community financial institutions and their customers to gather insights and feedback for both product lines.
* Work closely with UI/UX designers to optimize user experiences across consumer and B2B applications.
* Communicate the functionality and benefits of our products internally and externally.
* Shape the culture and processes within Bankjoy's product development team, ensuring efficient workflow and high-quality outputs.
* Oversee implementation tasks, address technical issues, and maintain streamlined product backlogs for both product lines.
* Assist with PCI, SOC II compliance, and multi tenancy migration projects.

**What you bring:**

* Minimum 5 years of experience in product management and/or product ownership, with a strong focus on API development or enterprise software.
* Demonstrated experience with Agile and Scrum methodologies, including sprint planning and backlog management.
* Experience in managing B2B products, in Fintech.
* In-depth understanding of authentication technologies such as SAML and OAuth 2.0 / Open ID Connect.
* Strong capability to thrive in a fast-paced, startup environment, and to work effectively with diverse teams.
* Familiarity with Canadian banking industry regulations and compliance standards is an advantage.
* Demonstrated experience in successfully managing and overseeing the lifecycle of technically complex products, from inception through launch and iterative improvements.
* Experience with access management product design is an advantage.

**What you get:**

* A fast-paced and collaborative environment
* Competitive compensation
* Stock options at a well-funded startup
* 100% medical, dental and vision coverage for you. We cover family's at 50%. (US Employees & Canadian Employees)
* 401(k) plan with 4% company matching (US Employees)
* 4 weeks PTO and 5 health days
* 18 holidays
* Performance-based bonuses (US & Canadian Employees)
* Remote first culture

 **Equal Employment Opportunities at Bankjoy**


Bankjoy is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Bankjoy provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability.


Compensation Range: CA$115K - CA$130K

title: Technical Product Manager
description:
**About this role**



We are seeking a talented and highly motivated individual to join our Product Management team as a Technical Product Manager. In this role, you'll integrate deeply with our Enterprise Data & Development Teams to lead the development and implementation of enterprise-level communication, data, and reporting products.
  

  

This role will be pivotal in leveraging technologies such as Snowflake and Tableau Cloud to deliver scalable, robust, and efficient solutions to our clients so that they can extend the capabilities of our data offering on their own. In addition, the candidate will have the opportunity to leverage data from a multi-sided platform model to drive new features on the Enterprise level. Our product team serves as the bridge between the business and technology teams, and we thrive on innovation, conceptualization, design, and piloting new capabilities to solve real customer problems. The ideal candidate will possess technical expertise, product management skills, and customer-facing capabilities.


**Apply if you're excited to:**


* Serve as a trusted advisor for stakeholders, driving key business outcomes with real impact on the company roadmap
* Engage with diverse teams and clients to align Petvisor solutions with real industry problems–overseeing, managing, and developing our data-driven software product
* Integrate closely with data and development teams for technical planning and deployment
* Manage Agile operations for efficient cross-departmental collaboration
* Develop clear documentation and processes for product understanding and adoption for internal and external audiences
* Illustrate business problems and value proposition to technical and executive audiences at all levels of our organization
* Conduct feedback sessions with customers for pre-development input, then bring that feedback back to an engaged development team eager to solve problems in new ways
* Validate product use cases and feasibility through demos with internal SMEs, users, and secondary audiences
* Support Strategic Account Managers with day-to-day product and technical needs–serving as the product evangelist to facilitate inquiries and provide technical support for customers as they adopt new features
* Collaborate on veterinary industry solutions to enhance data product value
* Stay updated on competitive technologies for strategic positioning


**About You**


* Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Research, or related fields, or equivalent experience
* 3+ years of experience as a Product Manager, Solutions Architect, or Data Contributor
* Internal and/or external consulting or customer-facing experience
* Exemplary written and verbal communication skills coupled with unparalleled follow-up skills
* Understanding of data analytics stack and workflow, including ETL, data platform design, BI, and analytics tools
* SQL experience required; high-level understanding of data warehousing, cloud data architecture, and data modeling beneficial


**Benefits & Perks**  

PetDesk is a remote organization, focused on a culture, infrastructure, and ecosystem that supports team members' participation in critical decisions and information sharing, regardless of location. Benefits and perks include:


* Medical coverage for employees and dependents (80-90% covered by employer)
* Employer HSA contribution with HDHP
* 401(k) match up to 3.5%
* Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
* Dental & Vision coverage available
* Basic Life and AD&D Insurance
* Short and Long Term Disability
* Flexible Time Off & 13 Paid Annual Holidays
* Paid Parental Leave
* Pawternity Leave, Financial Pet Adoption Support & Subsidized Pet Insurance
* $250 Annual Stipend for Learning and Development


**Pay Range**


$134,000—$150,000 USD
Petvisor is the parent company of a family of brands that includes PetDesk, Vetstoria, WhiskerCloud, Kontak, and Groomer.io. Petvisor equips veterinary practices and pet services businesses with a suite of mobile-enabled tools, facilitating better communication, service, and client retention. The company's innovative approach supports over 10,000 veterinary clinics, 400 grooming facilities, and over 20 million pet parents globally.



We are an equal opportunity and strive for a culture where everyone feels empowered to celebrate their whole, authentic selves at work. We encourage varied approaches and points of view to cultivate an inclusive workplace where difference is valued. Diversity fuels innovation and strengthens our bond with our customers and the communities we serve.


Our recruiting process is rooted in "Who: The A Method of Hiring" and consists of an average 2-week hiring timeline. This standardized interview process allows candidates to answer the same questions, experience the same process, and ensure a fair performance review from multiple perspectives.



Please, no external recruiters—candidate profiles submitted from external recruiting agencies will not be considered.


**Notice at Collection to Applicants Residing in California**  

Depending on your location, the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate how we manage job applicants' data. Our full notice outlining how your data will be processed as part of the application procedure for application locations is available at this link. By submitting your application, you agree to our use and processing of your data as required.

title: Product Owner
description:
Take the next step in your journey at Inspira Financial. You will help businesses and individuals thrive today, tomorrow, and into retirement. Become part of a company that is people centric and client obsessed in every interaction; a community of forward-thinking individuals focused on driving results to deliver our mission with an unwavering commitment to integrity. Join us as we strengthen and simplify the health and wealth journey – relentlessly pursuing better outcomes for all. **We believe in finding the best talent! While some roles are based at one of our office locations, remote roles can sit in any of the following states: AL, AZ, FL, GA, IA, IL, IN, MI, MN, MO, NC, NE, PA, SC, TN, TX, UT, VA and WV. Remote status and role locations are subject to change. Relocation is not provided.**


Don’t meet every single requirement? Here at Inspira Financial, we believe there is no “perfect” candidate and want to encourage applying even if all the requirements listed aren’t met. Our goal is to build an authentic workplace by valuing diversity in our candidates. We work to ensure that our team reflects the diversity of the businesses and clients we serve. We are always looking to expand our growing team with dynamic and enthusiastic individuals. If you enjoy a collaborative, fun environment that champions career development, Inspira Financial is the place for you! We look forward to receiving your application! Check out this Inspira Financial video to learn more about our company!


**HOW YOU WILL SOAR:**

The Product Owner role is responsible for ideation, specification, prioritization, implementation, and acceptance of product features in an Agile environment. The incumbent will be empowered and accountable to deliver innovative products to the market while working closely with leadership, clients, and technical teams to ensure product development aligns with business and technology outcomes. The ideal candidate will be strategic, innovative, and creative with a solid analytic foundation.


* Execute product roadmaps with a focus on measurable outcomes
* Track and regularly share progress with stakeholders and team members
* Author user stories and provide context for the product vision, strategy, and requirements
* Groom backlog and ensure that stories are ready for development
* Monitor and report KPIs on business and client metrics for the product
* Collaborate with various business lines and Technology to analyze needs, constraints, risks, and alignment with organizational strategy and priorities
* Work in partnership with team members and stakeholders to employ Agile methods, processes, tools, and metrics to deliver value, including ongoing product backlog refinement, product roadmaps, and release planning
* Engage and collaborate with team members to create and manage Agile artifacts (e.g., Product Roadmap, Backlog, Release Plan, Lessons Learned) and information needed for prioritization and decision-making
* Regularly assess features and costs to determine priorities for the product roadmap.
* Responsible for accepting product deliverables and providing guidance to the implementation teams
* Other duties as assigned


**IF YOU HAVE SOME OR ALL OF THE FOLLOWING, APPLY:**

* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Product Development or related field
* Scrum Product Owner or Certified Product Manager credentials preferred
* 4 -7 years of applicable experience
* Experience with various technology solutions including Salesforce and Service-Oriented Architecture
* Background in Financial Services and Fintech strongly preferred
* Experience with Cloud, APIs, DevOps, Agile methodologies (Scrum or Kanban)
* Strategic, innovative, and creative thinker with a solid analytic foundation
* Demonstrated leadership skills to gain credibility, garner respect, and guide the creation of self-organizing teams
* Working knowledge of Agile practices such as iterative development, incremental delivery, backlog management, burn down metrics, velocity and task definition
* Ability to be professionally assertive with business priorities and address opposing viewpoints while adhering to Agile concepts and principles
* Strong communication, facilitation and interpersonal skills to connect and engage with team members, facilitate discussions, mentor and advocate for team members, negotiate with the business, and resolve conflicts
* Ability to work with minimal direction, and flexibility to adapt to shifting priorities and schedules
* Ability to handle multiple issues simultaneously and manage stressful situations
* Strong knowledge of technical concepts and architectural principles to drive scalable solutions


Inspira Financial provides health, wealth, retirement, and benefits solutions that strengthen and simplify the health and wealth journey. With more than 7 million clients, representing over $62 billion in assets, Inspira works with thousands of employers, plan sponsors, recordkeepers, TPAs, and other institutional partners — helping the people they care about plan, save, and invest for a brighter future. Inspira relentlessly pursues better outcomes for all with our automatic rollover services, health savings accounts, emergency savings funds, custody services, and more. Learn more at inspirafinancial.com.


We have been recognized for our tremendous growth on lists, such as Crain’s Fast 50 and Inc. 5000, as well as our dedication to our customer’s wellbeing receiving the 2021 Gallagher Best-In-Class Employer and the 2020 Greater Oak Brook Chamber of Commerce Exceptional Service Award.


#LI-MG1 #LI-Remote

title: Product Manager
description:
Product Manager


Bloom, the insurance industry’s trusted growth partner, is looking for an experienced and dedicated Product Manager to be responsible for designing, planning, launching, and monitoring assigned products and/or product features. The Product Manager will be responsible for growing the product capabilities and utilization within the assigned product(s) user base(s). The right candidate will understand how to meet the needs of clients, influence strategic growth, and work with clients, prospects, and internal teams to deliver the product objectives. The right candidate will be excited about a fast-paced environment and have an extraordinary ability to take initiative and navigate unchartered paths.


**We are looking for an exceptional leader who can:**


* Create or assist in the creation of product strategy and business requirement for new features or products.
* Translate product strategy into detailed requirements for prototype construction and final product development by engineering teams.
* Responsible for product vision and continuous improvement of assigned features and/or products.
* Participates in all phases of the product development lifecycle, including analysis, design, testing, and integration of products as well as the introduction of products to the market.
* Lead and obtain strategic buy-in from internal and external stakeholders as necessary.
* Communicate product vision, roadmap, progress, and other key messages and engage with many diverse functional stakeholders through the product lifecycle.
* Actively seek customer and market input and data as a source of product innovation
* Act as the SME during initial roll-out and provide support when needed after product/feature launch.
* Responsible for continuous improvement of product post-commercialization
* Prioritize product features and requirements backlogs compromising both the business needs and technical readiness. Ability to participate in technical discussions and help make design trade-offs.
* Identify both business and technical impediments, assist in solving both and remain a primary steward for product advancement.
* Create documentation and communications to set expectations for delivery of new features/products.
* Guide direction for user stories related to assigned features/products to ensure precise development team execution.
* Work closely with functional business owners and client liaisons to create and maintain a product backlog according to business value and priority.
* Liaise, manage, and negotiate with IT SaaS vendors on all product-related issues as needed.
* Engage and support our Finance team in the creation of finance modeling/pricing associated with assigned products/features.
* Support our Business Development team by ensuring that documentation and education have been provided in order that they can effectively sell assigned features/products.
* Support the sale process as needed to deepen business partnerships in collaboration with the Business Development team to expand current client portfolio and/or create new business.
* Support our Product Operations team in defining KPIs, building analytics dashboards, internal and external reporting, and other tools to measure the impact of our solutions.
* Research your assigned product/feature(s) markets and audience to ensure that you remain in constant understanding of what our market and audience need and how to recommend positioning our product accordingly.
* May participate in the creation of documentation or user guides for new products/features.
* Perform all other duties as assigned.
* Participate in conferences and networking events as schedule permits.
* Perform all other duties as assigned.


**Education and Experience**


* Bachelor’s degree in business, health care administration or a related field
* 5+ years of experience in product development and/or product management required.
* Experience in a professional health insurance service role preferred.
* Experience with government programs healthcare enrollment strongly preferred.
* Medicare sales department knowledge a plus
* Expertise in the product or market including specific technical or industry knowledge.

**Skills and Abilities**

* Excellent written and oral communication skills are required; this role must have the ability to communicate with team members, other departments, upper management, and consumers of the company’s products.
* Superior project management and interpersonal skills
* Ability to maintain a keen attention to detail, multitask and work well under pressure and manage tight deadlines.
* Ability to work independently or collaboratively with a team in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
* Strong accountability and continuous initiator
* Entrepreneurial spirit highly skilled in innovative thinking and ability to drive solutions.
* Natural tendency to be curious, positive, and creative.
* Sincere empathy for the customer and a commitment to delving deep into the challenges they present or experience.
* Proficiency using MS Office programs (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio)
* Understanding of quality customer service
* Understanding of the software development lifecycle/process
* Demonstrated consistent patience, respect, and professionalism.
* Highly organized
* Ability to interpret and communicate complex data or concepts and relay concerns clearly and concisely.
* Demonstrated ability to advocate for the needs of the business and customer with proven results.

**Travel Requirements**


* Up to 10% of the time

### **What We Offer**


At Bloom, we offer an engaging, supportive work environment, great benefits, and the opportunity to build the career you always wanted. Benefits of working for Bloom include:


* Competitive compensation
* Comprehensive health benefits
* Long-term career growth and mentoring


### **About Bloom**


Bloom is a third-party insurance services provider that partners with Medicare health plans to enable high-quality Medicare enrollment and drive earlier health plan activation. Founded in 2007, Bloom has partnered with national and regional payers to implement solutions for every step of the member journey, from telesales and quote & enroll to health activation outreach. Supported by its Ascend technology platform, Bloom produces closer connections and better outcomes for Medicare beneficiaries and health plan stakeholders to deliver High Value Enrollment.


### **Ascend Platform**


Bloom provides advanced enrollment and health activation solutions to the insurance industry through the Ascend platform. Our Ascend platform supports insurance shopping, new member enrollment, and extended engagement that lead to better outcomes for Medicare health plans, brokers, agents, and beneficiaries.


**Bloom is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer.** We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

title: Product Manager
description:
**Position Title:** Product Manager

**Department:** Information Technology

**Location:** Remote

**Reports To:** Vice President of Information Technology


Installation Made Easy (“IME”) provides software and process management that enable retailers and contractors to offer installed home improvements to homeowners in a convenient, consistent, and affordable manner. IME senior management has over 100 years of retail management and home improvement industry experience.


The Product Manager (PM) is primarily responsible for documenting requirements for system enhancements, new features or bug fixes. The PM will interact with all departments within the company, including Software Development, Business Development, Project Management, Operations as well as with Executive Management. Additionally, the PM will have the potential to interact with Retailer and Manufacturer representatives and third-party vendors.


The candidate must be independently motivated, diligent with details, and precise in their work. Accuracy is a requirement, not an option. Furthermore, the candidate must have the ability to understand a process from beginning to end, ask questions, and think through obscure situations. The candidate must be able to work independently in a remote environment.

**Essential Functions:**

* Work closely with business team to define and document requirements for system enhancements, new features or bug fixes;
* Identify potential unintended impacts of requests and/or additional specifications needed;
* Work closely with development team to create workable tickets by defining Issue, Impact, Steps to Reproduce, Resolution, and Acceptance Criteria;
* Act as liaison between development team and business team to resolve blocked or on-hold tasks;
* Communicate weekly releases;
* Document business/system rules and processes; and
* Perform End User Testing of system enhancements, new features or bug fixes as needed.

 **Minimum Qualifications:**

* 2-4 years of experience as a Product Manager or Business Analyst within software development
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field;
* Experience customizing or building CRM systems
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
* Ability to function well in a high-paced environment.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite with the ability to learn new or updated software.

 **Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience writing software
* Experience as a Software Engineer/Software Developer

 **Physical Requirements:**

* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Must be able to lift 15 pounds at times.

 **Benefits to working with IME:**

* 100% remote work environment
* Employer provided equipment.
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance
	+ Health savings plan includes employer contribution to health savings account.
* Medical and dental flexible spending accounts
* Company paid basic life, short-term disability, and long-term disability insurance.
* 401K plan with employer match
	+ Company matches 100% of the first 4% of salary deferrals.
	+ All contributions, including employer contributions, are 100% vested immediately.
* Employee discount program for Electronics, Groceries, Travel, Entertainment, and more
* Employee assistance program
* Pay on demand.
* Critical illness, hospital indemnity, group accident, and legal insurance
* Paid time off.
* And more!

 **We are an Equal Opportunity and Drug-Free Workplace.**


The Job Description is not an exhaustive statement of all duties, responsibilities, or qualifications of the job, nor is it intended to limit opportunities for necessary modifications. The Job Description does not constitute an employment contract of any kind.

title: Product Manager, SMB (Remote)
description:
**Company Description**  

At Marketplace, our mission is to help readers turn their aspirations into reality. We arm people with trusted advice and guidance, so they can make informed decisions they feel confident in and get back to doing the things they care about most.


We are an experienced team of industry experts dedicated to helping readers make smart decisions and choose the right products with ease. Marketplace boasts decades of experience across dozens of geographies and teams, including Content, SEO, Business Intelligence, Finance, HR, Marketing, Production, Technology and Sales. The team brings rich industry knowledge to Marketplace’s global coverage of consumer credit, debt, health, home improvement, banking, investing, credit cards, small business, education, insurance, loans, real estate and travel.

 **Job Description**  

Forbes Marketplace is looking for a Product Manager to join our rapidly growing team within the Small Business Vertical. This role offers a unique opportunity to significantly contribute to the development of 0-1 products in our innovative business hub, identifying new monetization opportunities, addressing unique needs of underserved markets, and building highly differentiated products for our large portfolio of small business owners.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Identify monetization opportunities and untapped customer markets in the small business space, creating unique and impactful solutions.
* Lead the development of new software products, understanding customer pain points and employing a high degree of craftsmanship aligned with our product principles.
* Rapidly execute product initiatives, promoting a culture of learning and drawing insights from each project.
* Engage in direct communication with customers for product discovery, ensuring our solutions are closely aligned with their needs.
* Identify and implement strategies to continuously improve product reliability, scalability, security, maintainability, and performance.
* Work closely with engineering teams to improve standards, tooling, and processes.
* Utilize SQL for data analysis, deploy experiments, and generate actionable insights to inform product development and strategy.

**Requirements:**

* 2+ years of experience in a product management role, ideally with a background in software engineering.
* Demonstrated success in developing software solutions that not only meet but exceed operating targets in terms of reliability, scalability, and performance.
* Understanding of engineering principles and experience in partnering with engineering teams to improve standards, tooling, and processes.
* Preference for candidates with familiarity with the small business sector and a proven track record of building high-impact solutions in this space.
* Proficiency in SQL, GA, Amplitude with experience in conducting experiments and extracting actionable insights from data.
* Excellent communication and organizational skills, strong leadership and problem-solving abilities, with the capacity to handle multiple tasks under pressure.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive compensation package
* Ability to work remotely
* Unlimited PTO
* Every third Friday of the month off
* Winter break closure; the week between Christmas and New Years
* Home office setup
* Wellness Reimbursement

  

**Additional Information**  

Forbes Marketplace provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.


This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.


#LI-REMOTE #LI-NM1

title: Senior Product Manager (Cloud Networking) - Remote
description:
**Are you interested in creating marketing-leading compute products?**


**Do you enjoy creating products that customers love?**


**Come join our Cloud Technology Group!**



As part of Akamai's Cloud Technology Group (CTG), the Cloud Compute team's mission is to be the leading cloud for developers to build powerful, distributed, edge-native applications. We provide the infrastructure and services that enable developers and enterprises to build next generation applications on Akamai.


**Partner with the best**



As a Senior Product Manager, you are responsible for developing & advancing a simple, scalable distributed networking experience with our load balancing product portfolio. Through your efforts, you provide a set of highly differentiated solutions in the compute market to drive customer acquisition, customer expansion, and revenue growth.



As a Senior Product Manager, you will be responsible for:


* Defining the strategy for the product line inclusive of product definitions, market fit/alignment, key use-cases, and pricing models.
* Gathering and prioritizing feedback from customers & key stakeholders & translating the feedback into an actionable roadmap
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams during the product development process to ensure we deliver market-leading product experiences.
* Providing subject matter expertise and leadership to other product managers, sales/GTM teams, and customers.


**Do what you love**



To be successful in this role you will:


* Have 12 years of relevant experience and a bachelor's degree in engineering or equivalent.
* Have experience building and/or working with networking products (ideally at L4/L7)
* Be experienced in developing & launching new products and bringing them to market.
* Have experience defining an end-to-end product experience.
* Be passionate about working with customers and finding creative solutions
* Demonstrate experience gathering & using data to drive decision making


**Work in a way that works for you**



FlexBase, Akamai's Global Flexible Working Program, is based on the principles that are helping us create the best workplace in the world. When our colleagues said that flexible working was important to them, we listened. We also know flexible working is important to many of the incredible people considering joining Akamai. FlexBase, gives 95% of employees the choice to work from their home, their office, or both (in the country advertised). This permanent workplace flexibility program is consistent and fair globally, to help us find incredible talent, virtually anywhere. We are happy to discuss working options for this role and encourage you to speak with your recruiter in more detail when you apply.
  

  

Learn what makes Akamai a great place to work



Connect with us on social and see what life at Akamai is like!

  

**We power and protect life online, by solving the toughest challenges, together.**



At Akamai, we're curious, innovative, collaborative and tenacious. We celebrate diversity of thought and we hold an unwavering belief that we can make a meaningful difference. Our teams use their global perspectives to put customers at the forefront of everything they do, so if you are people-centric, you'll thrive here.


**Working for you**



At Akamai, we will provide you with opportunities to grow, flourish, and achieve great things. Our benefit options are designed to meet your individual needs for today and in the future. We provide benefits surrounding all aspects of your life:


* Your health
* Your finances
* Your family
* Your time at work
* Your time pursuing other endeavors


Our benefit plan options are designed to meet your individual needs and budget, both today and in the future.


**About us**



Akamai powers and protects life online. Leading companies worldwide choose Akamai to build, deliver, and secure their digital experiences helping billions of people live, work, and play every day. With the world's most distributed compute platform from cloud to edge we make it easy for customers to develop and run applications, while we keep experiences closer to users and threats farther away.


**Join us**



Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!  

  

Akamai Technologies is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength that diversity brings to the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race/ethnicity, protected veteran status, disability, or other protected group status.  

  

#LI-Remote



#Cloud


**Compensation**



Akamai is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The base salary for this position ranges from $134,466 - $214,782/year; a candidate’s salary is determined by various factors including, but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, certifications and location. The compensation package may also include incentive compensation opportunities in the form of annual bonus or incentives, equity awards and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP). Akamai provides industry-leading benefits including healthcare, 401K savings plan, company holidays, vacation (in the form of PTO), sick time, family friendly benefits including parental leave and an employee assistance program including a focus on mental and financial wellness; Eligibility requirements apply.

title: Product Manager
description:
Are you passionate about making a difference in people's lives? Do you enjoy working in a service-oriented industry? If so, this opportunity may be the right fit for you!
Modivcare is looking for an experienced Product Manager to join our team! This position is responsible for the overall success of the product by owning of the product roadmap and prioritizing building what matters most to achieve the strategic goals and initiatives behind the product.*Please note this is an "Evergreen" position which is used to build our candidate pool but is not a role that is open at this time. That said, we encourage you to apply to be a part of our talent community. By having your information on file, we can reach out to you when this (or a similar role) officially opens.*
This role...* Owns accountability for the overall team and product success
* Defines and shares the product vision, aligned with the goals of the business and is accountable to business leaders. Defines business value & OKRs (Objectives & Key Results)
* Maintains full responsibility for determining the timing of and prioritization of user problems to solve; Empowered to re-prioritize (and say no).
* Collaborates with the product development team, including product owners, developers, designers, and other stakeholders, to identify and prioritize product functionality.
* Creates and maintains a product backlog, including epics and feature level decomposition for sprint planning.
* Communicates regularly with stakeholders, including customers and internal teams to gather feedback, pain points, opportunities, and incorporates it into the prioritized feature backlog and roadmap.
* Works with the Product Owners to support development of user stories and acceptance criteria, to guide the development process.
* Participates in sprint planning and reviews meeting, and ensures that development teams have the resources they need to deliver products on time.
* Works with the team to find the best solution option based on tradeoffs.
* Engaging in Agile methodology ceremonies used through the development process as needed, including sprint planning and sprint retrospectives as needed.
* Continuous evaluation and refining of the product development process to improve efficiency and effectiveness.
* Supports the development of User Personas based on market research and customer feedback.
* Supports release planning timing, coordination, change impact assessment, communication (e.g. release notes) and training as needed.
* Conducts market research and analyzing trends to identify opportunities for product innovation and improvement.
* Works with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, and support, to ensure that products are well-positioned in the market and meet customer needs.
* Maintains a deep understanding of the competitive landscape and the needs of the target market, and using this knowledge to inform product development decisions.
* May lead projects and perform other duties as assigned.


We are interested in speaking with individuals with the following...* Bachelor’s degree in computer science preferred.
* Seven (7) plus years of experience in product management, consumer or enterprise-level product management.
* Marketing experience preferred.
* Experience preferred (but not required) in any of the following tools: JIRA Smartsheet Hubspot Google Analytics / Firebase Tableau.
* Or equivalent combination of education and/or experience.
* Strong analytical skills and passion for analyzing products, competitors, and market dynamics.
* Comprehensive understanding of agile methodologies. Scrum / agile certification a plus.
* Excellent collaboration and interpersonal skills to work with internal and external stakeholders.
* Proven ability manage product functionality prioritization and handle complex problems with minimal supervision.
* Metrics-oriented and customer focused, with presentation skills across stakeholder group across executive team, business leadership and product development teams
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to work effectively with geographically distributed teams.
* Ability to write decompose product capabilities functional specifications into logical groupings (e.g. epics, features, user stories).
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office packages is required.
* Experience in any of the following tools preferred:
* JIRA / Confluence / Trello / Asana
* Aha!
* Smartsheet
* Tableau
* Google Analytics / Firebase
* Hubspot


Salary: $111,000 - $149,900
This role is bonus eligible based on individual and company performance.
Modivcare’s positions are posted and open for applications for a minimum of 5 days. Positions may be posted for a maximum of 45 days dependent on the type of role, the number of roles, and the number of applications received. We encourage our prospective candidates to submit their application(s) expediently so as not to miss out on our opportunities. We frequently post new opportunities and encourage prospective candidates to check back often for new postings.  

We value our team members and realize the importance of benefits for you and your family.
Modivcare offers a comprehensive benefits package to include the following:* Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
* Employer Paid Basic Life Insurance and AD&D
* Voluntary Life Insurance (Employee/Spouse/Child)
* Health Care and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts

Pre-Tax and Post * -Tax Commuter and Parking Benefits
* 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan with Company Match
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Parental Leave
* Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Employee Discounts (retail, hotel, food, restaurants, car rental and much more!)

*Modivcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer.** EEO is The Law - click here for more information
* Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled
* We consider all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, handicap or disability, or status as a Vietnam-era or special disabled veteran in accordance with federal law. If you need assistance, please reach out to us at hr.recruiting@modivcare.com

title: Product Manager II
description:
**Summary**

R1 product managers are driven to make a difference in healthcare, by re-thinking the patient


experience, reducing the administrative burden on physicians, and ensuring our clients can


focus on patient care. The product team is responsible for driving delivery of critical roadmap


capabilities. Product Manager IIs lead the delivery of the roadmap, manage the product


backlog, and collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders. The PM II takes strategic direction


from product management and leads in the design and delivery of functional, technology enabled solutions.  



  

**Responsibilities**

* Drive development of new features by interpreting business needs, composing user

stories and acceptance criteria in an agile environment.


* Interface with engineering team to articulate requirements, product vision and business

priorities.


* Own maintenance backlog, including prioritization, and work closely with engineering

leads to feed the teams a constant pipeline of high-value work for each sprint.


* Work with stakeholders to guide the release of new features and the successful

integration and/or migration of current operations onto those products.


* Ensure product quality by performing thorough user acceptance testing.
* Quickly identify blockers, developing a mitigation strategy or escalating to leadership

where needed.


* Prioritize features and stories by balancing stakeholder interests, user needs, technology

direction, and product strategy.


* Make tough trade-off decisions between scope and schedule, while maintaining focus

on outcomes.


* Communicate with stakeholders, end users and developers on feature requests, bugs,

development priorities, and deployment timelines.


Competencies for Success


* Passionate about keeping current on the latest product innovations and how to

practically apply them.


* Thrives in a collaborative environment and is comfortable working with others and

giving and receiving feedback.  



  

**Required Qualifications**

* Ideally 2 years’ experience in product management.
* Demonstrated experience to drive execution within an Agile environment.
* Experience interfacing directly with technology leaders and engineers.

  

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Healthcare experience a plus, specifically in Healthcare Revenue Cycle and/or Revenue

Integrity Applications.


For this US-based position, the base pay range is $53,812.50 - $93,375.00 per year . Individual pay is determined by role, level, location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.
Learn more about Benefits at R1


Working in an evolving healthcare setting, we use our shared expertise to deliver innovative solutions. Our fast-growing team has opportunities to learn and grow through rewarding interactions, collaboration and the freedom to explore professional interests.  



  

Our associates are given valuable opportunities to contribute, to innovate and create meaningful work that makes an impact in the communities we serve around the world. We also offer a culture of excellence that drives customer success and improves patient care. We believe in giving back to the community and offer a competitive benefits package including:


* Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision & RX Coverage
* Paid Time Off, Volunteer Time & Holidays
* 401K with Company Match
* Company-Paid Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability & Long-Term Disability
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Parental Leave

R1 RCM Inc. (“the Company”) is dedicated to the fundamentals of equal employment opportunity. The Company’s employment practices , including those regarding recruitment, hiring, assignment, promotion, compensation, benefits, training, discipline, and termination shall not be based on any person’s age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. Furthermore, the Company is dedicated to providing a workplace free from harassment based on any of the foregoing protected categories.


If you have a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the job application process, please contact us at 312-496-7709 for assistance.
