title: Product Manager, Digital Products
description:
Overview:

Lifeway is hiring a full time **Product Manager, Digital Products**. The Product Manager, Digital Products will set product vision and roadmaps, be the face and owner of Lifeway’s digital discipleship offerings, and work alongside Church Ministry area leaders to develop a digital product strategy that is centered on the needs of customers. Will determine customer needs, communicate business and customer problems /needs / business requirements to the Technical Platform Manager. This role will require cross-functional collaboration with internal and external partners and will serve as a member of the Church Ministries Leadership Team. **Why Lifeway?**  

Lifeway is a place where you can bring your faith and work experience to join in the most important mission in the world: making disciples of Jesus Christ. Whether you’re a creator or storyteller, data guru or problem-solver, or anywhere in between, if you’re passionate about serving the church, we have a place for you. Lifeway has a strong Work from Anywhere (WFA) culture that is deeply focused on our mission and values. While headquartered in Nashville, TN, many of our positions are remote-eligible and have autonomy and flexibility with work hours. We provide equipment and resources to ensure team members have access to a productive and ergonomic workspace. We believe building relationships and community is essential to how we work together, so Lifeway hosts all-team meetings several times per year and provides travel for key team gatherings for remote-based team members. Full-time employees are eligible for enrollment in our comprehensive benefits plans including healthcare, vacation and sick time, holiday pay, care days, 401(k) plan, maternity and paternity leave, adoption assistance, mission trip time, and more. If this sounds like a place where you would be excited to serve the kingdom of God, we would love for you to join our team. **Learn more about our culture at team.lifeway.com/culture-code** **This is a remote position in the U.S. with occasional travel to Nashville for in-person team gatherings.**
#LI-Remote  


Responsibilities:
**Essential Duties and Responsibilities** - Following is a summary of the essential functions. Other duties may be performed which are not mentioned below.

* Strategic Leadership – Responsible for the development and execution of Lifeway’s digital product strategy. Set the vision and roadmap for Lifeway’s digital offerings determining business stakeholders, metrics for success, pricing strategies, and writing business requirements.
* Thought Leadership – Utilize market research and industry best standards, collect and analyze customer feedback, be the owner of the product internally and externally, and initiate cross-functional teams with learned data and product enhancement recommendations.
* Financial Plan – Execute current year plan by working with all stakeholders to properly align resources to achieve goals identified in the operations budget.
* Market Knowledge – Determine customer needs, use cases, and anticipate future needs of church leaders to develop digital product platforms and resources that chart what’s next for Lifeway’s customers. Continually develop an awareness of Lifeway’s product offerings guiding the team to think digitally as resources are created.
* Collaboration –Collaborates with Church Ministries Leadership team, Technical Platform Manager, UX, Marketing, Sales, and Customer Support to achieve long-term and short-term goals of Lifeway’s digital product strategy. Other duties assigned.


Qualifications:
**Required Qualifications** - The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 **Minimum Education:**

* Bachelor’s degree

**Minimum Required Experience:**

* 8 years of product management, strong preference given to technology products
* 8 years leadership in IT project management or digital publishing.
* 5 years leadership in a church, non-profit or parachurch organization.

**KSAs (knowledge/skills/abilities):**

* Strategic thinker – Advanced
* Collaborator – Advanced
* Communication skills – Advanced
* Leadership skills – Proficient
* Ability to cast and execute vision – Proficient
* Knowledge of church practice – Proficient

**Other Job Requirements:**

* Ability to travel, occasionally overnight
* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.
* Membership/active in a Southern Baptist church preferred
* Travel - 10%

title: Senior Product Manager, Member
description:
Papa is a new kind of care built on human connection. Across the country, health plans and employers look to Papa to provide vital social support by pairing older adults and families with Papa Pals, trained and vetted companions, who provide a helping hand and an open ear, resulting in less loneliness and better health.



Founded in 2017 and headquartered in Miami, Papa is backed by Canaan, Tiger Global Management, Comcast Ventures, SoftBank Vision Fund 2, TCG, Initialized Capital, and Seven Seven Six, among other revered institutional and individual investors. We envision a world where no one has to go it alone. Learn more at Papa.com.

**About the Role**



As the Senior Product Manager for the Member team, you will be responsible for the strategy and execution of products benefiting the seniors who use our services. Reporting into the VP, Product, you will build products that benefit our business and improve the experience of our members. Importantly, you'll need to lead as we explore different types of products (web, SMS, phone systems), helping the company determine how we should invest and build on different surfaces to engage our members.



While our business is mature and valued by users, we are early in our work creating products for members (who mostly call us right now). You should enjoy and excel at the strategic rigor needed to make foundational product decisions as well as the executional acumen to build products used daily by thousands.


**Essential Job Functions:**


* Work with product leadership to prioritize, sequence, and assess the platforms (e.g. web, SMS, automated phone systems) we build in to engage our members.
* Develop and voice a clear strategy for your product area. Create data-informed, user-compelling, and business-impactful roadmaps.
* Own execution across multiple technologies to build features that our members use and value. Balance executional rigor with velocity, and empower your team as they build.
* Work collaboratively with and mutually uplevel engineering, design, research, data, and operations. Empower cross functional collaborators to feel ownership of and improve the work we do.
* Ensure we are purposefully learning from our work through well-constructed experiments, research and data analysis, and monitoring of product performance.
* Foster a deep understanding of our users in yourself and the team, and use those insights to create engaging, business-building user experiences.
* Thrive in a startup environment by creating clarity from ambiguity and moving nimbly.


**Requirements:**


* 7+ years in product management working on human-facing products.
* Demonstrated ability to understand different technologies and build products across them. While understanding specific technologies is useful, we're mostly interested in your ability to get smart about a new channel and guide your teams on how to think about it.
* Stakeholder management experience: working with cross-functional leadership to align on strategy and maintain enthusiastic commitment to the work.
* The ability to understand business strategy and align product work towards it.
* Demonstrated ability to get in the executional details and move the team forward. Understand and assess the technical, design, and business aspects of shipping products.
* Expertise deploying data resources strategically to inform and assess product work.
* Professional or lived experience creating products for seniors or higher needs populations is a plus.


Papa's culture is People-first. While we have an incredible team of hard-working Papa people, at the end of the day, our company is really about family and community – and we celebrate that among our employees. We encourage everyone to truly bring their whole authentic selves to work. To be transparent. To be non-hierarchical. And, above all, to be a really good person.



We see ourselves as a place where every Papa employee feels they belong, a place where careers flourish, a place that brings back purpose and joy to work, a culture where visionaries/entrepreneurs are developed.



Papa's mission is at the core of our total rewards philosophy wherein we attract and retain high potential talent aligned with our journey. We offer gender neutral and inclusive parental leave policies that offer up to 16 weeks of 100% paid parental leave. We immensely value the benefits of a flexible workplace, while designing remote-first principles we ensured that Papa people feel psychologically safe about their career interests while being remote.

title: Product Manager, Client Experience
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**



As a Product Manager at Stitch Fix, you will play a pivotal role in shaping one of the highest priorities of our company - client experience. Your mission will be to develop engaging and social experiences that not only helps clients visualize their style but also provides compelling reasons for them to return and evolve their style. To achieve this, you'll focus on driving innovations in style visualization, client relationship building, and continuous evolution of our offerings.


**YOU ARE EXCITED ABOUT THIS OPPORTUNITY BECAUSE YOU WILL…**


* **Champion Innovative Product Ideas**: Dive deep into understanding client needs and company objectives to define groundbreaking product ideas focused on enhancing client engagement and retention. You'll employ techniques such as customer interviews, prototyping, and concept testing to generate ideas that resonate with our target audience and align with Stitch Fix's strategic goals.
* **Lead Meaningful Discovery Work**: Undertake thorough discovery work to uncover insights and identify solutions that address both client pain points and business challenges. You'll collaborate closely with stakeholders across the organization, conducting market research, competitive analysis, and user testing to inform product decisions and ensure alignment with Stitch Fix's mission.
* **Drive Cross-Functional Collaboration****:** Work hand in hand with Design and Engineering teams throughout the product development lifecycle. Applying Marty Cagan's emphasis on empowered product teams, you'll foster a collaborative environment where cross-functional partners collaborate closely, share insights, and iterate rapidly to deliver innovative solutions that exceed client expectations and drive business outcomes.


**WE’RE EXCITED ABOUT YOU BECAUSE…**


* **You have the right breadth of experience****:** 5+ years of product manager experience with a strong focus on driving growth and engagement within the e-commerce sector.
* **You are a strategic thinker:** Demonstrated ability to build a compelling business case around an idea and effectively communicate your vision and rationale to cross-functional partners and executive leaders.
* **You are a thoughtful collaborator:** Proficiency in collaborating with cross-functional teams, building relationships, and a deep understanding of how the business operates.
* **Prioritization is important to you****:** Strong skill in ruthless prioritization, especially when faced with competing priorities, opportunities, and constraints.
* **You possess strong technical & quantitative Skills****:** Exceptional technical and quantitative skills, including experience working with data science to make informed decisions.
* **Of your strong product sense****:** A keen product sense and experience working closely with Product Design and UX teams to craft delightful user experiences.
* **Bonus**: Experience with early-stage product development, taking products from zero to one, is a plus.

### **YOU’LL LOVE WORKING AT STITCH FIX BECAUSE…**


* We are a group of bright, kind people who are motivated by challenge. We value integrity, innovation and trust. You’ll bring these characteristics to life in everything you do at Stitch Fix.
* We cultivate a community of diverse perspectives— all voices are heard and valued.
* We are an innovative company and leverage our strengths in fashion and tech to disrupt the future of retail.
* We win as a team, commit to our work, and celebrate grit together because we value strong relationships.
* We boldly create the future while keeping equity and sustainability at the center of all that we do.
* We are the owners of our work and are energized by solving problems through a growth mindset lens. We think broadly and creatively through every situation to create meaningful impact.
* We offer comprehensive compensation packages and inclusive health and wellness benefits.


If you're a visionary Product Manager looking to drive client engagement at the forefront of tech and fashion, we invite you to join us at Stitch Fix. Help us transform the way people discover their personal styles and be a part of our exciting journey. Apply now and let's redefine retail together!


### **ABOUT STITCH FIX**



We're changing the industry and bringing personal styling to every body. We believe in a service and a workplace where you can show up as your best, most authentic self. The Stitch Fix experience is not merely curated—it’s truly personalized to each client we style. We are changing the way people find what they love. We’re disrupting the future of retail with the precision of data science by combining it with human instinct to find pieces that fit our client’s unique style. This novel juxtaposition attracts a highly diverse group of talented people who are both thinkers and doers. This results in a simple, yet powerful offering to our customers and a successful, growing business serving millions of men, women and kids throughout the US. We believe we are only scratching the surface and are looking for incredible people like you to help us boldly create our future.


**Compensation and Benefits**  

  

Our anticipated compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets, and the range below indicates the low end of the lowest-compensated market to the high end of the highest-compensated market. This position is eligible for new hire and ongoing grants of restricted stock units depending on employee and company performance. In addition, the position is eligible for medical, dental, vision, and other benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external careers site.
Salary Range
$220,000—$236,000 USD
*This link* *leads to the machine readable files that are made available in response to the federal Transparency in Coverage Rule and includes negotiated service rates and out-of-network allowed amounts between health plans and healthcare providers. The machine-readable files are formatted to allow researchers, regulators, and application developers to more easily access and analyze data.*



Please review Stitch Fix's US Applicant Privacy Policy and Notice at Collection here: https://stitchfix.com/careers/workforce-applicant-privacy-policy


**Recruiting Fraud Alert:**



To all candidates: your personal information and online safety are top of mind for us. At Stitch Fix, recruiters only direct candidates to apply through our official career pages at https://www.stitchfix.com/careers/jobs or https://web.fountain.com/c/stitch-fix.



Recruiters will never request payments, ask for financial account information or sensitive information like social security numbers. If you are unsure if a message is from Stitch Fix, please email RecruitingOperations@stitchfix.com.



You can read more about Recruiting Scam Awareness on our FAQ page here: https://support.stitchfix.com/hc/en-us/articles/1500007169402-Recruiting-Scam-Awareness

title: Product Documentation Manager
description:
**Description**


Skillable is a 100% remote and virtual tech company that’s modernizing the world of training. Come share your professional magic with highly talented, drive and fun colleagues who believe in the power of “skilling.” Experience what a true team focused on doing the right thing feels like!  

Our people and talent are what make us great and fun! We work together to create amazing solutions and experiences for our customers and their clients. We utilize our employees’ personal strengths to help our company grow and ensure our team is living their best, authentic life. We don’t just share our appreciation for our team members once a year with a branded mug—it’s shared on a daily basis. Our remote work environment blends the demands of work and life without the added pressure of commuting or feeling guilty about leaving early to visit the dentist.  

Come work with us and learn what teamwork and integrity blended with an emphasis on well-being and balance can do for your career!  

The **Product Documentation Manager** will work on our Product and Technology team, which encompasses a wide range of departments and areas within the company such as platform, development, product management, and data. The Product Enablement Manager is responsible for bridging the gap between product development and various organizations across Skillable. Their primary focus is to empower teams with in-depth product knowledge, streamline documentation & communication, and enhance overall efficiency. **Responsibilities*** Create, maintain, and curate comprehensive product documentation for both existing and new products.
* Collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure accurate and up-to-date information.
* Develop a centralized repository for product-related content, including user guides, FAQs, release notes, and technical specifications.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams (product, engineering, marketing, support, customer success, sales, solutions engineering, etc.) to understand their specific needs.
* Conduct regular training sessions to enhance product awareness and understanding across the organization.
* Foster communication channels to facilitate knowledge sharing and collaboration.
* Identify opportunities to proactively share product documentation throughout the organization.
* Tailor content to meet the unique requirements of different teams (e.g., sales teams need concise, customer-facing information, while engineers may require technical details).
* Implement strategies to ensure that relevant teams have easy access to the right information at the right time.
* Gather feedback from various teams regarding the effectiveness of product documentation.
* Continuously improve content based on feedback, industry best practices, and evolving product features.
* Monitor adoption rates and adjust strategies as needed.
* Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to product enablement.
* Measure the impact of documentation on team productivity, customer satisfaction, and overall business success.
* Provide mentorship and coaching to more junior documentation team members
* General responsibilities that come with managing others including regular 1:1s, career development conversations, alignment and accountability to objectives and key results
* Support and promote the company values through positive interactions with both internal and external partners and customers on a regular basis.
* Other strategic business initiatives or special cross-functional project involvement as required.

**Requirements**


* Bachelor’s degree in Product Management, Operations, Management, or related field, or equivalent experience.
* 8+ years of experience in product management, technical writing, or enablement roles.
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Ability to distill complex technical information into clear, concise content.
* Familiarity with tools such as Confluence, SharePoint, or other knowledge management platforms.
* Experience working in a scaled SaaS product development lifecycle
* A collaborative mindset and the ability to work effectively with diverse teams.
* Experience managing other team members directly and indirectly
* Demonstrated ability to lead multidisciplinary teams and projects
* Ability and willingness to participate in multiple technical projects concurrently.
* Desire and ability to work at a fast pace.

**Salary Range**  

The base salary for this position is $102,000 - $160,000 annually. This range does not include at plan potential for commissions and/or quarterly upsides. This role is not eligible for Skillable’s corporate bonus plan. Consistent with applicable laws, compensation will be determined based on the candidate's level, relevant skills, qualifications, and experience along with requirements for the position and annual financial plans.  

Skillable is a distributed first team with employees working across the U.S., and we do not consider geography when determining compensation ranges.  

Please note that it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range. Skillable reserves the right to modify this compensation range at any time. **What’s in it for You? Rewards and Perks**  

We believe in providing a suite of benefits that ensure our employees know we appreciate them as people first. Skillable wants to be a company that promotes physical, emotional and all around well-being through our benefit offerings! Subject to eligibility requirements, the Company offers comprehensive benefits including:* Fully remote with a monthly stipend to pay for office services and supplies
* Medical (2 plan options), dental (2 plan options), vision, health savings account with generous employer contributions, healthcare spending accounts, dependent care spending accounts, EAP, group paid life insurance, group paid STD and LTD and voluntary life/AD&D insurance, accident and critical illness options.
* 401(k) with Company match, tuition reimbursement, healthy lifestyle reimbursements.
* Open PTO, Paid holidays, bereavement leave, parental leave, caregiver leave and paid FMLA leave.
* Friends and Family Friday to end our standard workweek at 2pm local time; Full company closure during the 4th of July holiday week.
* Access to pet insurance; Access for employees and dependents to Skillable learning opportunities through our product and more!

***Skillable can only hire potential candidates with a primary residence in the following States: AZ, CA, CO, FL, GA, ID, IN, KY, ME, MI, MO, NC, ND, NH, NV, NY, OH, OK, SC, TN, TX, UT, WA, WI.*** **Working Conditions**  

The conditions for this position are in a remote home office setting, requiring a space that supports privacy and focus to attend to regular and frequent video and voice calls. Employees in this position will use their computer or phone on an on-going basis throughout the day. Travel is anticipated up to 10% of the time for critical business meetings and industry events.

title: Product Manager
description:
```Overview```  
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Product Manager to join our team. As a Product Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the development and implementation of our product strategy. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the successful delivery of high-quality products that meet customer needs and drive business growth.

```Responsibilities```  
- Develop and execute product strategies and roadmaps  
- Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify customer needs and market trends  
- Collaborate with stakeholders to define product requirements and prioritize features  
- Work closely with engineering teams to ensure timely delivery of high-quality products  
- Define and track key product metrics to measure success  
- Conduct user testing and gather feedback to inform product improvements  
- Manage the product development lifecycle, including planning, execution, and launch  
- Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies

```Skills```  
- Strong analytical skills, with the ability to gather and interpret data to make informed decisions  
- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to effectively communicate complex ideas to technical and non-technical stakeholders  
- Proficiency in Excel for data analysis and reporting  
- Familiarity with HTML5 and software development principles  
- Knowledge of SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) methodologies  
- Experience in product management, including requirements gathering, prioritization, and roadmap planning  
- Understanding of the SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle)  
- Familiarity with IT infrastructure and systems  
- Leadership skills, with the ability to influence cross-functional teams and drive results

If you are a highly motivated individual with a passion for product management and a desire to make an impact, we would love to hear from you. Join our team today!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $92,176.23 - $111,007.94 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Bonus opportunities
* RSU
* Signing bonus
* Yearly pay

Experience level:

* 4 years

Experience:

* Product management: 3 years (Required)

Security clearance:

* Secret (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Sr. Product Manager
description:
**Who We Are**  

Angel Studios is the home of stories that amplify light. Through its platform, thousands of “Angel” investors choose which titles will be created, funded, and distributed. Angel Studios allows creators and audiences to form passionate communities around their creative projects, making the story behind the story as important as the final project itself. The studios’ first projects—The Chosen and Dry Bar Comedy—have earned billions of views around the world. Learn more at Angel.com  

We’re looking for passionate team members who want to build world-class products that will reshape media over the coming decades. Learn more about:
Our North Star
Company Strategy
Team Principles
Join us and be part of stories that matter. **Summary/objective:**  

Angel Studios is seeking a talented and experienced Sr. Product Manager to join our team. As the Product Manager, you will play a crucial role in owning and optimizing our in-house ticketing service, ensuring a seamless and premium experience for our global audience. Success in this role will be defined by your ability to streamline the ticket purchasing process, making it effortless for fans to access and enjoy Angel Studios' movies on the silver screen.
### **Expectations of Leaders at Angel Studios:**

* Amplify light in every action.
* As the owner of your outcomes, you are empowered to break down silos and coordinate with any and all people you need in order to reach your goals.
* You are ultimately responsible for achieving the outcomes while also using resources wisely - whether that be money, people, or time.
* Know your customer - it might be our viewers, investors, creators, or internal Angel Teams. Ensure you understand your customers and are providing what THEY need and not just what you want to build.

### **Essential functions**

* Own and oversee the development and optimization of Angel Studios' in-house ticketing service for theatrical releases.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, engineering, design, finance, and our many theatrical partners, to ensure successful execution of product initiatives.
* Define and prioritize product features and enhancements based on customer needs, market trends, and business objectives.
* Lead the end-to-end product development lifecycle, from ideation and requirements gathering to implementation, testing, and release.
* Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify opportunities for innovation and differentiation in the ticketing space.
* Develop and maintain a deep understanding of our audience, their preferences, and behaviors to inform product decisions and strategies.
* Monitor key performance metrics, track user feedback, and iterate on product features to continuously improve the ticketing experience.
* Manage stakeholder expectations and effectively communicate product updates, timelines, and outcomes.

 *Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.*### **Competencies**

* An exceptional listener with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Detail-oriented perspective and able to pick up on overlooked details.
* Organization and time management.
* Able to maintain confidentiality of information.
* Must be able to manage multiple assignments, set priorities, and adapt to changing conditions.
* Resourceful and able to problem-solve and manage tasks with ambiguity.
* Willing to perform an array of tasks both in and out of the office.
* Can take feedback to tasks and assignments positively and create better solutions.
* A quick study, able to pick up new skills and learn how to use new programs.
* Must participate in setting and achieving regularly scheduled and outlined objectives.
* Self-driven and highly motivated to deliver best-in-class solutions with minimal guidance.
* Recognize when you're wrong, learning from your mistakes and moving past them.
* You have a good balance of technical depth and business savvy and can command respect from both engineers and business leaders.
* You have the tenacity and leadership experience to help you influence, lead, and organize complex projects.
* Expertise in the product or market including specific technical or industry knowledge.
* Ability to take individual ownership, execute with high energy, share context, insist on candor with positive intent.

### **Required education and experience**

* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent
* 5+ years experience in product management
* Ability to incorporate data, research, and market analysis to inform product strategies and roadmaps
* Experience with A/B testing and product experimentation.

### **Preferred education and experience**

* Bachelor’s Degree in a business-related field
* 2+ years experience as a software engineer
* Experience bringing a new product to market


Commensurate with experience and scope of responsibilities**Other duties:**  

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the team member for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. **Perks at Angel:*** Competitive compensation
* Stock Option equity package
* 100% company-paid medical, dental, and vision premiums for employees **and** dependents
* Short, and Long Term Disability Insurance paid for employee, with option of additional AD&D insurance
* Generous Paid Time Off
* Health Spending Account (HSA)
* 401(k) investment opportunity with employer match
* Paid parental leave

 **Other duties**  

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the team member for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. **Angel is an Equal Opportunity Employer:**  

At Angel Studios, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates.

title: Dot Product Owner
description:
**COMPANY SUMMARY:**
  

Marketing.com brings together people from diverse personal and professional backgrounds to create a technology-centered, people-powered culture that is constantly evolving and redefining how marketing is done. Our team members bring to work a combined history of dedication, service and being the best at what they do—everyday. With over 30 production facilities in the US and Canada (and growing!), we provide comprehensive digital marketing services, commercial printing, warehousing & fulfillment, direct mail marketing, sign manufacturing & fabrication, and promotional products.
  

We are expanding at warp speed and are adding to our team – from our sales office and shop floor locations to our remote online team members. We are a diverse, creative, and passionate crew who is always looking to discover and implement fresh, innovative ideas and make some pretty amazing things.
**JOB SUMMARY:**
We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Product Owner to join our team and lead the development and scaling of Dot™. As the steward of the product, you will play a critical role in bridging the gap between our visionary ideas and the technical execution to deliver an unparalleled tool that meets the evolving needs of our clients.  


**ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**
* Define and prioritize the product backlog, ensuring that the team is working on features that maximize business value and deliver necessary functionality to our clients.
* Translate business requirements into user stories for the development teams, clarifying any ambiguity and ensuring that deliverables meet our high standards.
* Act as the primary liaison between stakeholders and the development team, maintaining clear communication and ensuring that the product vision is understood and implemented correctly.
* Continuously assess the market and our competition to ensure Dot™ stays ahead of the curve, incorporating feedback from customers, sales, and marketing teams to iterate and improve the product.
* Oversee product releases and manage expectations for delivery of new functionalities, taking responsibility for the product’s success from conception to launch and beyond.
* Foster an agile, collaborative environment, encouraging feedback and innovative thinking among the development team to solve complex problems.


**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:**
* Proven experience as a Product Owner or similar role in product management, preferably in the software or technology sector.
* Strong understanding of agile methodologies, with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Exceptional leadership and communication skills, capable of motivating and guiding a team towards achieving the product vision.
* Deep understanding of marketing strategies, tools, and platforms, with a passion for driving innovation in the marketing domain.
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, evolving environment, managing multiple priorities with attention to detail.

  


*Our Company offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package including but not limited to medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short & long-term disability, 401k, PTO, and Company-paid holidays.*
*We’re an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.*

title: Senior Product Manager, People Product
description:
**About the team**
------------------


Join a dynamic team of product managers that deliver everything from large-scale technology solutions to small optimizations for employees at Zillow. The team is responsible for developing long-range product roadmaps and engaging in backlog grooming for the upcoming 2-week sprint. We work in lock-step with our engineering partners to deliver a portfolio of technology solutions that include a wide range of 3rd party SaaS products and custom developed applications to support the employee experience at Zillow.**About the role**
------------------


We are seeking an experienced product manager to drive the end-to-end product execution and vision for Zillow’s enterprise solutions that employees use each day. This role will be responsible for dreaming big about the employee experience, driving changes and recommendations to improve the digital workplace. In a remote world the ability to operate effectively and efficiently becomes even more critical, and this role will focus on how we can evolve and launch technology to support that.


This role will be responsible for identifying opportunities and improvements to currently launched ServiceNow (help support platform) and Unily (intranet) functionality as well as evaluating and proposing new features and initiatives based on stakeholder priorities. You will get the opportunity to develop a deep understanding of your customer’s process and needs, while keeping a pulse on the broader company strategy and objectives. Collaboration is a key ingredient for success, you must be able to recognize key dependencies across different teams in order to coordinate a successful product launch. You will provide product consultancy and recommendations to your business partners, helping them to better understand trade-offs, interoperability, and maintenance costs, enabling them to select the right solution that will help them meet their business objectives.


This role will work alongside other Product Managers, HR leaders, IT leaders and subject matter experts in supporting Zillow employee programs by delivering solutions that enable our processes and systems to operate at scale.

*Primary responsibilities include:*

* Collaborate with key partners in IT and Shared Services (Finance, HR, Risk, Legal, People Analytics, Compliance, Workplace Services and Core Technology) to articulate functional requirements into strategic product visions
* Review and assess incoming requests for small enhancements and collaborate with stakeholders to prioritize and categorize requests based on business impact and urgency
* Lead Zillow’s roadmap related to ServiceNow and Unily enhancements, including reprioritization as required due to changing priorities or business needs
* Partner with a variety of engineering teams internally, including leading a small scrum team in an agile environment
* Identify opportunities for ways to improve routines in place today by reducing manual steps and improving the employee experience
* Collect and analyze quantitative cycle time data and qualitative user feedback information to define opportunity size and understand root cause of issues, that guide product planning and prioritization
* Recommend product features and technical improvements, specifically focused on how Zillow can continue to better leverage & enhance the Workday experience
* Responsible for launching new product features and experiences - diving deep to define the problem, draft detailed requirements/user stories, plan development sprints, create and execute user testing plan, and support continuous releases
* Manage a broad group of key stakeholders and senior leaders - communicate progress and findings to program leaders and other key partners, via product briefs, status updates, and demos
* Establish success metrics and ensure performance of products ensuring easy adoption and interoperability across the lines of business


This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.
In California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington the standard base pay range for this role is $143,200.00 - $228,800.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington and may not be applicable to other locations.
In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.**Who you are**
---------------

* 4+ years as a Product Manager with direct product ownership, operating in an Agile development environment - experience working directly with internal and external technology analysts and developers
* 1-2 years experience executing product development within ServiceNow
* 1-2 years experience in Unily or an equivalent platform
* Proven track record leading cross-functional teams, delivering quality work on time, must be conversant in UX design, technology and data analysis
* Examples of end-to-end project management and technical implementation of new products or features, including discovery, requirement gathering, planning, prioritization, stakeholder management, user testing, launch execution and measuring impact of launches
* Experience working with SasS applications and 3rd party vendor relationship management and implementation of new 3rd party tools related to knowledge management, virtual agents, task automation and enterprise search
* Workday and JIRA experience a plus
* Excellent decision-making skills and experience guiding prioritization of work; ability to make trade-off decisions to meet customer needs and technology constraints

**Get to know us**
------------------


Zillow is reimagining real estate to make home a reality for more and more people.


As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates help movers find and win their home through digital solutions, first class partners, and easier buying, selling, financing and renting experiences. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move. The work we do helps people get home and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making home a reality for more and more people.


Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverages as well as parental leave, family benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off. We’re also setting the standard for work experiences of the future, where our employees are supported in doing their best work and living a flexible, well-balanced life. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: the 100 Best Companies to Work For, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, and TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list.

*Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.*

*Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.*

title: Associate Product Manager
description:
**About LeafLink**
------------------



LeafLink is the largest unified B2B cannabis platform, providing licensed cannabis businesses a suite of tools to manage their business more effectively, sell or order from their favorite brands and accelerate growth. We are one platform, one solution and we're defining the way thousands of cannabis brands, distributors and retailers streamline their operations. With thousands of brands and retailers across 30+ markets in North America, we are setting the industry standard for how cannabis businesses grow together. LeafLink processes more than $4.4 billion in wholesale cannabis orders annually.



Our team, backed by funding from leading VC's, including Founders Fund, Thrive Capital, Nosara Capital, and Lerer Hippeau is poised to define the cannabis supply chain through technology. LeafLink was named one of Inc. 5000's 'Top 5000 Fastest-Growing Private Companies', one of Built In NYC's 'Best Places to Work in 2021', as well as one of Fast Company's 'Top 10 Most Innovative Companies in Enterprise for 2020', joining the ranks of Amazon, Slack, and VMWare - and we're just getting started!

**The Role**
------------



We are looking for a growing associate product manager to join LeafLink's product organization early in their career. As a LeafLink Product Manager, you will work closely with experienced product managers to refine your product management skills, while owning your portion of the LeafLink platform.



You will work closely with product designers, engineers, stakeholders, and others to build and launch various experiences, capabilities, and features for LeafLink customers. You will also support sprint planning, roadmap constructions, retrospectives, and maintaining a backlog of ready-to-go stories, tasks, and bugs.


**What You'll Be Doing**
------------------------


* Contribute to and support the planning, prioritization, and implementation of various functionality and capabilities for LeafLink's cannabis platform
* Work closely with various LeafLink teams and customer feedback to identify areas to improve the user experience
* Write user stories, organize bugs, and review UX/UI designs in close coordination with the development team and product teammates
* Own and maintain a prioritized product backlog and collaborate daily with our engineering team to execute
* Act as the point person for escalation and resolution during the product lifecycle as it relates to bugs and enhancements within your scope
* Determine and provide a necessary level of documentation as well as work with other teams to produce sales and marketing collateral
* Track product KPIs and analyze user data to evaluate adoption
* Oversee sprints, retrospects, and similar Agile-based ceremonies
* Stay informed and ahead of industry trends, advancements, and competitor capabilities

**What You'll Bring to the Team**
---------------------------------


* Inspired by LeafLink's vision, mission, and value system we are committed to driving us toward these pursuits daily.
* At least two years in a product-focused role for an e-commerce, enterprise, or SaaS software product.
* Passionate about delighting users by creating a wonderful experience
* Customer-centric orientation with experience developing and acting on customer insights
* Ability to define opportunities and problems, collect and analyze data, establish facts, and make valid conclusions
* Ability to work effectively both in a team environment and independently
* Proven experience communicating effectively across roles and teams
* Prior startup experience is a plus
* Prior Agile software development experience is a plus

**LeafLink Perks & Benefits**
-----------------------------


* **Flexible PTO** - you're going to be working hard so enjoy time off with no cap!
* A robust **stock option plan** to give our employees a direct stake in LeafLink's success
* **5 Days of Volunteer Time Off (VTO)** - giving back is important to us and we want our employees to prioritize cultivating a better community
* **Competitive compensation** and **401k**
* Comprehensive **health** **coverage** (medical, dental, vision)
* **Commuter Benefits** through our Flexible Spending Account


*LeafLink's employee-centric culture has earned us a coveted spot on**BuiltInNYC's Best Places to Work for in 2021 list.* *Learn more about LeafLink's history and the path to our First Billion in Wholesale Cannabis Orders**here**.*

**Base salary range**


$75,000—$100,000 USD

title: Senior Product Manager, Follow Up Boss
description:
**About the team**
------------------


At Follow-Up Boss, we're on a mission to help real estate businesses convert more of their leads into deals. We believe in crafting simple, effective, and high-quality tools that make our customers' lives easier and their businesses more profitable. Our team is fully remote, and we pride ourselves on our collaborative, supportive, and customer-centric approach. We are guided by our core values of teamwork, communication, code quality, focus and prioritization, and customer-driven innovation.**About the role**
------------------


Looking for an opportunity to redefine real estate? We are seeking a Senior Product Manager who is passionate about solving customer (internal and external) problems and building impactful solutions. If you know what's needed to make your features successful, understand the big picture, and are able to achieve, come join us! In this role, you will:

* Deliver impact and results by defining success metrics, analyzing data for insights, prioritizing what to build, and coordinating with partner teams to align efforts to business strategies
* Communicate and collaborate by articulating the “why” and "what" customer problem to solve, partnering with others, and balancing their point of view with solicited input of others
* Actively participate in engineering discussions with Software Development Engineers, Designers and other stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into technical requirements.
* Inform strategy by monitoring competitors, understanding customer needs and technical designs of products to serve them
* Mobilize your teams to do their best work by providing clear direction, handling dependencies, removing blockers and applying effective operating rhythms


This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.
In California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington the standard base pay range for this role is $143,200.00 - $228,800.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington and may not be applicable to other locations.
In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.**Who you are**
---------------

* 5+ years of product management experience, with proven track record to lead and launch products at scale, with experience working with millions of customers across various communications channels such as emails, mobile push, SMS, etc.
* Proactively defines feature goals, objectives and metrics, and sets priorities for the team
* Ushers features through development and launch, iterations, and optimizations
* Experience with experimentation & hypothesis development
* Exceptional stakeholder management experience and maintains strong relationships by involving the right people at the right time throughout the development process
* Communicates and documents at the appropriate level of detail in a timely manner
* Clearly articulates customer needs, understands designs of features to advise development, and evaluates how the feature is meeting the needs of the customer and the business to make feature decisions
* We value the experience and perspective of candidates with non-traditional backgrounds. We encourage you to apply if you have transferable skills or related experiences.

**Get to know us**
------------------


Zillow is reimagining real estate to make home a reality for more and more people.


As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates help movers find and win their home through digital solutions, first class partners, and easier buying, selling, financing and renting experiences. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move. The work we do helps people get home and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making home a reality for more and more people.


Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverages as well as parental leave, family benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off. We’re also setting the standard for work experiences of the future, where our employees are supported in doing their best work and living a flexible, well-balanced life. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: the 100 Best Companies to Work For, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, and TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list.

*Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.*

If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.*

title: Product Manager
description:
### **Company Overview**



Casetext, Part of Thomson Reuters, is a fast-growing legal technology company tackling the $6 billion U.S. legal research market and advancing the cause of justice by empowering all attorneys to provide high-quality, efficient, and affordable representation to their clients. Our award winning research platform helps millions of users access and understand the law every month, and our AI-powered search tools are at the cutting edge of search technology.


### **About the Role**



Casetext is looking for a Product Manager to join its CoCounsel team. CoCounsel, built on GPT 4, is the first true AI based legal assistant for attorneys. It automates multiple time-consuming tasks attorneys perform regularly. It is flexible and powerful enough to be used by both solo practitioners and attorney at AM Law 200 firms. It was launched on March 1st, 2023 and in its first month it generated multi-million dollars in ARR.



CoCounsel is organized into skills. Each skill helps attorneys perform a specific task. As a Product Manager, you will own a number of skills end-to-end. You will work with Designers, Application Engineers and Prompting Engineers to build and iterate on skills. You will be responsible for adoption, engagement and financial success of your skills, making this an ideal role for those who are seeking meaningful product ownership.



Our ideal candidate has a legal background, 2-5 years of product management experience, and is equally at ease with analyzing data and talking to users to gather insights.This role is entirely remote, but **you must be based in the U.S. and authorized to work in the U.S.**


### **As the Product Manager You Will:**


* Analyze usage of portfolio skills
* Gather user insights about portfolio skills through user interviews
* Work with design, engineering and other stakeholders to improve usage of portfolio skills

### **About You:**


* JD is ideal, but legal experience through other methods works as well
* 2-5 years of product management experience
* Able to analyze data and communicate with users to gather insights with ease, efficiency & comfortability
* Have knowledge of basic UX patterns and the ability to work with a Designer is required
* Have curiosity and interest in leaning more about generative AI
* Are dedicated to making users successful
* Have the ability to collaboratively work with Engineers and Designers


**Salary Range: $115,000-$155,000, total compensation**


*As listed above, the salary range for this role's listed level is currently $115,000-$155,000. Compensation is determined through interviews and a review of education, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities of the applicant, equity with other team members, and alignment with market data and geographic location. This role is also eligible for Thomson Reuter's Annual Incentive Plan as a part of our total compensation strategy. This role is 100% remote, but you must be a resident of the U.S. The salary range listed is for U.S. residents only.*


### **Benefits**


* Competitive Salary
* Medical, Dental & Vision
* 401k plus match
* ESPP (Employee Stock Purchase Plan)
* Generous Parental Leave
* Unlimited PTO
* Wellness Benefits
* 529 College Savings Plan
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Annual Incentive Bonus Plan (eligible for roles without commission structure)
* ...And more!


*As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.*

title: Principal Product Manager, Follow Up Boss
description:
**About the team**
------------------


At Follow-Up Boss, we're on a mission to help real estate businesses convert more of their leads into deals. We believe in crafting simple, effective, and high-quality tools that make our customers' lives easier and their businesses more profitable. Our team is fully remote, and we pride ourselves on our collaborative, supportive, and customer-centric approach. We are guided by our core values of teamwork, communication, code quality, focus and prioritization, and customer-driven innovation.**About the role**
------------------


Looking for an opportunity to redefine real estate? We are seeking a Principal Product Manager who is passionate about solving customer (internal and external) problems and building impactful solutions. If you know what's needed to make your features successful, understand the big picture, and are able to achieve, come join us! In this role, you will:

* Deliver impact and results by defining success metrics, analyzing data for insights, prioritizing what to build, and coordinating with partner teams to align efforts to business strategies
* Communicate and collaborate by articulating the “why” and "what" customer problem to solve, partnering with others, and balancing their point of view with solicited input of others
* Actively participate in engineering discussions with Software Development Engineers, Designers and other stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into technical requirements.
* Inform strategy by monitoring competitors, understanding customer needs and technical designs of products to serve them
* Mobilize your teams to do their best work by providing clear direction, handling dependencies, removing blockers and applying effective operating rhythms


This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.
In California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington the standard base pay range for this role is $170,200.00 - $271,800.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington and may not be applicable to other locations.
In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.**Who you are**
---------------

* 7+ years proven ability in a product management role, with a focus on building technology products
* Strong experience with both iOS and Android applications
* Proactively defines feature goals, objectives and metrics, and sets priorities for the team
* Ushers features through development and launch, iterations, and optimizations
* Experience with experimentation & hypothesis development
* Exceptional stakeholder management experience and maintains strong relationships by involving the right people at the right time throughout the development process
* Communicates and documents at the appropriate level of detail in a timely manner
* Clearly articulates customer needs, understands designs of features to advise development, and evaluates how the feature is meeting the needs of the customer and the business to make feature decisions
* We value the experience and perspective of candidates with non-traditional backgrounds. We encourage you to apply if you have transferable skills or related experiences.

**Get to know us**
------------------


Zillow is reimagining real estate to make home a reality for more and more people.


As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates help movers find and win their home through digital solutions, first class partners, and easier buying, selling, financing and renting experiences. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move. The work we do helps people get home and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making home a reality for more and more people.


Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverages as well as parental leave, family benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off. We’re also setting the standard for work experiences of the future, where our employees are supported in doing their best work and living a flexible, well-balanced life. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: the 100 Best Companies to Work For, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, and TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list.

*Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.*

*Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.*

title: Product Manager
Product Manager, Integrations
description:
Restaurant365 is a SaaS company disrupting the restaurant industry! Our cloud-based platform provides a unique, centralized solution for accounting and back-office operations for restaurants. Restaurant365’s culture is focused on empowering team members to produce top-notch results while elevating their skills. We’re constantly evolving and improving to make sure we are and always will be “Best in Class” ... and we want that for you too!  

As the Integrations Product Manager, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and executing our integration strategy. You will collaborate with other product managers and cross-functional teams, including Engineering, Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success, to identify, prioritize, and implement integrations that align with the R365 product roadmap and customer needs.
### **How you'll add value:**

+ Own product efforts for the new Enterprise-focused Integrations squad, from ideation to implementation
+ Thrive in a fast-paced, flexible work environment where you’ll have the opportunity to lead the creation of new product components for a successful SaaS platform
+ Select, design, and write user stories for the Integrations Scrum Team
+ Work closely with Engineering teams to define usage metrics, technical requirements, and specifications for seamless integrations
+ Evaluate and prioritize features, bugs, and program debt according to importance and impact
+ Drive, develop and maintain the R365 Integrations Roadmap
+ Collaborate with other teams to plan, design, and deliver products that bring value to our users
+ Partner with other Product Managers on the Platform & Integrations team to prioritize and define the most impactful enhancements needed to fortify and enhance our existing integrations.
+ Communicate and present product information at company events
+ Conduct customer interviews
+ Curate ideas and user feedback to inform the product roadmap and strategy
+ Work with the Customer Success (CS) and Go to Market (GTM) teams to strategize how new capabilities will be rolled out to both prospects and internal customers
+ Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for integrations, including usage metrics, user guides, release notes, and technical documentation
+ Develop a deep understanding of the market and what data points drive successful restaurant businesses
+ Receive constructive feedback with grace, using it to iterate and improve

### **What you'll need to be successful in this role:**

+ 3+ years of experience in product management integration roles in a SaaS environment, with a track record of creating and growing integrated products through the prioritization, design, development, and roll-out phases
+ A solid demonstrated understanding of integration business and technology fundamentals, with strong analytical and business problem solving skills
+ Demonstrated Agile Methodology experience, ideally at scale
+ Proven ability to work successfully with cross functional stakeholders
+ Excellent oral and written communication skills
**Preferred Skills**+ Experience working in the restaurant industry
+ Product Management experience with Back-of-House Restaurant Software (integrations, reports, analytics, accounting, invoicing, workforce management), ideally in the Enterprise space

### **R365 Team Member Benefits & Compensation**

+ This position has a salary range of $100K-$135K. The above range represents the expected salary range for this position. The actual salary may vary based upon several factors, including, but not limited to, relevant skills/experience, time in the role, business line, and geographic location. Restaurant365 focuses on equitable pay for our team and aims for transparency with our pay practices.
+ Comprehensive medical benefits, 100% paid for employee
+ 401k + matching
+ Equity Option Grant
+ Unlimited PTO + Company holidays
+ Wellness initiatives
  

#BI-Remote
$100,000 - $130,000 a year
R365 is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we encourage all forward-thinkers who embrace change and possess a positive attitude to apply.

title: Junior Product Manager
description:
**About us**

We are agile and innovative.

Our work environment includes:

* Modern office setting
* Food provided
* Wellness programs
* Growth opportunities

Responsibilities: - Collaborate with senior product managers to define product vision and strategy - Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify customer needs and market trends - Assist in creating product roadmaps and prioritizing features based on business goals and user feedback - Work closely with cross-functional teams including engineering, design, and marketing to ensure successful product launches - Gather and analyze user data to inform product decisions and drive continuous improvement - Assist in defining user stories, acceptance criteria, and wireframes for new features - Support the development team throughout the software development lifecycle, including testing and quality assurance - Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to evaluate product success and identify areas for improvement Skills: - Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze complex data sets - Proficiency in Excel or other data analysis tools - Knowledge of software development methodologies, particularly Agile - Experience with project management software for tracking tasks and timelines - Familiarity with databases and data management principles - Ability to create wireframes or mockups to visualize product features - Understanding of internet technologies and trends, including Internet of Things (IoT) - Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal - Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills Please note that this is a junior-level position, so we are looking for candidates who are eager to learn and grow in their product management career. If you are passionate about technology, have a strong analytical mindset, and enjoy working in a collaborative environment, we encourage you to apply.
