title: Junior Product Manager
description:
(This is a REMOTE Role)


WATCH THIS VIDEO (https://www.loom.com/share/220c0c5cefe14db2b02c6f0f0e9b5627?sid=9727f1a4-81c2-4590-b2eb-25cab734ef29)


Are you a Product Manager looking to make an impact by joining a healthcare tech startup that is disrupting the broken healthcare system?


If so, we have a role for you!


**We're looking for a hungry, “I want to build products that make a massive difference” type of person.** You are user-focused, think in terms of key performance indicators (KPIs), and love bringing simplicity and elegance to complex problems. You thrive in a fast-growth startup environment and can swim through feedback and user interviews to uncover hidden gems.


As a Product Manager, help develop our software that generates patients for our customers. You will be responsible for driving product design, implementing tracking metrics, creating the product roadmap and working closely with the engineering team to implement the product.


This role is for you if you:


* Have loads of grit. You never hesitate to roll up your sleeves and pursue something hands-on, you persevere when others fall away.
* Lead with empathy. You work backwards from a customer problem to find the real solutions our customers need.
* Decide with data. You are an analytical problem solver, driven by data.


Breakthrough and our community of pioneering Physical Therapy private practice owners are united by the purpose of helping people in pain get back to normal naturally through Physical Therapy and other natural solutions instead of unnecessary pain medication or surgery.


Breakthrough is the leader in business growth for Physical Therapy private practices through marketing services and business coaching. Our clients have an average annual practice growth rate of 33%. Every month, our system drives over 10,000 direct access patients into our member practices.


Our people are the heart and soul of our success. We are passionate, dedicated, and driven. Our teammates have the grit to get things done in ambiguous environments, the teamwork drive to put the team ahead of self, and the desire to continue to learn and grow throughout their careers.


If you are passionate about helping people get back to health naturally, and you love to work for a driven company, we want to talk to you!


**What you'll do:**


* You will own our product research by conducting thorough customer interviews to gather insights and generate innovative ideas. You will evaluate features based on value metrics and collaborate on prioritization. You will develop feedback systems and maintain the product roadmap.
* You will own product requirements by creating detailed epics and user stories, refining wireframes with team and customer feedback. You will work closely with engineering to translate requirements and stay ahead of sprint cycles.
* You will facilitate the scrum process. You will serve as product owner and scrum master, leading sprint activities and release planning. You will ensure timely delivery and clear communication with stakeholders.
* You will own quality assurance by defining test criteria and managing bug tracking across departments. You will conduct tests and prioritize fixes efficiently.
* You will increase product adoption and customer value by promoting feature value internally and externally, execute rollout plans, optimize features through customer feedback, and measure outcomes for continuous improvement.


**What we're looking for:**


* Proven ability to work cross-functionally in a highly collaborative environment
* Attention to detail and comfort solving ambiguous product problems
* Deep understanding of software development and how to use analytics to improve products.
* Proficient in defining well thought out user stories, with thorough acceptance criteria and use cases.
* Excellent communication skills and ability to drive alignment among multiple stakeholders


**Why Breakthrough**


You will be part of a transformative company. Our mission is to help people in pain get back to normal naturally (instead of overusing pharmaceuticals or getting unnecessary surgery).


**Other Awesome Benefits About This Opportunity**


* Completely virtual. We don't have an office (and never have). We care about your results and impact on the business and want our team to live and work wherever they want.
* We have an amazing team of incredibly driven people who are constantly learning, growing, and encouraging one another.
* Amazing benefits, including healthcare, matching 401K, and shares in our employee stock ownership trust.
* Work life balance environment - we care that you are personally and professionally taken care of.


**Our Values = Your Values:**


This is for you only if you align with our values:


Elevate Others


Be Real


Beginners' Mind


Own The Results


Up for the Challenge


Driven


Seeks to Understand the Customer First

title: Product Manager
description:
**The Role**: You will be accountable for the origination, research, analysis, solution design, documentation and implementation of new projects related to the platform or solution assigned to you. You will partner with operations and technology colleagues to complete tasks, but will ultimately be responsible for the success of product improvement initiatives.
**As a Product Manager, you will:**
* Own a product or portion of the product from end to end: idea generation, solution design, testing, implementation and tracking success metrics.
* Be the leading expert in the product or product segment which are you are working on, which includes understanding detailed industry, client, operations and technical requirements and metrics.
* Prioritize and maintain the backlog for assigned products, based on changing requirements and in line with organization's vision and goals and in partnership with other stakeholders. Translate current and future initiatives into financial and budget formats, including estimated financial impact, timeline and staffing.
* Write detailed solution design and functional requirement documentation for product features that are clearly understood by development teams. Further, track and manage the completion of improvement initiatives and maintain an organized project plan. Ultimately you are the owner of the incremental value delivered for the product.
* Utilize strong analytical skills to research proposed product initiatives, perform POC/data studies which drive deeper understanding and create/design reports which track outcomes. All product initiatives should be paired with metrics/KPIs which clearly articulate financial impact to the organization. If necessary, work with Data Analysts to generate data to conduct analysis, but own full analysis and business conclusions.
* Collaborate with users and clients to maintain expert-level understanding of the product and ways in which it can be improved, including creating ongoing feedback loops for updates/new information.
* Have other duties as assigned.

  

**You will be successful if you have:**
* A BA/BS degree in a related field and a minimum of 3 years of related experience in a data intensive product role; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
* Excellent analytical, reporting and data analysis/visualization skills (SQL required).
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required. The ability to tailor your message to your audience is a must.
* The ability to work with cross-functional teams productively is required. Tactfully working through competing product priorities is critical.
* A high degree of organization, individual initiative, and personal accountability.
* Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks effectively.
* A successful track record of developing products within deadlines.
* Strong decision making and problem-solving skills.
* Creative and innovative thinking.
* Revenue cycle experience preferred.
* Working knowledge of 837 files, 835 files and HIS data preferred.
* 2 - 4 years of experience as Product Manager in a data intensive product role.
* Working knowledge of the healthcare denials process would be nice to have


**Why Join Revecore?**
* Flexible work location
* Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance benefits are available from the first day of employment
* 401(k) with employer match after 90 days
* Generous PTO plan
* 12 paid holidays
* All computer and necessary hardware are provided to you

title: Product Owner, HR Technology (Remote)
description:
**Company Description**  

The Product Owner for HR Technology will translate product strategies within HR into feasible, desirable, and inclusive experiences. This position will collaborate with internal and external partners, developers, product teams and several key stakeholders supporting the full product lifecycle from concept to delivery.

  



**What Will You Be Doing?**

* Leading the end-to-end execution of product development, ensuring deliverables are met on time and within scope.
* Crafting, maintaining, and fine-tuning detailed epics, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
* Managing the product backlog to ensure alignment with our overarching product vision and strategy.
* Working closely with stakeholders to understand and anticipate their needs and translate them into product requirements.
* Participating in Scrum ceremonies including daily standups, sprint planning, sprint review, sprint retrospectives, and backlog refinement.
* Managing product release plan and coordinating with relevant teams to ensure smooth rollout and minimal disruption.
* Developing user-friendly release notes for each product update, highlighting new features, improvements, and fixes.
* Proactively resolving challenges that arise throughout the product development process.
* Monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure product success.

**What Do You Need To Bring?**

* Bachelor’s degree and 2+ years of relevant experience, or a combination of relevant education/experience.
* Outstanding people, communication, and negotiation skills.
* Strong understanding of Agile methodologies, particularly Scrum and Kanban.
* Organized, collaborative, and persistent, with the ability to prioritize and balance multiple initiatives and stakeholders.
* Proficiency in transforming complex scenarios into clear, understandable contexts.
* Knowledge of user-centric design principles.

**Our Company**


Abercrombie & Fitch Co. (A&F Co.) is a global retailer of five iconic, omnichannel lifestyle brands catering to the kid through millennial customer: Abercrombie & Fitch, abercrombie kids, Hollister, Gilly Hicks and Social Tourist. At A&F Co., we’re here for our associates, customers and communities on the journey to being and becoming who they are – and because no journey is the same, we strive to create an inclusive culture, where everyone is free to share ideas.

**Our Values**


We lead with purpose and always put our people first, which is evidenced by our Great Place to Work™ Certification, as well as being a 2021 recipient of Fortune’s Best Workplaces in Retail, and named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign for 16 consecutive years. We’re proud to offer equitable compensation and benefits, including flexibility and competitive Paid Time Off, as well as education and engagement events, including various Associate Resource Groups, volunteer opportunities and additional time off to give back to our global communities.

**What You'll Get**


As an Abercrombie & Fitch Co. (A&F Co.) associate, you’ll be eligible to participate in a variety of benefit programs designed to fit you and your lifestyle. A&F is committed to providing simple, competitive, and comprehensive benefits that align with our Company’s culture and values, but most importantly – with you! We also provide competitive incentives to reward the commitment our associates have for moving our global business forward:

* Incentive Bonus Program
* Paid Time Off and Work From Anywhere Flexibility
* Paid Volunteer Day per Year, allowing you to give back to your community
* Merchandise Discount
* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Available
* Life and Disability Insurance
* Associate Assistance Program
* Paid Parental and Adoption Leave
* Access to Carrot to support your unique parenthood journey
* Access to Headspace dedicated to creating healthier, happier lives from the inside out
* 401(K) Savings Plan with Company Match
* Opportunities for Career Advancement, we believe in promoting from within
* A Global Team of People Who'll Celebrate you for Being YOU

  

**Additional Information**  

ABERCROMBIE & FITCH CO. IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

*Notice (For Colorado, New York, California and Washington): The recruiting pay range for this position is $98,000 - $117,000. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary may include your specific skills, your years of experience, your work location, comparison to other employees in similar or related roles, or market demands. The range may be modified in the future.*

title: Product Manager/Analyst
description:
**Job Title:**Product Manager or Product Analyst (Depends on Experience)  

**Department:**Donation- Transplant
  

**Reporting to:**Director of Product
  

  

**Location:**Remote in the continental USA.
  

  

**Hours of work:** Typical hours of work are from 8:30 AM until 5:00 PM Monday through Friday. Additional hours may be necessary as needed. This position is exempt from overtime.  

  

**Compensation:** Depends on Experience  

  

**Who we are****:** InVita develops specialized software for regulated industries that support the advancement of public health and safety. We are the acknowledged leader in the markets we serve. Our subject matter expertise is unmatched in the industry and our products are used by public health and medical professionals across the globe. We have employees spanning across the US and two main offices (Baltimore & Los Angeles).
  

  

**Overview****:** ***Provide cutting-edge software solutions to save more lives through the miracle of transplantation***: that’s our goal here.
  

And as the world’s leading provider of human biologics (organ, tissue, eye, birth tissue, etc.) donation and transplantation software, we’re incredibly proud that our modern, web-based solutions have already enabled millions of lives to be saved and healed around the globe.
  

  

It’s an exciting time for us. We not only have a steady and continually growing stream of new partners adopting use of our award-winning, secure cloud-based**iTransplant**SM Platform, but we remain tireless in our journey to continually evolve and expand our portfolio of products - including the build-out of entirely new revolutionary clinical solutions to transform and improve this key space.
  

Which is why we need visionary and talented people like you.  

  

You’re likely a good fit here if:* **You prioritize Purpose (and Challenge and Autonomy) in your Career**: You’re ready and willing to work extremely hard - but need it to be for a great and worthwhile cause.
* **Building Product is your bread-and-butter**: Transforming a customer’s “*wouldn’t it be nice if …”* into a clear and executable product vision and set of software requirements for a talented Dev and QA team – and then getting the product successfully deployed - is what you do.
* **You are a Natural Leader and Team Player:** You don’t need formal authority to successfully rally cross-functional teams around a well-communicated goal and plan. You don’t need the winning idea to be your idea – you need it to be the best idea. You raise teammates up with both praise and effectively communicated feedback for improvement, while holding yourself accountable for team missteps.
* **You are a Problem Solver:** The bigger the problem and challenge, the more you want to solve it. You enjoy thinking creatively and critically to navigate ambiguity, identify root issues, and formulate clear action plans and solutions.


* **You’re Savvy to our Space:** You don’t need Google to know the definitions of EHR/EMR, HL7, FHIR, ICD10, UML, or JAD; that MoSCoW isn’t just the capital of Russia; that Scrum and MVP aren’t just sports references; and that LEAN isn’t a new diet fad. You cringe when you see references to “HIPPA”. And you can successfully administer the 5 Whys technique without being too annoying.
* **You enjoy occasional Travel:** You enjoy face-to-face time, know the value of Clear and TSA Pre, and (whenever possible) usually carry-on to hit the ground running.

  

**Who****:** InVita is looking for visionary and talented people to join our Donation-Transplant team. As a Product Manager or Product Analyst (DOE), you will:
* Effectively collaborate directly with clinical users, teammates in the product team, software engineers, and QA analysts to design and launch best-in-class SaaS solutions to streamline workflows, reduce errors, and transform processes in the critical space of human biologics (organ, tissue, eye, placenta, other) donation and transplantation.
* Operate in a fast-paced, nimble environment to simultaneously manage projects, plan product roadmaps, produce CCCCT (correct, comprehensive, concise, consistent, and testable) software specifications and end-user materials, launch new Systems, ensure Partner success with our products, and support unique growth initiatives.
* Perform occasional domestic and international business travel to the company offices, partner sites, prospective partner sites, and industry conferences.

  

**Qualifications:*** BA/BS in an Information Systems, Computer Science or related technical field, OR a BA/BS in a medical or clinical field.
* Minimum of 2 years' relevant work experience as a Software Product Manager or Business Analyst leading projects and teams, AND/OR in a leadership role with expertise configuring and using EMR/EHR or other clinical workflow System(s).
* Hands-on experience in business analysis, workflow engineering, and software product management.
* Extensive background producing user stories, documented workflows, software requirements, UML diagrams, and high/mid/low-fidelity wireframes and prototypes.
* Strong attention to detail, with emphasis on focus and organization.
* Entrepreneurial drive and ability to excel in a fast-paced, team-based, and agile-oriented environment.
* Excellent client-facing presence, interpersonal skills, and written + spoken communication skills.
* Proficient with standard MS Office suite (Excel, PowerPoint and Word) and web-based SDLC collaboration tools (e.g., Atlassian platform).

  

**Highly Desirable:*** Work experience in the space of human biologics donation and transplantation (e.g., organ procurement, organ transplant, tissue recovery, tissue processing, eye banking, birth tissue acquisition and processing, blood banking, etc.).
* Hands-on experience successfully designing and deploying Interoperability solutions in the healthcare space via FHIR or HL7 interfaces.
* Master’s in Business Administration (MBA) or Health Administration (MHA).
* PmP Certification or other formalized Project Management Certifications.
* Healthcare Information Technology Certifications.

  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment****:** The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodation(s) may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions.
* While performing the duties of this position, prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer may be required.
* Additionally, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear.
* The employee frequently is required to use hands or fingers, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls.
* The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.
* The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds.
* Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, and the ability to adjust focus.
* The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
* Ability to attend and preside over trade shows and conferences and visit client sites which include hospital settings and medical facilities.
Ability to travel on a flexible schedule. Airplane travel is necessary.  
* 

  

  

*This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee(s) incumbent in this position. Employee(s) will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties requested by any person authorized to give instructions or assignments.*  

*This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an "at will" relationship.*  

*InVita provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.*

title: Product Manager - HMIS
description:
**Product Manager - HMIS**
--------------------------



At Bitfocus, our employees are the foundation of our success as an industry-leading software company. We are a team of talented, hard-working individuals who are passionate about the mission of ending homelessness. We strive to live by our core values and foster a culture of respect, collaboration, and inclusion. We actively look for ways to continue developing our foundation at all levels at Bitfocus.



We also believe in having fun and cultivating a positive environment where employees can bring their whole selves to work. We recognize that everyone brings unique perspectives, experiences, and strengths. We believe in supporting and developing our employees to provide an 11-star experience to our customers and ultimately help communities use data to tackle their greatest social challenges.



We hope you consider bringing your talent and drive, and join us in helping end homelessness!



We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced **Product Manager** to join our **Product** team. The successful candidate will be responsible for:



Overseeing the entire life cycle of the Bitfocus software product, including defining the product vision, planning its development, and ensuring its successful delivery. They will work closely with internal stakeholders, customers, and market research to architect features and functionality that align with the product roadmap while maintaining compliance with federal and local requirements.



The Product Manager will collaborate with diverse stakeholders to design and implement new features and reporting enhancements, ensuring that they meet market needs and maintain a consistently high level of quality. They will also support research efforts by synthesizing input from marketing, sales, and customers to inform product design and approach. Additionally, they will identify and articulate the key benefits and value of new features and enhancements to guide marketing plans and create effective marketing materials.



Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or disability.


**THIS IS A FULLY REMOTE, FULL-TIME POSITION - SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE REQUIRED TO WORK FROM HOME.**


**Compensation:**
-----------------



We are committed to providing competitive pay and benefits that are in line with industry standards. We analyze and carefully consider several factors when determining compensation, including skills, qualifications, and professional experience, which can cause your compensation to vary. This role has an annual targeted total compensation range of **$80,000 - $125,000**, which includes variable compensation **(bonus)** eligibility.


**About the Product Team:**
---------------------------



Product operates at the confluence of the customer, owner, and engineering. Our goal is to facilitate data-driven software that makes a meaningful impact on our customers. We strive for excellence and are empowered to create a collaborative, transparent, and fun working environment.


**As a Product Manager, you will:**
-----------------------------------


* **Product Requirement Development:** Develop clear, comprehensive product requirements that align with business logic and system impacts while translating customer needs into processes compliant with regulations. Ensure traceability, documentation, and accounting of all stakeholder requirements throughout the product development lifecycle.
* **Subject Matter Expertise:** Develop a deep understanding of the Clarity Human Services software, the market landscape, relevant technology trends, and the competition. Acquire and maintain expertise in these areas to inform decision-making, strategy development, and product positioning.
* **Product Strategy and Lifecycle Management:** Support the implementation of the Clarity Human Services product strategy and roadmap. Manage the product throughout its entire lifecycle, from concept development to end-of-life considerations. Continuously evaluate and monitor the performance of the product and identify areas for improvement.
* **Business Case Development:** Write compelling business cases for development initiatives and obtain internal approvals. Present a strong rationale and justification for proposed projects, outlining their potential value and alignment with business objectives.
* **Performance Monitoring and Improvement:** Monitor, report, and improve the performance of the product. Continuously track key metrics and indicators, identify areas for enhancement or optimization, and implement appropriate strategies to enhance the product's effectiveness.
* **Trial and Launch Planning:** Plan and execute trials and minimum viable product (MVP) releases. Develop comprehensive go-live launch plans, ensuring smooth product launches and seamless transitions from development to deployment.
* **Feedback Collection and Analysis:** Collate feedback from internal staff and customers, gathering insights and suggestions to inform future product iterations and enhancements. Actively seek feedback through surveys, interviews, and other appropriate methods.
* **Representation and Advocacy:** Represent the voice of the customer and the product in senior-level management meetings. Articulate product strategy, goals, and requirements to key stakeholders, advocating for the product's vision and value proposition.
* **Product Advocacy and Stakeholder Engagement****:** Act as a champion for the product within the organization and to external entities including customers, partners, and industry stakeholders, promoting its unique features, benefits, and competitive advantages. Develop robust relationships with business stakeholders, fostering rapport, trust, and collaboration while establishing yourself as a respected leader, further enhancing productive partnerships and a collaborative mindset.

**What you bring:**
-------------------


* At a minimum, you have **two to three years** of Homeless Management Information System (HMIS) experience.
* You have **advanced product management expertise**, evidencing the ability to meet strict deadlines and contractual obligations; adept at constantly prioritizing tasks, progressing parallel projects, and adjusting swiftly to emerging priorities in a fast-paced software development environment.
* You have **solid analytical abilities, proficiency in quantitative and qualitative statistical analyses,** and a working knowledge of contemporary analytics tools, essential for data-driven decision-making in software product management.
* You are a **proven innovator**, adept at identifying and implementing best practices in problem-solving, specifically within the software product development context.
* You have **proven expertise in drafting** clear, concise requirement documents for software engineering teams, effectively bridging the gap between business needs and technical execution.
* You have extensive experience utilizing **Jira for Agile** workstream planning and delivery in a software development setting, demonstrating proficiency in Agile methodologies and tools.

**You will love this position if:**
-----------------------------------


* **You are a systematic and innovative thinker** and understand structures, patterns, and cycles in complex systems and processes. You are able to analyze interdependencies within a system to inform decision-making and drive effective strategies. Demonstrates creativity in problem-solving, constantly seeking new solutions and approaches to improve and deliver high-quality software products.
* **You are a data-driven strategist** and leverage analytical insights to make informed decisions, prioritize interdependent goals, and align actions with the overall strategy, ensuring timely project delivery. You are skilled in the full software development lifecycle and well-versed in best practices.
* **You are an excellent communicator and collaborator** and an expert in written and oral communication, capable of conveying complex topics to non-technical audiences and articulating ideas clearly and concisely. You demonstrate empathy in understanding and addressing the needs of team members and stakeholders, fostering collaboration across teams.
* **You are resourceful and entrepreneurial** and achieve results creatively even with limited resources. You are adaptable and proactive in agile, lean, and fast-paced environments, with a comfort in taking ownership to drive projects forward.
* **You are ethical and empathic**, and display self-awareness, honesty, openness, and respect towards others. Your ethical behavior and integrity are inherent in your work approach.
* **You are a passionate problem solver** and enthusiastic about ideating and delivering best-of-breed software solutions and tackling challenges head-on. You exhibit a growth mindset that drives continuous improvement and a strong desire to learn new skills.
* **You are design-oriented** and skilled in designing complex systems with an eye for effective design principles. Able to create intuitive and user-friendly software solutions while maintaining attention to detail and a focus on simplicity.

**How Bitfocus Will Support You:**
----------------------------------


* Work in a fully remote/virtual environment with a robust onboarding and training program that sets you up for success
* A unique, friendly, and caring culture! Hear more from our employees on Glassdoor.
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees and dependents. (100% employer paid for employee only and 50% employer paid for dependents!)
* Voluntary benefits options include Critical Illness, Hospital, Short-Term Disability, and Long-Term Disability.
* Flexible Spending Account (FSA), Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, and Health Saving Account options!
* Employer-sponsored life insurance
* 401K retirement plan w/ 4% match.
* One-time $500 Home Office Stipend
* $75 per month towards internet and phone bills
* 100% paid parental leave for 12 weeks for birthing, non-birthing, adoptive and surrogate parents
* Apple Macbook for your home office

title: Senior Product Manager - Clinical Core
description:
Curai Health is an AI-powered virtual clinic on a mission to improve access to care at scale. As the pioneer in deploying machine learning into clinical workflows, Curai Health enables its dedicated, specially trained clinicians to deliver primary care to more people at a fraction of the cost. Easy-to-use and convenient, Curai Health partners with insurers and health systems to keep patients engaged in their care over time, improving health outcomes and reducing costs.  

Our company is remote-first, and we consider candidates across the United States. Our corporate office is located in San Francisco. **Product Management at Curai**
At Curai, we collaborate on our product development efforts across “pods.” Each pod operates cross-functionally and includes members from engineering, design, and clinical operations. We’re looking for a Product Manager to lead our Clinical Core and Practice Management pods, responsible for developing our custom-built provider-facing platform.  

As pod lead, you will be responsible for driving product development for the pod’s slice of the user experience, from the roadmap and vision down to feature launches and metrics. You’ll be working on features typical of EHR development and features that harness AI so that our Care team can scale while delivering an exceptional patient experience. **Who You Are***None of these individually are hard requirements, but they do describe the type of folks that we think would be most effective and happy at Curai. You…** Are a self-starting doer who is optimistic and resilient and can work in a sometimes ambiguous environment
* Can’t sit back when there’s a problem to solve
* Understand your audience to help them achieve clarity, especially in group dynamics
* Pick up things quickly, staying current with the latest products & technologies in healthcare and AI-related healthcare domains
* Have a feel for and obsession with polished product experiences
* Want to know everything about your product area, deriving and updating insights from metrics, user research, chat reviews, etc
* Are decisive even when limited to sparse data, fuzzy insights, or qualitative outcomes
* (but also!) Are quantitative and believe in the power of striving to define crisp, even when difficult. You should have exceptional judgment
* Thrive as a collaborative leader, knowing that you’ll interface with every functional group in the company as a leader for the pod

 **What You’ll Do***A week in the life of this Product Manager includes…*
Acting as the directly responsible individual (DRI) for projects in the pod* Defining requirements and building alignment for upcoming projects
* Collaborating with engineering management to support ongoing projects
* Assessing and integrating the learnings gathered from past product launches

  

Acting as the directly responsible individual (DRI) for the pod’s roadmap* Thinking time spent without distraction to define the future. You are expected to bring transformational ideas to the table
* Interfacing with the Growth team to understand the voice of the customer
* Maintaining the future roadmap to reflect changing plans and priorities

  

Deepening your mastery as the expert on Curai’s clinical core product* Ensuring that you know every nook, cranny, and skeleton in the closet of product behavior in this area
* Gathering new user insights through weekly chat, customer satisfaction reviews, and periodic user research
* Staying current on KPIs and seeking out the answers to the WHY that underlies metrics changes
* Developing a deep understanding of each team’s challenges in advancing the pod’s goals (design, eng, operations, clinical)

  

Collaboration with colleagues* Leading pod meetings, communicating vision and plans, and sensing where extra alignment is needed
* Time spent with the AI team to understand their latest initiatives and maintain tight alignment
* Time spent with clinical leadership to ensure that the product is effectively operationalizing our clinical protocols, goals, and programs
* Time spent with the rest of the product team, ensuring that the pods stay in sync, learnings are shared, and that we foster a supportive team environment
* 1:1’s with your manager and closest peer collaborators in the pod (likely the designer and tech lead)

 **What You’ll Need*** 5+ years of consumer-facing product management experience
* First-hand experience in clinical workflows
* Bachelor’s degree
* Experience delivering EHRs and the ability to describe your involvement clearly
* Demonstrated history of translating product data/insights into actionable plans that delivered measurable impact
* A tuned and demonstrable sense of what excellent product experience feels like
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Enough engineering understanding to be able to assess technical tradeoffs with an engineering peer appropriately
* Enough data science understanding to help define metrics and interpret analyses from the data science team
* Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously

 **What We Offer*** Culture: Mission-driven talent with great colleagues committed to living our values, collaborating, and driving performance
* Pay: Competitive compensation and stock
* Wellness: Unlimited PTO, flexible working hours and remote working options
* Benefits: Excellent medical, dental, vision, flex spending plans, and paid parental leave
* Financial: 401k plan with employer matching

  

This position's annual base salary range is between $150,000 and $215,000 annually. Stock grants also play a key part in any offer, they increase your overall compensation package significantly based on company success. Please note that the base salary range is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on qualifications, skill level, competencies, and work location.  

Curai Health is a startup with a small but world-class team from high-tech companies, AI researchers, and practicing physicians to team members from non-traditional career paths and backgrounds. We also have research partnerships with leading universities across the country and access to medical data that facilitates research in this space. We are a highly collaborative, data-driven team focused on delivering our mission with funding from top-tier Silicon Valley investors including Morningside, General Catalyst, and Khosla Ventures.  

At Curai Health, we are highly committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment. In keeping with our beliefs and values, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status. To promote an equitable and bias-free workplace, we set competitive compensation packages for each position and do not negotiate on our offers. We are looking for mission-driven teammates who embody our core values and appreciate our transparent approach.

title: Product Manager
description:
At LegitScript, we are passionate about making the internet and payment ecosystems safer and more transparent. We help companies of all sizes keep their services legal and safe for consumers. To do this, LegitScript combines big data with the world’s leading team of experts skilled in highly regulated and complex sectors, including transaction laundering detection, pharmaceuticals, online gambling, and more.


The result? Unmatched accuracy and deep risk analysis that identifies which commercial entities play by the rules, and which do not. Our diverse industry partnerships provide unique insights that keep businesses and governments at the forefront of emerging trends. That’s why LegitScript is trusted by the world's largest search engines, internet platforms, payment companies, and regulatory agencies.


General description


The Product Manager is responsible for guaranteeing the success of the Platform Monitoring product line. This role is responsible for the product planning and execution throughout the Product Lifecycle, including: gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements, defining the product vision, and working closely with engineering, sales, marketing and support to ensure revenue and customer satisfaction goals are met. This includes business performance enablement of both existing product expansion as well as new market and product assessment, roadmap, requirements and launch readiness.  

What You'll Do:

* Work with coordinating departments to create and implement a strategic product plan across definition, development and launch phases
* Act as the key authority and point of contact for product development concepts, business strategy and business models
* Enable and manage business performance including effective portfolio, resource and budget management to ensure optimal product development investment and alignment across stakeholders
* Partner with the marketing, development and design teams to fully realize the product vision, strategy commercial success of the products
* Direct and collaborate with product development on requirement intake, scoping, prioritization and roadmap processes
* Collect, analyze and report on data and make adjustments to development plans as needed to respond to new market and customer expansion opportunities
* Represent the voice of the end consumer throughout the product development lifecycle
* Ensure that high standards of reliability, quality, usability and measurement are adhered to throughout each phase of product development
* Represent and support product leadership position to internal stakeholders and external audiences
* Collaborate closely with other product and analyst leaders to inform and enable growth and EBITDA expansion opportunities
* Instrument measurement and reporting capabilities to inform the business on areas of opportunity and progress


What You'll Bring:

* Must possess and consistently exhibit the competencies relative to the position
* Passion for conceiving, creating and designing useful, innovative products
* Experience identifying various business problems or product flaws and coming up with creative solutions
* Proven experience overseeing all elements of an agile product development lifecycle
* Highly effective cross-functional team management
* Previous experience enabling and delivering impactful product positioning and marketing strategies
* Exceptional writing and editing skills combined with strong presentation and public speaking skills
* Strong experience in a dynamic product management role
* Aligned with values
* Growth mindset (receptive to feedback, learner)
* Detail-oriented
* Independent/Resourceful
* Able to work under pressure
* Effective and authentic communicator of technical concepts to internal and external audiences
* Adaptable
* Excellent time management and problem solving skills as well as the ability to make informed judgments and strong independent decisions when necessary
* Capable of inspiring confidence and clarity in direction that also contributes to a positive team environment
* Ability to build and maintain effective working relationships with team members along with willingness to set and maintain high standards of performance
* Well developed ability to speak, read, comprehend, and write English
* 4 year college degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
* 2-4 years of related product management experience

  

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

  

Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position. We cannot support international remote work.

  

In addition to competitive salaries, full-time employees enjoy a great benefits package:

* Multiple Medical plans (one with $0 employee premium option), Dental & Vision plans
* 401k with company match and immediate vesting
* Generous paid time off package and 11 paid holidays
* And much more!


If you got to this point, we hope you're feeling excited about the job description you just read. Even if you don't feel that you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people that believe in LegitScript’s mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of ways – not just candidates who check all the boxes.

title: Product Manager
description:
**Twin Health**



At Twin Health, we empower people to reverse, prevent and improve chronic metabolic diseases. Twin Health invented The Whole Body Digital Twin™ , a dynamic representation of each individual's unique metabolism, built from thousands of data points collected daily via non-invasive sensors and self-reported preferences. The Whole Body Digital Twin delivers a new standard of care, empowering physicians and patients to make personalized data-driven decisions.


**Working here**



Our team is passionate, talented, and driven by our purpose to improve the health and happiness of our members. Our culture empowers each Twin to do what's needed to create impact for our members, partners, and our company, and enjoy their experience at work. Twin Health was awarded Innovator of the Year by Employer Health Innovation Roundtable (EHIR) (out of 358 companies), named to the 2021 CB Insights Digital Health 150, and recognized by Built In's 2022 Best Places To Work Awards. Twin Health has the backing of leading venture capital funds including ICONIQ Growth, Sequoia, and Sofina, enabling us to scale services in the U.S. and globally and help solve the global chronic metabolic disease health crisis. We have recently announced broad and growing partnerships with premier employers, such as Blackstone and Berkshire Hathaway. We are building the company you always wished you worked for. Join us in revolutionizing healthcare and building the most impactful digital health company in the world!


**Excited to join us and do your part in improving people's health and happiness?**

**Opportunity**



We're on the hunt for a visionary Product Manager to spearhead the development of next-generation mobile and AI experiences. This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is passionate about leveraging technology to make a meaningful impact on health. Whether you're a veteran in healthcare or eager to apply your skills to the health tech space, we want you.


**Responsibilities**


* Craft and Execute Vision: Define the roadmap for our member-centric mobile apps, setting priorities and steering the product toward success.
* Drive with Data and Empathy: Utilize user insights and data analytics to enhance the app experience, ensuring it meets the needs of our diverse user base.
* Foster Collaboration: Lead multidisciplinary teams, including engineers, designers, and clinical experts, to bring your product vision to life.
* Innovate and Iterate: From ideation to launch, you'll experiment and refine, scaling our mobile app to delight millions.
* Write Exceptional Specs: Communicate your vision clearly by crafting detailed and understandable specifications for the engineering team, facilitating efficient and effective product development.
* Be a User Advocate: Work closely with business operations, health coaches, and nutritionists, translating member feedback into impactful product features.
* Champion Personalization: Deliver exceptional, tailored experiences that win hearts and minds.


**Qualifications**


* You have 3+ years of Product Management experience, preferably in tech, with a track record of launching successful mobile apps.
* You're a self-starter, comfortable navigating ambiguity and complexity.
* Your decisions are data-informed, and you're skilled in product analytics.
* Exceptional interpersonal skills; you're able to influence and work effectively across functions.
* Experience in experimentation, prototyping, and hypothesis testing is a plus.


**Compensation and Benefits**



The compensation range for this position is $120,000-$140,000 annually.



In addition, Twin has an ambitious vision to empower people to live healthier and happier lives, and to achieve this purpose, we need the very best people to enhance our cutting-edge technology and medical science, deliver the best possible care, and turn our passion into value for our members, partners and investors. We are committed to delivering an outstanding culture and experience for every Twin employee through a company based on the values of passion, talent, and trust. We offer comprehensive benefits and perks in line with these principles, as well as a high level of flexibility for every Twin


* A competitive compensation package in line with leading technology companies
* As a remote friendly company we are committed to providing opportunities for all who join to further build relationships, increase cross-functional collaboration, and celebrate our accomplishments.
* Opportunity for equity participation
* Unlimited vacation with manager approval
* 16 weeks of 100% paid parental leave for delivering parents; 8 weeks of 100% paid parental leave for non-delivering parents
* 100% Employer sponsored healthcare, dental, and vision for you, and 80% coverage for your family; Health Savings Account and Flexible Spending Account options
* 401k retirement savings plan

Salary range for US jobs**US Salary Range**


$120,000—$140,000 USD

title: Product Manager
description:
**Compensation: The initial compensation for this role will be in the form of equity and can be part-time to begin with. Once the company secures equity funding, which is expected within the next 3-4 months, the candidate will be converted to full-time and receive a competitive market salary in addition to equity.**

**Job Description**

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Product Manager- software development to join our team and drive the evolution of our platform. If you are passionate about leveraging technology to transform professional interactions and are excited about the opportunity to contribute to a growing company, we encourage you to apply.

**Key Responsibilities**:

* Work with head of product and the CEO to execute the product vision, collaborating with the CTO, head of software development, and Director of Content and Research.
* Prioritize, develop, and communicate the product roadmap to the organization.
* Collaborate with key stakeholders including customers, sales, marketing, AI/ML, design, and software development on the creation of the roadmap.
* Become a subject matter expert in how business users perform their jobs. Write use cases, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
* Evangelize the current offering both internally and externally.
* Understand market dynamics and drive changes to the product to create improvement and differentiation.
* Comfortably engage in professional conversations with our target buyers and users.
* Interact with staff, colleagues, cross-functional teams, and third parties with excellent people skills.
* Manage multiple projects and tasks, demonstrating strong project management skills.
* Facilitate effective meetings and consensus building without compromising speed or execution.
* Demonstrate strong analytical skills.

**Requirements**:

* 5 years of product management experience preferred but open to all levels.
* Track record of using qualitative and quantitative data to prioritize and drive decision-making.
* Comfortable using product, collaboration, and development tools such as Slack, JIRA, Github, Canva, etc.
* Experience with best practice agile scrum software development principles.

**About the Company**

VideoXRM is a rapidly growing business video sharing and networking platform, dedicated to transforming the way professionals connect and collaborate. Our platform integrates video sharing, networking, and AI-driven insights to empower businesses and professionals to engage, learn, and grow. The company is now beginning to generate revenue.

**Team**

Our Company’s founders and executive team, come from fund management, corporate finance, trading, national commercial banking, software and app development and AI/machine learning. We are keenly aware of the challenges that emerging growth private and public companies face to garner investment community visibility and shareholder sponsorship as well as the valuable unstructured data that investors, partners, suitors and customers are seeking in today’s digital world.

**Corporate Culture**

We encourage open and frequent communication and free flowing ideas with no one being a filter to another member of the team. You can reach out to anyone on the team about anything, anytime. We all trust each other implicitly. We are friends and colleagues. Communicate with team members when/how you want.

**Compensation**

**The initial compensation for this role will be in the form of equity and can be part-time to begin with. Once the company secures equity funding, which is expected within the next 3-4 months, the candidate will be converted to full-time and receive a competitive market salary in addition to equity.**

Job Types: Part-time, Contract, Internship

Pay: $100,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Paid time off

Compensation package:

* 1099 contract
* RSU

Experience level:

* 1 year
* 2 years
* 3 years
* 4 years
* 5 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Product Owner
description:
**Position Summary**

We are seeking a Product Owner to work with our incredibly talented team in order to deliver the best innovative and industry-leading product solutions to our customers. The Product Owner will be primarily focused on the execution of product design, build, testing, and release & launch for our Curriculum and Learning products including the measurement of product efficacy, usage, and overall customer satisfaction.

The Product Owner will need to be a strong collaborator that is highly motivated to understand our users. This position will require a proven track record of success in delivering product value by continuously envisioning, prioritizing and evaluating the work generated by the associated delivery teams, ensuring highly valuable features and functionality of our product are delivered.

**Responsibilities and Duties**

* Work closely with the Director of Product to define product vision, road-map and growth opportunities.
* Be the primary point of contact for the business delivery teams, representing the voice of the customer throughout the product development cycle as well as setting priorities, objectives and deadlines.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to capture user needs and requirements, establish acceptance criteria, manage project backlogs and iteration planning.
* Manage daily project goals and schedules, adjusting expectations and priorities as needed.
* Communicate project status to stakeholders.
* Participate in the establishment of the team objective and key results (OKRs) based on input from Corporate OKRs, Product Management and team members.
* In conjunction with the Product Director, assess value, develop cases, and prioritize Stories, Epics and Themes to ensure work focuses on those with maximum value that are aligned with product strategy.
* Develop feedback loops to validate the most critical product changes prior to implementation and solicit ideas for new functionality
* Works with UX to create mockups that feed into the User Story Acceptance Criteria
* Research and analyze the customer needs, the industry, competitors, and other potential industries for innovation and valuable product opportunities.
* Analyzing user feedback and activity, and iterating to enhance the user experience
* Must have the ability to quickly adapt to new technologies and a willingness to keep their skills and industry knowledge current.
* Support go-to-market release/launch activities working with Marketing, Sales, Account Management, Sales Enablement teams.
* Monitor all phases of product development and help to resolve roadblocks to ensure deadlines are met and product outcomes are delivered.
* Perform other assignments or duties as needed or requested by management.

**Additional Desired Knowledge & Skills:**

* 3-5 years of Product Owner experience preferred
* Experience working with Edtech software preferred
* Strong analytical skills
* Proven history of gathering requirements and the ability to translate requirements and visions into user stories
* Excellent verbal/written skills
* Experience working in an Agile Framework (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)
* Proficient with Jira (or other Agile project management tools)
* CSM/CSPO/PSPO certification strongly desired
* Ability to collaborate and build new relationships
* Experience organizing and driving projects to completion

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Yearly bonus

Experience level:

* 3 years
* 5 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Studio Games Product Manager
description: Discord is about giving people the power to create space to find belonging in their lives. We want to make it easier for you to talk regularly with the people you care about. We want you to build genuine relationships with your friends and communities close to home or around the world. Original, reliable, playful, and relatable. These are the values that connect our users and our employees at Discord. Our Studio team focuses on creating games and on-platform experiences through first party development and partnerships. We’re looking for a Product Manager for our casual game development team. As a key player, you will collaborate with our internal game development team to define success metrics, design engaging systems, and drive player retention and monetization. If you have a passion for gaming and want to help drive the success of our games on Discord and ensuring exceptional player experiences, this is the perfect opportunity for you. This person will report to the Director of Game Development. What You'll Be Doing Design systems that engage, retain, and monetize players via free to play, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable gaming experience. Collaborate with game teams to define success metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) for titles. Work closely with multiple cross-functional teams, including game designers, engineers, and artists, to develop and launch new features and updates. Analyze game data, player feedback, and industry trends to identify areas for strategic improvements and optimize game performance. Collaborate with marketing and platform teams to develop and execute player acquisition and retention strategies. You Will Thrive In This Role If You have 3+ years of experience in product management in the gaming industry You have a strong understanding and proven results in F2P game monetization and player psychology. You have a track record of successfully launching and managing games or game features. You have experience using data and insights to inform product development and strategies You have experience managing multiple simultaneous projects, with the ability to bring structure to ambiguous challenges and engage with project teams in varying phases of development. You have experience communicating product updates, milestones, and progress to internal and external partners, with the ability to work closely with cross-functional teams. Bonus Points Experience with web/html5 games and/or real-time multiplayer games. Experience with user acquisition and retention strategies in the gaming industry. Familiarity with agile development methodologies The US base salary range for this full-time position is $175,000 - $191,000 + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role and level. Within the range, individual pay is determined by additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include equity, or benefits. #LI-RemoteAbout Us Discord is a voice, video and text app that helps friends and communities come together to hang out and explore their interests — from artists and activists, to study groups, sneakerheads, plant parents, and more. With 150 million monthly users across 19 million active communities, called servers, Discord has grown to become one of the most popular communications services in the world. Discord was built without selling ads or user data and instead, offers a premium subscription called Nitro that gives users special perks like higher quality streams and fun customizations. We’re working toward an inclusive world where no one feels like an outsider, where genuine human connection is a click, text chat, or voice call away. A place where everyone can find belonging. Challenging? Heck yes. Rewarding? Double heck yes. It’s a mission that gives us the chance to positively impact millions of people all over the world. So if this strikes a chord with you, come build belonging with us!

title: Product Manager - IT Service Management Integrations
description:
**About the Role**


NinjaOne is on the lookout for a Product Manager to spearhead our IT Service Management (ITSM) Integration product line. Use your passion of leveraging technology to streamline IT Service Management in this pivotal Product Management role. Blend your IT expertise in API integrations, deep understanding of IT Solutions, and experience in delivering solutions that enhance IT operations; to help us build our best-in-class IT Operations products.

  

As the Product Manager for ITSM Integration, you will navigate the crossroads of product innovation, strategy, and execution. Your role is crucial in defining the future of our Integration offerings, ensuring they meet the complex needs of our clients. Your profound knowledge of APIs and IT service management processes, will drive the integration of our products with a variety of ITSM tools, creating seamless, efficient workflows that power thousands of businesses.

 **Location -** We are flexible on remote working from home, if you are located in the **USA** and in one of the following states - **TX, FL, CA, NC, GA, CT, ME, KS, and VA**.

 **What You’ll be Doing**

* **Product Vision and Strategy:** Craft and articulate the vision for NinjaOne' s ITSM Integration products. Develop a comprehensive product strategy that aligns with market needs, customer feedback, and the company’s overall goals. Assist with our wider NinjaOne Workflow product lineup Ticketing, Documentation, API etc.
* **API Integration Expertise:** Use your extensive experience with APIs to oversee the development of robust, scalable integrations between NinjaOne products and third-party ITSM tools. Ensure our roadmap aligns with the capabilities of third-party tools.
* **Collaboration and Leadership:** Work closely with engineering, sales, marketing, and support teams to deliver products that exceed customer expectations. Lead cross-functional initiatives to drive product development, launch, and adoption.
* **Market and Customer Insight:** Conduct market research and engage with customers to understand their needs and challenges. Translate insights into product features that solve real problems and enhance IT service management.
* Other duties as required.

 **About You**

* Bachelors degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or other technical track, preferred but not required.
* 7+ years IT technical experience, such as working for an MSP, Internal IT department, IT Operations SaaS products, Systems Engineer, etc.
* 4+ years of Product Management experience with a B2B SaaS product.
* Expert experience working with REST APIs, integrating different tools using them and being able to understand their capabilities from documentation.
* Previous experience working with a variety of PSA, ITSM and Service Desk tools.
* Stakeholder management experience and a knack for juggling multiple priorities.

 **About Us**


NinjaOne automates the hardest parts of IT, empowering more than 17,000 IT teams with visibility, security, and control over all endpoints. The NinjaOne platform is proven to increase productivity, while reducing risk and IT costs. NinjaOne is consistently ranked #1 for its world-class support and is the top-rated software on G2 in seven categories including endpoint management, remote monitoring and management, and patch management.

 **What You’ll Love**


We are a collaborative, kind, and curious community.


We honor your flexibility needs with full-time work that is remote.


We have you covered with our comprehensive benefits package, which includes medical, dental, and vision insurance.


We help you prepare for your financial future with our 401(k) plan.


We prioritize your work-life balance with our unlimited PTO.


We reward your work with opportunity for growth and advancement.

 **Additional Information**


Starting pay for the successful applicant depends on a variety of job-related factors, including but not limited to location, market demands, experience, job-related knowledge, and skills. The benefits available for this position include medical, dental, vision, 401(k) plan, life insurance coverage and PTO. For California-based roles, the base salary hiring range for this position is $135,000 to $210,000 per year.

title: Junior Product Manager
description:
**Job Description:** We are looking for a dynamic and passionate Junior Product Manager to join our product management team. In this role, you will work closely with senior product managers to develop and implement product strategies that align with our company's vision and customer needs.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Assist in the development and implementation of product roadmaps and strategies.
* Coordinate and analyze market research to identify customer needs and market trends.
* Collaborate with the engineering, design, and marketing teams to develop and launch new features and products.
* Analyze product performance and user feedback to recommend improvements.
* Contribute to sprint planning and review sessions.
* Prepare and present reports on product progress and roadmap updates.
* Assist in managing product backlogs and prioritizing feature development.
* Coordinate with stakeholders to ensure product goals are met on time and within budget.


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.
* 0-2 years of experience in product management, project management, or a related field in the software industry.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Knowledge of Agile methodologies and tools such as DevOps.
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Passion for technology and innovation.

  



About Persimmony:



Persimmony is a leading software company working primarily with state and county health and social service departments. We provide electronic case management and other tracking software for government employees who provide critical care for county residents.



Founded in 2002, we are well established and have a proven track record of success in over two dozen counties, where we have helped our customers save hundreds of millions of dollars.



We are based in Aliso Viejo, CA, but are committed to 100% remote work as we continue to scale out our services nationally.



Persimmony is an equal opportunity employer, committed to cultural diversity. Persimmony will provide equal consideration for employment to all qualified applicants without regard to their race, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, domestic partner status, or medical condition. Persimmony is an E-Verify participant.

title: IT Product Owner
description:
Imagine a workplace that encourages you to interpret, innovate and inspire. Our employees do just that by helping healthcare payers manage the cost of care, improve competitiveness and **inspire** positive change. You can be part of an established company with a 40-year legacy that helps our customers thrive by **interpreting** our client's needs and tailoring **innovative** healthcare cost management solutions.

  



Our commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging are part of the fabric of our company. We strive to create a workplace that fosters mutual respect and collaboration, where every talent individual can participate and perform their best work. We are MultiPlan and we are where bright people come to shine!

  



**JOB SUMMARY:** The Product Owner is an empowered leader, knowledgeable in the business, who is responsible for working with stakeholders to understand business challenges and develop innovative and practical solutions that meet the customer’s needs. They develop a Product Roadmap that describes deliverables and strategy, and then execute the roadmap. The Product Owner is responsible for maintaining both the Program and Team backlog for Agile teams, and overseeing and/or conducting the elicitation, organization and documentation of business and solution requirements. They work closely with Product Management, Architecture, Business Owners, subject matter experts, Business Analysts and Agile teams; ensuring that the team develops solutions that meet the customer’s real needs.

  


**JOB ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**



* Work with Product Management, Operations and Technical Leadership to articulate the vision and high level Roadmap, and garner consensus across all stakeholders.


* In collaboration with product management, identify and deliver features, gather feedback from stakeholders that will inform feature development, meet with the development team to convey the product roadmaps, and gather data on product usage


* Own and manage the backlog of the development team


* Working with other product owners to resolve dependencies and negotiate, coordinate, and align priorities to complete a feature


* Work with the Technical Lead/Architect to understand technical work and ensure the roadmap and backlog is planned with technical concerns in mind


* Collaborate with customers, clients and prospective users to understand and anticipate their needs.


* Work with Agile Program Managers (RTE) and Domain Architects to create a prioritized Product/Program Backlog for all development work related to the Product.


* Work with Business Analysts and Agile Teams to break down big Features into User Stories on the Team backlog for the Agile team to design, build, test and deliver.


* Attend and actively participate in all relevant Team level Events and act as the content authority to make sure the Agile Team delivers the right solution at the right time.


* Attend and actively participate in Program level Agile Events such as PI Planning


* Act as a liaison between the Agile Team and the customers/stakeholders, making sure Product progress is highly visible and that the team is working/delivering at a sustainable pace.


* Assist the Agile team as needed to complete stories and with troubleshooting problems and developing recommendations/solutions


* Establish and govern approach for Product Documentation


* Support training development for end users and staff members.


* Collaborate, coordinate, and communicate across disciplines and departments.


* Ensure compliance with HIPAA regulations and requirements.


* Demonstrate commitment to the Company’s core values.


* The position responsibilities outlined above are in no way to be construed as all encompassing. Other duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be required and/or assigned as necessary.
  


**JOB SCOPE:** Incumbent works under minimal direction and uses independent judgment to identify issues, trends & problems and recommend action plans and evaluate results on initiatives that may not be clearly defined and are large in scope. Work is varied and complex, requiring the individual to use a broad range of knowledge gained through experience. The position works with internal and external sources to complete objectives, keeping the needs of external and internal customers as a priority when making decisions and taking action.

  




**COMPENSATION**



The salary range for this position is $115-120K. Specific offers take into account a candidate's education, experience and skills, as well as the candidate's work location and internal equity. This position is also eligible for health insurance, 401k and bonus opportunity.


  
**JOB REQUIREMENTS (Education, Experience, and Training):**  

* Minimum Bachelor's Degree, or 8 equivalent years of related experience
* 3+ years of agile Product Owner experience with methods such as Scrum, Lean, Kanban or SAFe or 7 years' experience in analysis and design on software development initiatives in analyst role (preferably within a Scrum Agile team)

* Experience managing large scale greenfield system migration strongly preferred.
* Ability to manage multiple simultaneous initiatives including continuous evaluation and re-ordering of priorities as business needs dictate
* Experience with distributed (offshore and remote) teams
* Experience with multiple teams at the same time
* Product Owner certification
* Experience with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) and PI Planning
* Strong working knowledge of Jira & Confluence
* Knowledge of other Agile approaches, such as Kanban and hybrid approaches
* Knowledge of Healthcare industry and understanding all major workflows associated with the healthcare claim processing is beneficial
* Communication (oral, written and listening), project management, analytic, organization, interpersonal, prioritization, multi-tasking, initiating, communication, problem-solving, planning and technical skills
* Ability to develop and maintain collaborative and cooperative relationships throughout the organization
* Ability to establish strong working relationships with teams and client relationships
* Demonstrate commitment to excellent customer service and follow-through
* Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from internal and external customers
* Ability to be flexible and creative in problem solving
* Ability to anticipate business needs and think with a business owner mind-set
* Ability to adhere to corporate work ethic standards.
* Minimum 5 years' experience in analysis and design on software development initiatives in a Product Owner or Product Management role (preferably within a Scrum Agile team).
* Experience developing Product vision and Roadmaps and communicating these to a wide range of stakeholders
* Experience in Agile methodologies and requirements gathering and management practices such as BDD
* Knowledge of Agile knowledge management tools such as JIRA and Confluence preferred
* Knowledge of modelling tools such as Visio, Lucidcharts, Draw.io preferred
* International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA) certifications, AAC, CBAP or CCBA preferred
* Required licensures, professional certifications, and/or Board certifications as applicable
* Knowledge of Healthcare industry and understanding all major workflows associated with healthcare claim processing
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Analytic, organization, interpersonal, prioritization, multi-tasking, initiating, communication, planning and technical skills
* Ability to use software and peripherals related to performance of job responsibilities
* Ability to facilitate teams and client relationships to satisfy needs and identify improvements
* Ability to develop strong relationships with all levels of management
* Ability to demonstrate commitment to excellent customer service and follow through
* Ability to manage multiple simultaneous initiatives including continuous evaluation and re-ordering of priorities for self and staff as business needs dictate
* Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from internal and external customers
* Ability to be flexible and creative in problem solving and identifying process improvements
* Ability to anticipate business needs and think with a business owner mind-set
* Ability to recognize and apply business analysis and system analysis best practices to fit a variety of situations

  



**BENEFITS**

We realize that our employees are instrumental to our success, and we reward them accordingly with very competitive compensation and benefits packages, an incentive bonus program, as well as recognition and awards programs. Our work environment is friendly and supportive, and we offer flexible schedules whenever possible, as well as a wide range of live and web-based professional development and educational programs to prepare you for advancement opportunities.

  



Your benefits will include:



Medical, dental and vision coverage with low deductible & copay



Life insurance



Short and long-term disability



401(k) + match



Generous Paid Time Off



Paid company holidays



Tuition reimbursement



Flexible Spending Account



Employee Assistance Program



Summer Hours

  



**EEO STATEMENT**


MultiPlan is an Equal Opportunity Employer and complies with all applicable laws and regulations. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you would like more information on your EEO rights under the law, please **click** **here**
