title: Product Manager
description:
Honor exists to expand the world’s capacity to care.



We’re combining high tech with high-touch to deliver better home care for aging adults, better jobs for Care Professionals, and entirely new offerings to support the aging journey, at scale.


Founded in 2014, and now a Series E funded “Unicorn” valued at over $1B, Honor leads the world’s largest home care network with the most advanced care platform. Our August 2021 acquisition of Home Instead has created a global company that’s revolutionizing how society cares for older adults, their families, and Care Professionals.



The Honor Care Platform combines local care and the most advanced technology to bring the highest quality care to more aging adults.


Grow at Honor as part of a united team where everyone shows up authentically, shares ideas bravely, and solves complex problems!


***About the Work:***


As a Product Manager at Honor, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the direction of our products and driving them to launch. We're seeking a highly motivated individual with exceptional communication skills, a knack for execution, and a passion for creative problem-solving. The product team is small, lean, and fast-paced so if you thrive on making your mark in a number of areas at once, Honor could be the place for you.


* You should have at least 2 years of product management experience at a high-growth small company or an established technology-led organization. You’ve led the development of products or large-scale platforms, with at least one example of taking a product end-to-end, from ideation to launch, iteration and scale.
* You come with a track record of navigating competing priorities and have demonstrated success collaborating with engineering and design teams.
* You are able to drive alignment from solution development to execution, and across a wide range of stakeholders. To succeed in this role, you’ll need to have excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical audiences.
You are a systems thinker, with an appetite for digging deep into the data, and thinking from first principles. You measure against clear success metrics and embrace experimentation, getting creative at figuring out ways to learn faster.  
* 
* You act like an owner. You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast paced environment, deals well with ambiguity and has a strong bias towards action. You pair strong problem solving skills with a high level of empathy and emotional intelligence.


#LI-DNI

*Our range reflects the hiring range for this position. We use national average to determine pay as we are a remote first company. Individual pay is based on a number of factors including qualifications, skills, experience, education, and training.*

  

*Base pay is just a part of our total rewards program. Honor offers generous equity packages that increase with position level and responsibilities, and a 401K with up to a 4% employer match.*  

*We provide medical, dental and vision coverage including zero cost plans for employees. Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability and Life Insurance are fully employer paid with a voluntary additional Life Insurance option. We offer a generous time off program, mental health benefits, wellness program, and discount program.*


**Hiring Salary Range**
$143,100—$175,000 USD***What’s next?***



Honor is remote friendly! We're hiring across the U.S., with an entirely virtual interview and onboarding process. Most of our positions are remote/work from home and do not require permanent relocation. As conditions allow, we have office space for in-person collaboration in our San Francisco Bay Area, CA and Austin, TX hubs. If you're looking for a great job that offers you the opportunity to work from home, we'd love to talk to you.

  

  

We value people! These four people-centric values guide the ways we work and decisions we make every day.


This role doesn’t sound quite right? Send this application to a friend who may be a fit and check out our other available roles!

  

#LI-Remote


*Honor is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, political affiliation or belief.*
  

  

*Honor is an E-Verify company. For more information please review our* *Participation* *and your* *Right to Work*

title: Product Manager
description:
Greenshades Product Managers are responsible for executing Agile based software development across multiple product verticals whilst maintaining true ownership of their products and scrum teams.


The Product Management Department is aiming to hire professionals that have a combination of hard and soft skills that are valuable within a development organization. These professionals should expect to interact, manage, and communicate effectively across departmental boundaries, to external partners, and directly with users of the product. You should be comfortable working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. Structure and processes are crucial, but as a results driven PM, flexibility is essential to ensure you are properly prioritizing the enhancements that will enable new revenue and maintain a high level of satisfaction for the active customer base. We expect you to be passionate about building products that our customers love.


We are looking for a technically talented and data driven individual with a moderate level of experience within the Payroll / HCM space who seeks to enhance the products they take ownership of and grow their own skillsets.

**Responsibilities**

* Define and develop the product strategy / roadmap to drive targeted business outcomes in alignment with top level corporate strategies / goals.
* Identify new product features to solve problems that current and prospective clients are facing, through market or internal information via interactions with clients, sales, implementations, or other functional internal or external departments.
* Nurture the technical relationships with key customers through various avenues (i.e. conducting voice of the customer feedback sessions).
* Daily leadership and management of the Sprinting or KanBan processes of assigned scrum teams.
* Present complex information, issues, processes, and potential solutions in an organized and summarized fashion to leadership, interested parties, and team members with the goal of producing buy in and cross team alignment.
* Identify market opportunities and build business cases, including financial estimates, to own the P&L
* Build a highly skilled and engaged development workforce.
* Create User Story definitions and specifications and in turn define the “what to build” and “why we should build it” side of the development cycle.
* Define, analyze, and manage metrics that track the success of managed products (KPIs)
* Effectively and efficiently communicate product changes both internally for stakeholders and externally for users.

**Knowledge, Skills & Abilities**

* Must display the highest level of critical thinking to weigh alternatives and present solutions that are consistent with the business strategy.
* Superior leadership abilities including the ability to share knowledge, resolve conflict, and create consensus.
* Strong ability to take ownership of assigned tasks and responsibilities, and appropriately prioritize.
* Excellent strategic project planning and documentation skills.
* Logical, clear, and concise written and verbal communication skills.
* Well versed in software development, web applications, computer architecture, and related subject matter.
* A passion for data, with great quantitative skills. Fully comfortable with financial and operational metrics and analyses.
* Must think like a both with strong business acumen as well as problem solver or engineer by displaying strong troubleshooting abilities to get to the source of problems and think critically about the potential solutions impact both technically and practically.
* Must display initiative, ability to work independently and be able to use extensive independent judgment.
* Ability to work seamlessly within a team as well as manage individual tasks.
* Ability to react quickly to a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
* Focus on the customer; Celebrates the success of others in the business.
* Working knowledge of the Payroll and HCM software market, with an intermediate level of core payroll and tax concepts.

**Preferred Training and Experience**

* Bachelor's degree in a related area required (or equivalent work experience).
* A minimum of 4+ years of experience in a software development environment, preferably as a Product Owner, Product Manager, Business Analyst, or equivalent, with an HCM or Payroll industry focus.
* Proven track record of developing and implementing winning technology strategies within a large, complex organization.
* Proven track record overseeing all aspects of large-scale projects including planning, requirements gathering, resource management and budget.
* Experience in Agile based software development.
* Technical knowledge of Information Technology field, software development, and computer systems.
* Familiarity with the following Product Management and/ or software development toolsets; Azure DevOps, SQL Syntax, Pendo, Miro / Figma / Lucid, and Postman


This is a remote position.




1M9MES456S

title: Group Product Manager, Integrations
description:
**About Kojo**
--------------


It's time to build. Whether it's creating more housing, upgrading our infrastructure, or adapting to climate change, one thing is clear: the construction industry is at the center of solving our biggest problems. We’re making buildings cheaper and easier to build by transforming the way commercial construction companies buy their materials. Join us.


Founded in 2018, Kojo is now one of the fastest-growing construction technology companies in the world. Construction accounts for $10 trillion in global spend annually and we can’t live without its output - our roads, schools, hospitals, and offices. Despite this, there’s been very little innovation over the past 70 years in how materials - which constitute up to 40% of project costs - are bought and sold. This is our opportunity.


Integrations are core to Kojo delivering business value to both buyers and sellers across the 7 Step Plan-to-pay process. This **Group Product Manager** will be responsible for defining the vision, roadmap, and implementation of both our buyer and seller integrations. They will work collaboratively across Kojo’s product teams to define the quarterly deliverables for each of these areas in accordance with Kojo’s overall business goals, while creating the mechanisms for guaranteeing that a quality product is delivered that meets customer and vendor expectations.

**About the Role**
------------------

**This role will include:**

* Defining, propagating, and implementing integrations strategy alongside Sales, CS, Product and Engineering counterparts
* Distilling strategy into quarterly plans that drive agreed-upon, high priority business goals
* Delivering high quality end-to-end customer experience with Kojo integration program, in a manner that meets or exceeds expectations
* Partnering with Engineering to create metrics and accountability systems to ensure product performance exceeds internal expectations
* Overseeing the build out of Kojo’s Vendor Integrations program with counterparts to define strategy, performance metrics, and maintain overall accountability across stakeholders.

**About You**
-------------


If you are a curious, thoughtful product leader excited about the unique opportunity to own and drive an industry-changing aspect of the Kojo platform, apply below!

**What you’ve accomplished:**

* 2+ years overseeing a complex integrations program, preferably of a SaaS application into legacy systems
* 5+ years as a Product Manager, *experience as a team lead or manager of Product Managers is a plus*
* Demonstrated experience building metrics / SQL
* A deep customer-centric curiosity that has allowed you to learn quickly on the job with the desire to learn multiple functional areas of business
* Reliable use of sound judgment to assess risk and implement solutions
* Ability to communicate your ideas in a well-structured, data-informed way
* Demonstrated understanding of product discovery and delivery
* Successful collaboration with engineers, designers, and other stakeholders
* Track record of success combining practical and conceptual thinking skills with proof of impact on a complex problem space

**What you care about:**

* **Innovation:** You seek to understand the truth behind problems and find solutions to them
* **Customer Obsession:** You care deeply about our customers and seek to understand their pain
* **Impact:** You prioritize rigorously and accomplish amazing amounts of important work
* **Accountability:** You are motivated by having the space to make your best judgments about what should be done and how to do it

*The salary range for this role is between $170,000 and $205,000 for candidates located in the US. The role is remote with less than 10% travel required. See details about compensation ranges below.*

**Working at Kojo**
-------------------

**Salary:** Your salary will be dependent upon many factors, including your experience level, skillset, market dynamics and balancing internal equity relative to other Kojo employees. The compensation and benefits information that we provide is based on Kojo’s good-faith estimate as of the date of the job posting and may be modified in the future.

**Benefits:** This position is also eligible for a new hire equity grant and all US-based full time employees are eligible for our full suite of perks and benefits. For more information about our perks and benefits, check out https://www.usekojo.com/careers.

**Location:** Kojo’s team members work from home 100% of the time across North and South America. If applicable, we’ll identify the travel and/or location-specific requirements of a position in the text above. Otherwise, team members can expect to work business hours congruent with their local time zone and remotely.

**Inclusive Workplace:** Kojo values diverse perspectives and is committed to building an inclusive workplace. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. We strongly encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply.  

  

**Scam Notice:** Please be aware that there are individuals and organizations that may attempt to scam job seekers by offering fraudulent employment opportunities in the name of Kojo. These scams may involve fake job postings, unsolicited emails, or messages claiming to be from our recruiters or hiring managers. Kojo will never ask for any personal account information, such credit card details or bank account numbers, during the recruitment process.

title: Group Product Manager
description:
Overview:
**Now is the time to join us!**
At Virgin Pulse we value and celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We believe in creating teams made up of individuals with various backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. Why? Because diversity inspires innovation, collaboration, and challenges us to produce better solutions. But more than this, diversity is our strength, and a catalyst in our ability to #changelivesforgood.


Responsibilities:
**Who are you?**
As a Lead Product Manager, you will be both an individual contributor and provide direct team management. You will lead the Personify Health Wellbeing product team and have personal responsibly for our member Rewards features and strategy as a means to drive member/user engagement. In addition to being a manager of product managers (also referred to as a Group Product Manager) you will provide thought leadership across the product organization and beyond. You will find the right balance between extrinsic and intrinsic mechanisms that motivate our members/users to focus on their personal health and wellbeing. Possessing an insatiable curiosity and desire to solve user problems, you advocate for your feature roadmap with an eye towards user and user empathy. You serve as the evangelist for your product family, communicating the roadmap vision to stakeholders, and directing product, UX, and engineering resources through product discovery and delivery. **In this role you will wear many hats, but your knowledge will be essential in the following:**

* Participate in strategic roadmap planning and maintain alignment across teams.
* Work with Engineering teams to design services that provide the right sequence of events to create multitude of statuses for our digital and service led health experiences.
* Lead a 3-5 member team of product managers
* Identify opportunities to improve the wellbeing of our members by consistently measuring the performance of our programs and systems capabilities.
* Redefine and implement our Rewards and Redemption strategy and discover new ways to support member health outcomes.
* Work with stakeholders across the business (including, but not limited to engineering, user experience & design, product marketing, client success, and legal).
* Drive product strategy through a deep understanding of business needs, maintaining a prioritized backlog with near-term deliverables and longer-term vision.
* Work directly with clients and client-facing teams to help them implement a successful Rewards program.

*You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.*


Qualifications:
**What you bring to the Virgin Pulse team****In order to represent the best of what we have to offer you come to us with a multitude of positive attributes including:**

* Six (6) or more years working as a product manager in an agile software development environment Domain experience in areas such as digital wellbeing, health, or strongly preferred. Preference given to candidates with direct experience in healthcare products and/or working with digital rewards.
* Minimum of 8 years of experience working in Product Management with at least 3 years as a Lead Product Manager. Experience in the management of product managers is a plus.

**You also take pride in offering the following Core Skills, Competencies, and Characteristics:**

* Experience with product design, service design, and/or design thinking a plus
* Experience with consumer and employee software a plus, especially in healthcare or wellbeing
* Excellent communication, collaboration, and presentation skills
* Experience with A/B testing, user testing, user interviews and conversions funnels strongly preferred.
* Knowledgeable in SaaS software
* Preference in those with a user-centered, data driven approach, with experience in product-led organizations.

*No candidate will meet every single desired qualification. If your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you can bring value to the role, we’d love to learn more about you!*

  

#LI-REMOTE **Why work at Virgin Pulse?**
We believe a career should provide competitive pay and benefits, a collaborative and supportive culture and cutting-edge technology and services. Virgin Pulse is an equal opportunity organization and is committed to diversity, inclusion, equity and social justice. To that end, we make a particular effort to recruit candidates from minoritized backgrounds to apply for open positions.

 *In compliance with all states and cities that require transparency of pay, the base compensation for this position ranges from $132,000 to $145,000 annually. Note that salary may vary based on location, skills, and experience. This position is eligible for 10% target bonus/variable compensation as well as health, dental, vision, mental health and other benefits.*

title: Product Manager
description:
**Product Manager**
===================


at BOLD View all jobs
United States (Remote)
We are looking for a Product Manager who is an technical expert at working with large language models. This role will be responsible for creating and prioritizing a backlog of generative AI projects at BOLD, authoring prompts and evaluating their results. This individual will also work with engineering to productize services based on these prompts, and measuring both the impact and quality of these systems in the context of the end-user.



**JOB DESCRIPTION**
-------------------


**ABOUT THIS TEAM**



This position works within the Horizontal product team. This team develops strategic, platform-spanning capabilities that address Bold’s customers around the world and across multiple product surfaces. This role works closely with backend engineering teams and partners with frontend teams. The AI Services PM is a new role on a new team responsible for accelerating Bold’s generative AI capabilities and strategy.


**WHAT YOU'LL DO**


* Develop requirements and manage the delivery of new product capabilities and offerings
* Work on internal platforms and customer-facing experiences
* Understand and create new best practices for working with large language models
* Elevate the capabilities of Bold’s product organization to conceptualize, create, and deliver product experiences powered by large language models.
* Own BOLD’s generative AI services strategy.


**WHAT YOU'LL NEED**


* Experience as a product manager or equivalent experience
* English proficiency
* Experience analyzing and working with qualitative and quantitative data
* Ability to develop, prioritize, and execute a product roadmap
* Experience personalizing product experiences for different customers
* Ability to unite and align stakeholders by synthesizing data and research into product strategy
* Being open to working till noon pacific time (9pm Polish time) 3 days per week. You would collaborate with geographically-distributed team members in US, India, and Poland.


**WHAT'S GOOD TO HAVE**


* Past experience working with User Research, User Experience Design, Data Science, Engineering, and other Product teams
* Prior technical experience or education
* Proficiency working with distributed teams
**BENEFITS**
------------


**OUTSTANDING COMPENSATION**


* Competitive salary
* Bi-annual bonus
* 401(k) plan with match
* Equity in company
* Flexible spending accounts (health, dependent care)
* Internet and home office reimbursement


**100% FULL HEALTH BENEFITS**


* Medical, dental, and vision (optional plans for your family)
* Life & long term disability insurance (optional)
* Mental health support and resources
* Wellness reimbursement (gym, health apps, etc.)
* Pet Insurance (optional)


**FLEXIBLE TIME AWAY**


* Flexible PTO
* Sick time policy
* Observed holidays
* 1-week PTO for the December holidays
**SALARY & REQUIREMENTS**
-------------------------


**STARTING PAY RANGE**



$120,000—$165,000 USD
**PAY TRANSPARENCY**



Individual pay is based on location, transferable skills, experience, and other relevant factors. This estimated range is based on the best available market data and factors, all of which are subject to change. This position may also be eligible for a bonus and medical, dental, vision, life, short and long-term disability insurance, 401(k), paid time off, sick leave, and paid holidays, all subject to applicable plan terms.


**ELIGIBLE HIRING LOCATIONS**



This position is 100% remote, work from home.



BOLD is able to hire full-time residents of the following U.S. States & Territories: Arizona, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Iowa, Kentucky, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, Minnesota, Nevada, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oklahoma, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Puerto Rico, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Virginia, Washington.



California Residents: Please see our privacy notice for more info on how we handle your data.


**ABOUT BOLD**
--------------


**WE TRANSFORM WORK LIVES**



As an established global organization, BOLD helps people find jobs. Our story is one of growth, success, and professional fulfillment. We create digital products that have empowered millions of people in 180 countries to build stronger resumes, cover letters, and CVs. The result of our work helps people interview confidently, finding the right job in less time. Our employees are experts, learners, contributors, and creatives.


**WE CELEBRATE AND PROMOTE DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION**



We value our position as an Equal Opportunity Employer. We hire based on qualifications, merit, and our business needs. We don't discriminate regarding race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin or citizenship, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other applicable characteristic protected by law.



Under San Francisco's Fair Chance Ordinance, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for the position.

title: Technical Product Manager-Platform
description:
*Mark43 is approved to hire in 40 states*, including*AL, AZ, CA-excluding San Francisco, CO, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, IA, ID, IL, IN, KS, LA, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, NE, NV, NH, NJ, NM, NY, NC, OH, OR, PA, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, and WI.* Before applying to a remote role, please ensure that *you are able to* perform the position*in one of the states listed above. State locations and specifics are subject to change as our hiring requirements shift.*


Mark43's mission is to empower communities and their governments with new technologies that improve the safety and quality of life for all. We build powerful, scalable, and elegant software that sets a new standard for the tools upon which our first responders rely. Our users are diverse, and we are therefore committed to embracing diversity of thought and experience within our team.



We are looking for a Technical Product Manager to join our team. **You** will be responsible for ensuring there is product alignment between customers, technology teams and the business. Working with a variety of stakeholders you will play a key role in maximizing the value delivered by our teams and ensuring that the backlog and sprint planning is consistently aligned with our roadmap priorities.

  


**What You'll Do**



If you were part of our team, here are some things you would have done last week:


* Connected with the customer to understand their needs
* Met with internal stakeholders to prioritize technology, growth and delivery initiatives
* Used your understanding of our end users and market demands to contribute to the product vision and roadmap
* Ensured the product backlog was clearly defined and prioritized

  


**What You'll Need**



We're looking for a Technical Product Manager with 4 years of professional experience within the software industry. The ideal candidate has worked alongside technical teams, communicated with internal stakeholders and interfaced with customers. A strong understanding of the SDLC and Agile methodologies is a must.



People who thrive on our team also tend to share the following characteristics:


* **Humble, open, and curious**. You understand that team is the key to success.
* **Excited, motivated and passionate.** You love solving problems and taking Managership.
* **Collaborative, empathetic and friendly.** You play well with others and enjoy speaking up on behalf of others.


Mark43 is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. As part of this commitment, we will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed, please email recruiting@Mark43.com requesting the accommodation.

title: Product Manager (OMS)
description:
Product Manager (OMS)

Location: San Francisco, CA

Duration: Long Term

PDMs in OMS (Order Mgt System) domain with Logistics and supply chain functional area.

Product Manager to drive initiatives in order management domain.

Requires understanding of one of the following areas

1. Drop Ship/marketplace

2. Customer delivery date optimization - Understand complex sourcing logic and work with lead product manager, engineers, UX to build product features.

Product Management is responsible for overseeing the lifecycle, from inception to retirement, of IT products that are delivered to our customers, business associates and consumers. The job family manages the relationship between WS business functions and IT to provide IT product and user experience solutions to meet the needs of the business.

Specific Responsibilities

* For project of diverse scope and complexity
* Serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization to provide product and user experience solutions to meet the business needs.
* Develops high level business requirements and translates them into functional specifications for the IT organization and manages changes to such specifications.
* Prepares requirements, specifications, business process and recommendations.
* Uses skills as a seasoned, experienced professional with a full understanding of industry practices and company policies and procedures.
* Resolves a wide range of issues in innovative and practical ways.
* Strong knowledge of product management best practices, functional design, and application delivery methodology
* Understands basic project management methodology.
* Customer focused with high quality standards.
* Demonstrates strong interpersonal, business communication and writing skills.
* Works on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors.
* Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.
* Networks with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise
* Strong decision-making capabilities will result in meeting schedules and/or functional goals of department/unit.
* Frequently interacts with customers, and/or functional peer group IC'S/managers, normally involving matters between department and other functional areas or internal customers.
* Regularly participates in a cooperative effort among members of a project team.
* May receive some instruction on day-to-day work but receives general instructions on new assignments and areas of higher complexity.

Job Type: Contract

Salary: Up to $65.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Product Manager (Recreation)
description:
**Remote opportunity**  

  

At DaySmart Software, we are a dynamic and energetic SaaS company that specializes in providing best-in-class scheduling and business management solutions to companies across the globe.  

  

As we continue to grow, we are looking for a **Product Manager** to support our DaySmart Recreation Software, which services a variety of customers, from NHL teams to indoor sports centers, school districts and municipal parks and rec departments. Our solution helps these businesses and government organizations manage their resources for: leagues, classes, camps, parties, corporate events, and other programming to help promote health and enrich lives.  

  

**As a Product Manager, you will:*** Drive the execution of all processes in the product lifecycle, including product and market research, competitor analysis, planning, positioning, requirements and roadmap development, and product launch
* Develop detailed product scope documents and oversee implementation from ideation to launch through working cross-functionally
* Create product strategy documents that describe business cases, high-level use cases, technical requirements, revenue, and ROI
* Translate scopes into detailed requirements for prototyping and final development for design and engineering teams
* Assess current competitor offerings and seek opportunities for differentiation
* Analyze market data to develop go-to-market strategy
* Closely analyze customer needs and gain a deep understanding of customer pain points and areas of improvement
* Comfortable wearing multiple hats to drive progress and balance resources to ensure success
* Exceptional writing and editing skills, combined with strong presentation and public speaking skills

**Required skills:*** At least 2+ years experience of demonstrated Product Management experience in the SaaS industry
* Exceptional organization and communication skills and experience with asynchronous written-first culture combined with strong presentation and public speaking skills
* High effectiveness in managing cross-functional teams
* Based in North America
* Strong experience in a dynamic product management role
* Proven success in overseeing all elements of the product development lifecycle
* High effectiveness in managing cross-functional teams
* Experience in delivering finely tuned product strategy

**Preferred skills:*** Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent)
* Experience with, or eagerness to learn, the problems fitness studio owners, instructors, and customers face
* Previous experience using JIRA, Notion & Figma
* Previous experience in Health, Fitness & Wellness
* Demonstrable knowledge of Agile Software practices

  

DaySmart is committed to creating a diverse employee environment and is a proud equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.
