title: Product Manager II (Web3)
description:
QuickNode is a cloud-based infrastructure company that powers the blockchain ecosystem.

Our mission is to be the indispensable utility that empowers companies and innovators globally to build next-generation, Web3 enabled businesses & applications using blockchain technology. QuickNode is backed by some of the world's best investors including Tiger Global, Y Combinator, SoftBank, and the Seven Seven Six Fund. The QuickNode team has over 120 people maintaining high performance global data infrastructure for amazing customers serving billions of requests daily.

We are a global remote/hybrid company HQ'd in Miami, Florida.
### **The Role**



We are seeking a talented and experienced Product Manager with a deep understanding of the Web3 and blockchain space to drive the development and evolution of our platform. As a QuickNode Product Manager, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the roadmap, prioritizing features, and delivering exceptional products that meet the needs of our diverse user base. We're looking for a self-starter, strong communicator, with a deep sense of ownership to help build the program from the early stages to scale.


### **What You'll Do**


* Develop and articulate a comprehensive product strategy aligned with QuickNode's vision and market opportunities in the Web3 and blockchain landscape.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and prioritize features, enhancements, and integrations based on customer feedback, market research, and industry trends.Work closely with engineering, design, and business development teams to translate product requirements into detailed user stories, specifications, and acceptance criteria.
* Champion a user-centric approach to product development, ensuring intuitive workflows, seamless interactions, and delightful user experiences across all QuickNode offerings.
* Monitor competitive dynamics, emerging technologies, and regulatory developments to identify opportunities and threats, informing strategic decision-making and product innovation.
* Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and success metrics to measure product performance, track progress against goals, and drive continuous improvement.
* Communicate product vision, progress updates, and feature releases to internal stakeholders, external partners, and the broader community through various channels.
* Engage with customers, gather feedback, and advocate for their needs and pain points, fostering strong relationships and driving customer satisfaction and retention.
* Serve as a subject matter expert (SME) and evangelist for QuickNode products, representing the company at industry events, conferences, and meetups, and contributing thought leadership content.

### **What You'll Bring**


* Proven track record of 4+ years in product management roles, with a focus on DeFi, Web3, blockchain or related technologies.
* Deep understanding of blockchain fundamentals, decentralized networks, smart contracts, and related protocols (e.g., Ethereum, Bitcoin, Polkadot).
* Strong analytical skills and data-driven decision-making abilities, with proficiency in product analytics tools and methodologies.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and inspire cross-functional teams and external stakeholders.
* Entrepreneurial mindset, with a bias for action and a passion for driving impact in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Experience with agile development methodologies, product management frameworks (e.g., Lean Startup, Design Thinking), and project management tools (e.g., Jira, Asana).
* Prior experience in developer tools, infrastructure-as-a-service (IaaS), or platform-as-a-service (PaaS) businesses is a plus.

### **Bonus**


* Experience in Blockchain


The base salary range and level for this position are $150,000 - 165,000 base USD per year and level P3. International ranges, in local currency, will be discussed during the hiring process with applicable candidates. This role is eligible for a quarterly bonus tied to company and individual goal achievement. We consider years of experience, level of proficiency in job function, the technical competencies required and location when determining base salary ranges for positions and levels.


The QuickNode compensation philosophy includes pillars to ensure fair and unbiased compensation for all employees. To design and deliver total reward offerings that are employee-centric. To offer a competitive benefit package in all locations where we operate. To prioritize attracting and retaining the best talent globally. To maintain a high-performing and flexible way of working.

During the hiring process, we are committed to discussing compensation openly and honestly. We encourage candidates to share their salary expectations and requirements early, allowing for an individualized discussion. We know that our total rewards practices impact the lives and wellbeing of our employees. Therefore, we will never stop learning about the market, our business, your needs, and how best to achieve our goals through thoughtful and data-driven practices. If you have any questions or require further information about the compensation for this position, please don't hesitate to reach out to your Recruiter.

We at Quicknode are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Product Manager - Shared Services
description:
Cribl does differently.



What does that mean? It means we are a serious company that doesn't take itself too seriously; and we're looking for people who love to get stuff done, and laugh a bit along the way. We're growing rapidly - looking for collaborative, curious, and motivated team members who are passionate about putting customers first. As a remote-first company we believe in empowering our employees to do their best work, wherever they are.



As the data engine for IT and Security many of the biggest names in the most demanding industries trust Cribl to solve their most pressing data needs. Ready to do the best work of your career? Join the herd and unlock your opportunity.

**Why You'll Love This Role**



The Cribl Product Management teams sits at the center of the entire company, responsible for ensuring that the product strategy and execution aligns closely with our customers' needs and company values. Cribl Product Management teams are more than just backlog babysitters, Cribl Product Management goes beyond delivery of features and ensures that we are creating value, lowering barriers of entry and accelerating adoption through the entire customer journey. Cribl Product Managers are truly cross-functional and require technical depth, value user experience and work alongside marketing, sales, services and many other teams to continue Cribl's leading position in the IT, Security and Observability markets.

  


**As An Active Member Of Our Team, You Will ...**


* Guide the product roadmap by living in the product - we're a hands on keyboard PM team
* Work across the Product team to build consensus on experiences and services that will be shared by our entire product portfolio - PM is not a solo sport here at Cribl!
* Work closely with our UX, guidance and engineering teams to develop the best experience for a variety of personas and experience levels across our product portfolio
* Work with the volumes of data we have about our products and users to build plans based on hard data with an eye on how to improve over time
* Align with field teams and customers on key services and experiences to grow the value of our products.
* Always be working with customers, we are nothing without our customers
* Help guide and learn from our team of experts in engineering and our sales teams. We have one of (if not THE) best field teams in the business!

  


**If You Got It - We Want It**


* 5 or more years in a Technical Product Manager role
* Experience working in the Enterprise Software Space
* Background building and owning cloud services
* Deep experience in customer journey mapping and working with User Experience teams building flows across growing product portfolios
* Must be a strong communicator: writer and reader. As a remote first company this is our primary way of collaborating.
* You love being a technical Product Manager - you spend time building labs, learning new technologies and are never satisfied with what you know today
* Able to demo product at a high level as well as go into the details - not just why but how it was done

  


**Preferred Skills**


* Experience working in remote first companies and know how to navigate a large distributed team
* Background working with Enterprise data products
* Experience with Streaming data products
* Experience working with products that are deployed across multiple types of environments and infrastructure (Cloud, on-prem, hybrid)
* No fear! Speak your mind
* Good jokes, or maybe better, bad jokes
* A Love for goats

  


**Salary Range ($160,000 - $200,000)**



The salary for this role is dependent on geographic location. The salary offered within the range described will be based on the individual candidate's job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. In addition to a competitive salary, Cribl also offers a generous benefits package which includes health, dental, vision, short-term disability, and life insurance, paid holidays and paid time off, a fertility treatment benefit, 401(k), equity, and eligibility for a discretionary company-wide bonus.



#LI-JB1

**Bring Your Whole Self**  

Diversity drives innovation, enables better decisions to support our customers, and inspires change for the better. We're building a culture where differences are valued and welcomed, and we work together to bring out the best in each other. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.



Interested in joining the Cribl herd? Learn more about the smartest, funniest, most passionate goats you'll ever meet at cribl.io/about-us.

title: Product Manager
description:
**About the Opportunity**


Small businesses are the backbone of our economy. Today, more than ever these businesses are struggling to survive. Our mission is to help small businesses grow, make their lives easier and their businesses more efficient. We automate commerce for these businesses, so they can spend more time growing and less time dealing with operational hassles. Our SaaS platform processes over $7B of GMV each year and powers over 5,000 ecommerce companies. If you're passionate about solving real-world problems, building cool $hit and helping small businesses win, come join us!


*Webgility is fully remote in the United States with offices in Scottsdale, AZ and Indore, India. We embrace flexibility and you can work from anywhere in the US.*


**Why Work for Us**


We're a fast-paced company with a diverse team of smart, ambitious and fun people. We want to make a difference in the lives of our customers because we're not happy with the status quo. We empower our teams with data, tools and big ideas so they can truly transform their careers. We offer many opportunities for professional growth and we're not shy to express ourselves and our creativity. We're a group of diverse professionals located across the US and India.


At Webgility, we value strong, positive relationships within our teams, our customer base, business partners and our communities. The ideal candidate will demonstrate a passion for product and technology, but also be a strong communicator willing to collaborate. We are looking for someone who is comfortable in fast-paced environments with competing priorities, excited by collaboration and driven to solve problems for small businesses!


**The Impact You Will Make**


* You'll own the strategy, execution and delivery of Webgility's Ecommerce accounting products to drive revenue growth
* Drive the go-to-market strategy for key product launches and evangelize the product across all channels
* Own the entire customer experience lifecycle and collaborate with marketing, sales, and customer success teams
* Be the voice of the customer in driving product features to delivery with the support of a remote development team
* Become an Ecommerce and Accounting expert and articulate the product strategy and roadmap for the entire team, partnering closely with key stakeholders, both internally and externally
* Work closely with the product team, architects, developers and designers to prioritize and deliver on high-impact initiatives in inventory, payments, fulfillment, supply chain, and much more.
* Research and validate new opportunities through user surveys, data analysis, user testing, competitive analysis and interviews
* Identify and measure key success metrics for customer and business impact.


**What You Bring to the Table**


* 3-5 years of proven product management experience, preferred to be in a SaaS Ecommerce or Accounting environment
* 3-5 years of experience in Retail, Ecommerce, Supply Chain Management, Business Analytics or Finance
* Deep curiosity and customer empathy
* Experience in working with remote development teams in India
* Highly quantitative and enjoy analyzing lots of complex data
* Strong process driver with expertise in Jira and/or other project management software
* Strong product management and technical skills having comfort in a fast-paced, Agile Scrum environment
* Exemplary communication skills, including the ability to distill, refine and socialize key findings into stakeholder needs
* Ability to manage competing priorities, make recommendations, be able to compromise and develop new ideas with stakeholders, and be able to deliver a consensus while keeping customer needs at heart
* Love working in teams and not shy to roll up your sleeves
* Proven track record of taking ownership and driving measurable outcomes with a history of successful delivery of large-scale projects with high-quality, while managing the entire life-cycle
* Self-starter and able to motivate teams to deliver initiatives from conception to launch
* Strong academic track record (MSc or PhD preferred) in computer science, mathematics, operations research or a related discipline
* Mush have 4 hours overlapping working hours with India team ( 8am-12am EST)


**What we offer**


* Competitive base salary range of $120-140k (DOE)
* 20% annual bonus opportunity paid quarterly
* Unlimited Paid Time Off
* Competitive healthcare benefits
* Twelve paid holidays and four mental wellness days each year
* 401(k) tax-deferred savings plan
* $100 monthly tax-free stipend for phone and wifi expenses

title: Director, Program Management - Product PMO
description:
**Director, Program Management (Product PMO)**  


  

**About Us**  

  

We are BetMGM. We are revolutionizing sports betting and online gaming in the United States. We are a partnership between two powerhouse organizations—MGM Resorts International and Entain Group. You know our name through our exciting portfolio of brands including BetMGM Sportsbook, Borgata online, Party Casino and Party Poker. We aim to bring our ideas into action and find ways to deliver the best quality in gaming platforms.  

  

We understand that each card in the deck plays a unique role in any given hand, just as our employees each play a unique role in accomplishing our goals as a company. We strive to create a culture of empathy where our employees feel valued, heard, and comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work. We want to build a product and a workplace that reflect the communities we serve so we approach our work fearlessly, take responsibility when we get it wrong, and ante-up again. We play to win, and we are all-in together.  

  

We were recognized as one of Glassdoor’s “Best Places to Work”.
**About the Role**
As a key member of the Program Management team at BetMGM the Director, Program Management (Product PMO) will be responsible for the BetMGM product portfolio and roadmap planning, ongoing feature activation and continued prioritization of the portfolio in alignment with the company strategy. The Director, Program Management will act as the liaison between all BetMGM Product Areas, the Entain PMO and Product and the BetMGM PMO team to ensure successful and timely execution of the product roadmap. The Director will also be the key champion for driving operational excellence via standardization and documentation and continuous improvement of PDLC and SDLC.  

The ideal candidate will have a passion for driving and enabling change with a strong foundation of digital product management and program management experience. This key role will work with senior team members across product, product design, user research, engineering, compliance, and operations to manage the regular product roadmap planning process, facilitate the prioritization process, and collaborate with the PMO Process team to continuously advance the planning and delivery process.
The Director, Program Management should be a dynamic leader and highly impactful communicator, with an excellent ability to present to and gather feedback from senior stakeholders. They should contribute meaningfully to creating a culture of excellence and driving the practice of program management and innovation, helping BetMGM create the future of sports and entertainment.
  

**Responsibilities**
* Manage and gain alignment on roadmap planning processes and delivery across all product verticals and Entain.
* Facilitate the regular roadmap planning and prioritization process and ensure all submissions adhere to the highest quality standards.
* Drive adaption and continuous improvement of PDLC and SDLC.
* Define the strategic goals for the Product PMO team based on the needs of the business and provide direct line management to departments program and projects managers by setting performance objectives and providing guidance and coaching to ensure set objectives are met.
* Build strong relationships with all BetMGM Product leads and partner with them to understand inefficiencies in the planning process, eliminate any roadblocks and drive improvement of any roadmap related processes.
* Develop and maintain a regular project and portfolio status reporting cadence and process for BetMGM in alignment with Entain.
* Monitoring and actively managing project deviations to resolve issues and bring at risk projects back on track.
* Create and deliver senior stakeholder presentations, summarizing the BetMGM Product roadmap including strategic initiatives and key focus areas.
* Oversee and drive a robust change control process to enable risk mitigation and enable transparent communication when significant impact is expected.


**Essential Functions**
* Must be able to stand or sit and operate computers and other technological devices for extended periods of time


**Qualifications**
* Experience in Product Management and/or managing Product portfolios required.
* Substantial experience of working with PDLC, SDLS and both Agile and Waterfall project management methodologies and associated tools and techniques.
* Proven authority and responsibility for effectively and efficiently managing complex change portfolios.
* Proven strong performance in prior project management and/or delivery roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.
* Proven people leadership experience, especially in building, leading and motivating teams.
* Willingness to act as mentor and coach to build on colleague’s strengths and improve on weaknesses, acting as one who listens and gives honest feedback.
* Ability to successfully work across cultures and locations, driving team cohesion and effectiveness.
* Experience developing a function or department in a fast-paced environment preferred.
* Ability to inspire via superior communication & interpersonal skills are required, experience communicating and interacting with executive teams required.
* Excellent communicator who is able to get one’s message understood clearly by adopting a range of styles and techniques appropriate to the audience and the nature of the information.
* Experience using tools such as Jira, Smartsheet, Asana, Trello, etc. to optimize team efficiency.
* Willingness for occasional travel to colleagues that are located across multiple offices.


**About Our Culture**  

  

Building BetMGM from the ground up takes effort, energy, and teamwork, but that’s what will make leading this industry all the more satisfying. We stay focused on our main goal with the help of these four company pillars:
* Believe in Your Game – Take your shot! There’s a freedom to explore ideas usually only start-ups are lucky enough to experience.
* Backed by the Best - With our expertise—merged with that of our world-class investors—we have the opportunity to take this business, and ourselves, farther than anyone has ever imagined.
* Do What’s Right - We operate with clarity and simplicity, always doing the right thing by our customers and each other, standing shoulder to shoulder every day.
* Hustle Hard - Our combined commitment and ambition is what drives us to create some of the most innovative products in the industry.

**What We Offer**
  

As a valued employee, we’re committed to giving you the resources and support you need. We offer Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Commuter Benefits, Paid Time Off, Holidays, Employee Resource Groups and more!  

  

**Gaming Compliance**  

  

Candidate must comply with and support the company’s responsible gambling policies, procedures and initiatives.  

  

This job description is not an exclusive or exhaustive list of duties a person in this position may be asked to perform from time to time.  

  

***BetMGM LLC is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, age, marital status, national origin, sexual orientation, citizenship status, veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning recruitment, hiring, compensation, benefits, training, termination, promotions, or any other condition of employment or career development. If your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you’ve got what it takes, we’d love to learn more about you.***  

  

*If you need assistance or accommodation with your application due to a disability, you may contact us at recruitment@betmgm.com.*  

#LI-MH1

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
Love what you do. It’s a core value that drives our business. Plus, we’re pretty fun.  

  

We also believe people do their best work where they feel most comfortable so the work location of this position is flexible. However, all candidates must be eligible and able to work in the United States, without sponsorship. **About Brad’s Deals****Our Why**—At Brad's Deals, we believe there is a better way to shop. It goes beyond price. It's the value in connecting with consumers on what's important so we can deliver the best savings and choices every day.**Our Team**—We're real people, really helping. We call ourselves Brad Ambassadors—where passion and expertise create the magic in our mission to 'create the consumer advantage.**Our Promise**—Consumers first, always.  

Brad’s Deals is seeking an experienced Product Manager to redefine the user experiences across our website, apps and distribution platforms. This role will be responsible for managing various high-priority initiatives and moving them through the entire product lifecycle in close collaboration with all relevant stakeholders.
### **What You’ll Do**

* Develop and execute successful product roadmaps and initiatives (B2C, potentially B2B) to create the best online shopping experiences for our users.
* Manage initiatives throughout the product management lifecycle which includes but is not limited to: identifying problems and opportunities, facilitating problem solving, determining appropriate metrics, setting scope, writing stories, testing, roll-out strategy and content management strategy.
* Leverage research and data to inform decisions and identify opportunities.
* Lead cross-functional teams and facilitate decision-making.
* Quickly identify and eliminate roadblocks that impede progress to achieving both short term and long term goals.

### **What You’ll Bring**

* 4+ years of relevant product management experience with at least two (2) years experience in e-commerce.
* Proven experience leading cross-functional teams to deliver B2C products that users love and that move metrics in a timely manner.
* Excellent research skills, with proven experience leveraging data and experimentation to define products that make an impact (including background in experimentation).
* Proven ability to balance user, business and technical considerations.

**Our Story**
Started by Brad in 2001, our purpose remains the same to help create smarter shopping habits and to **keep it real** with expert lifestyle and financial advice.  

Our culture **embraces diversity** with different talents, experiences, and backgrounds that help us be **exceptional together**. With competitive pay, full health benefits, 401K profit sharing, plenty of paid time off including a paid sabbatical, and creative perks, we also believe in work-life integration and continued learning.  

As one of the 50 Best Places to Work, headquartered in the heart of Chicago’s River North neighborhood, we partner with over 2,500 retailers to help 5.5 million consumers save more every month. So if you want to **challenge the ordinary** and **love what you do**, we want to hear from you. **Brad’s Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion****'**Embrace diversity’ is one of our core values because our differences make us stronger together. To make the world a more inclusive and safe place, we start within our company to intentionally lead with equal opportunities. We encourage the value that unique talents, ethnicities, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences bring to our company, our employees, and our future applicants. We welcome all applicants, whether or not you meet every qualification, to share your unique talents with us. Read more about this here. **"Love what you do" and our Commitment to your Personal Growth**
At Brad’s Deals, our culture invites creativity, passion, and career empowerment to help you thrive. We champion employees to create their personal paths to success and are proud to be above the industry average in employee promotions earned every year. An entrepreneurial spirit supports our commitment to employee growth and being exceptional together with unique talents, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences.* *Please note: We are a remote-first culture, so our hiring teams will be conducting virtual interviews with potential candidates.*

  

If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open positions.

title: Product Operations Manager
description:
**Formstack improves people’s lives with practical solutions to their everyday work. We are looking for the next Stacker to help us accomplish this mission.**
Formstack is a **remote-first** company with team members who live and work across the U.S., Canada, and the globe. We offer more than just a job; we provide a community where you can learn, grow, and thrive your way. Join a dynamic and diverse team that values relationships as much as results. Come build what matters with Formstack. **Who You Are**
We’re looking for someone who loves to empower those around them. We’re passionate about valuing our collective genius, embracing change, and prioritizing growth. This role will live and breathe those core values. Coming in with some Product Management experience is a huge plus because you’ve experienced the challenges you’ll be helping solve. This person will love to get lost in the tools, processes, and frameworks we use and have an endless desire to improve how we use them. They're open to change and look for ways to adapt our teams to best solve the challenges they face. **What You Will Do**
As a Product Operations Manager, you will work closely with our team to make them more effective through processes, playbooks, and the product tools we use. You will work closely with the product marketing and customer-facing teams to help launch features as effectively as possible. You will proactively identify and fill knowledge gaps with a portion of the work you will define from scratch. As a servant leader, you’ll seek opportunities to drive alignment, communication, processes, and scale across the company.
### **How You Will Succeed**

+ Own and optimize product processes, including documentation, training, and enablement, to enhance team efficiency and effectiveness.
+ Provide training and enablement for the product team on tools, frameworks, and best practices.
+ Manage product tech stack and enablement to ensure effective utilization by our team.
+ Bring consistency to our Product Documentation process: Assistance in feature, release, and internal enablement documentation.
+ Lead the feedback and roadmap processes, ensuring the conversion of feedback into actionable insights and maintaining strategic alignment with company objectives while accommodating shifting priorities.
+ Coordinate product launches and sunsets, collaborating with cross-functional teams to monitor progress, identify risks, and manage dependencies to ensure smooth execution. This includes the execution of product communications.
+ Training & Enablement: Training product team when onboarding and ongoing training for processes and tools across the dept.
+ Lead the process and tools required for Product-to-Customer Communication: How do we get a target and communicate to customers regarding sunsets, policy changes, and product updates.
+ Assist the Product team with Product copywriting and messaging.
+ Improve the availability and quality of data to drive the best product decisions.
+ Manage the integration of newly acquired products and companies into our ecosystem.

### **What We Are Looking For**

+ 2+ years of Product Operations experience working with cross-functional teams in an agile environment.
+ Collect, organize, and analyze product data to ensure that the entire organization uses it to the best of its ability.
+ Manage the product tech stack while assisting team members in using each tool.
+ Success in creating, collaborating with, and carrying out product strategies alongside other departments, such as sales and marketing.
+ Is a strong and proactive decision-maker who effectively balances ambiguity, available data, speed, and iteration. Effectively communicates with and influences cross-functional stakeholders.
+ Implement and track experiments related to product ops.
+ Support and drive key decisions related to all aspects of product ops.
+ Ability to manage the product tech stack, becoming the defacto expert to assist team members in using each tool.
+ Preferred experience working with product tools such as Productboard, Pendo, Jira, Monday, and Zapier.
+ Impeccable documentation and organization skills.
+ Comfortable working with customer and product data.
+ Experience training and enabling others with training sessions, documentation, playbooks, and video.
+ Comfortable working in a remote environment.
+ Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English required)

+ Salary Range: $100,000 - $140,000 USD/year
+ Plus a potential annual bonus of up to 10% of the salary.
+ This is a target starting cash range for a candidate who meets the minimum qualifications for this role. The final cash pay for this role will depend on a variety of factors, including a specific candidate’s experience, qualifications, skills, and projected impact.
+ **\\*\\*\\*This is a remote position\\*\\*\\***

$100,000 - $140,000 a year
**What Formstack Offers for Full-Time Employees in the US and Canada:*** Competitive health plans, Dental, Vision, Disability, and Life Insurance Benefits for US and Canadian full-time employees.
* Monthly Health & Wellness and Technology stipends
* Half-day Fridays
* Unlimited PTO for all employees.
* 401k & Roth w/ safe harbor match (the US and Canada)
* The most up-to-date technology, including company-issued Macs, the latest software, and other tools needed to excel at your job
* Company-paid conferences and extended learning opportunities
* Yearly company and team gatherings

 **Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every qualification. Formstack is dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. if you’re excited about this role, but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.** **Formstack is an equal-opportunity employer. We are passionately committed to equitable hiring and boldly dedicated to diversity in our work and staff. We do not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices based on actual or perceived race, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related conditions), age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, uniform service member status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law. Women, people of color, bilingual and bicultural individuals, LGBTQ+ persons, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply.** ***All data collected in our application process, from resume collection to application questions, is used for recruitment purposes only.*** We will store it in our applicant tracking system, Lever, and will not share this data with anyone else. We will keep your data until the role is filled and only continue to store it if we feel you may fit future roles.

title: Product Manager I
description:
At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web3 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.



There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.



Ready to #LiveCrypto? Who you are:


* You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there.
* You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0.
* You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.
* You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.
* You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.
* You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone.
Coinbase Product Managers play a critical role in building the next generation of crypto products. You will work closely with engineering, design and cross-functional teams to build products and new experiences. You’ll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of cryptocurrency and help us achieve our mission of creating an open financial system for the world

What you'll be doing:
* Own product development from conception to launch
* Collaborate cross-functionally with engineering, design and cross-functional teams to develop and steer product roadmap
* Define and analyze metrics to guide product development
* Align teams on a shared vision and steer execution on that vision.

What we look for in you:
* 3+ years of product management experience
* Exceptional interpersonal communication, relationship management and organizational skills
* Deep analytical, prioritization and problem solving skills
* Previous experience working in software product management
* Demonstrated passion for cryptocurrency, financial markets, and the Coinbase mission
* An entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to succeed in a fast-paced environment

ID: G2027


Pay Transparency Notice: Depending on your work location, the target annual salary for this position can range as detailed below. Full time offers from Coinbase also include target bonus + target equity + benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)).
Pay Range:
$140,250—$165,000 USD### **Commitment to Equal Opportunity**



Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view Pay Transparency, Employee Rights and Know Your Rights notices by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.



Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please complete this intake form to let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.


### **Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants**



Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required. For US applicants only, by submitting your application you are agreeing to arbitration of disputes as outlined.

  




Benefits at Coinbase

* Medical Plan, Dental and Vision Plan with generous employee contributions
* Health Savings Account with company contributions each pay period
* Disability and Life Insurance
* 401(k) plan with company match
* Wellness Stipend
* Mobile/Internet Reimbursement
* Remote-First Stipend
* Connections Stipend
* Volunteer Time Off
* Fertility Counseling and Benefits
* 18 weeks paid Parental Leave
* The option of getting paid in digital currency

title: Product Manager, Safety (Mapping)
description:
Description: *CENTEGIX® is the industry leader in incident response solutions. CENTEGIX® innovates technology to empower and protect people, and leaders nationwide trust our safety solutions to provide peace of mind. Our award-winning CrisisAlert™ platform is the fastest and easiest way for staff to request help in any emergency, from the everyday to the extreme. Our Internet-of-things (IoT) platform utilizes a powerful blend of hardware, software, and wireless technologies to ensure campus-wide rapid, accurate, and reliable communication of emergency incidents. Instant communication through visual cues and audio integration enables rapid response to any incident or crisis, anywhere on a campus. Because in a crisis: Every. Second. Matters.*

**Purpose**


We are looking for a skilled Product Leader to join our remote team at CENTEGIX. As a Product Leader, you will take charge of steering the strategic direction of our assigned products, with a primary focus on overseeing the product management of Safety Blueprint. Safety Blueprint is a cutting-edge web-based mapping application designed to empower customers in managing facility maps and asset data crucial for emergency response scenarios.


In this role, you will drive innovation and customer-centric solutions within education, healthcare, government, and various other vertical markets. You will be instrumental in shaping the roadmap, prioritizing features, and ensuring the product meets the evolving needs of our diverse customer base. This position offers a unique opportunity to lead a critical aspect of our product portfolio, driving impact and advancing safety solutions across multiple sectors.

**Position Responsibilities**

* Lead by owning the product vision, market offering, product roadmap, requirements, and priorities.
* Define product features and capability development via prioritization process with engineering.
* Incorporate customer requirements from various feedback sources including (customers, sales, solutions engineering, competitors, etc.)
* Communicate the vision and direction of Safety Blueprint internally and externally.
* Coordinate with sales, marketing, channel partners and operations to develop go-to-market plans.
* Maintain expert-level knowledge of current capabilities and the product roadmap.
* Collaborate with internal and external customers via the use of mockups, wireframes, and prototypes to iterate on product direction.


Requirements:
* 3+ years of experience in a technical, product-related role, such as engineering and/or product management
* Comfortable with ambiguity and biased to action without continuous, direct oversight
* Software background ideally with geospatial and SaaS based products
* Ability to travel up to 20% to visit customers, attend conferences, and critical meetings
* Bachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering or Business

**What’s in it for you?**

* Remote first work environment; we offer workplace flexibility
* Participation in company wide discretionary bonus
* 15 days paid time off
* 11 paid holidays
* Monthly device(s) reimbursement
* Affordable health coverage (medical, dental, vision)
* 401(k) Plan with 4% employer contribution to help you plan for the future
* Employee Referral Bonus
* Charitable Program Match


CENTEGIX is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at CENTEGIX are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

title: Product Manager
description:
Job Summary:
Do you have a “do whatever it takes” attitude and an entrepreneurial mindset? Do you have ardent curiosity and a desire to be a “change leader”? Ready for a big challenge with a mission you can believe in? Come join the Product Management team at PPLSI!  

  

PPLSI (aka LegalShield) has been making legal and identity services available to all for over 50 years, and we are proud of the work we have done, but we are ready to disrupt our own business. To do this, we are looking for an innovative Product Manager to join our team and work on our customer-facing mobile and web legal applications.  

  

The Product Management department is integral to the successful development and management of our key flagship products. We are the connecting force among multiple departments, vendors, and partners, especially working hand-in-hand with our software engineering, quality assurance, design, and business partner teams to ensure exceptional products and features for our customers in a timely and presentable style.  

  

If you thrive in a collaborative environment of talented, supportive, results-driven, and customer-focused teammates, this is the place for you!
Responsibilities:* Foster a close relationship with users of the product, and leverage feedback from multiple sources to help prioritize roadmap decisions; balance feedback from users with the business needs of the company, and make the right trade-off decisions.
* Effectively think through and specify complex functionality.
* Use data analytics tools not only to analyze results of projects, but to proactively gather insights from ad hoc queries, and to use those insights to drive product recommendations and set realistic goals for upcoming projects.
* Think creatively and pragmatically about the best way to utilize limited resources.
* Be an expert with respect to external marketplace solutions.
* Create, design, and format product requirement documentation including personas, user journeys, wireframes, process flows, and other information or processes needed to describe required system changes for development, QA (quality assurance), and other internal customers.
* Perform product design, prototype, and live demos to internal and external stakeholders.
* Partner with the software engineering team to ensure operational and people readiness prior to product or feature launch.
* Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, establishing personal networks, and/or participating in relevant professional societies.
* Act as a leader within the company.


Qualifications:* 3+ years’ professional experience as a Product Manager
* Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent industry experience
* Demonstrated success defining and launching excellent products that customers love
* Technical background, with experience in Scrum or Agile methodologies
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* High emotional intelligence and empathy
* Success when working in situations with high ambiguity
* Strategic mindset
* High ambition and capacity to bring your product to “the next level”
* Excitement and comfort in a quickly-changing environment
* Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority


#LI-Remote
Department:
9315 Product Management
Time Type:
Full time  

Commitment to Equal Opportunity
PPLSI conforms to all the laws, statutes, and regulations concerning equal employment opportunities. We strongly encourage women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and veterans to apply to all of our job openings. We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a protected veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. We prohibit retaliation against individuals who bring forth any concerns, orally or in writing, to the employer or the government, or against any individuals who assist or participate in the investigation of any concerns or otherwise oppose discrimination.
If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process, please contact Human Resources at: humanresources@legalshieldcorp.com.

title: Associate Product Owner
description:
At First Advantage, people are at the heart of everything we do. This mindset spans from our customers and partners, to our greatest strength: our team members. Join us if you want to say “hello” to a rewarding career, and pave the way as an industry leader in mission-critical background screening solutions to some of the most recognized Fortune 100 and Global 500 brands.

**Who We Are**


We are on the frontline of the Great Onboarding, empowering organizations to Hire Smarter. Onboard Faster™. First Advantage (Nasdaq: FA) is an HR Tech company that delivers innovative solutions and insights to enable our clients to manage risk and hire the best talent. Leveraging an advanced global technology platform, First Advantage builds fully scalable, configurable screening programs that meet the unique needs of over 33,000 clients across the world. Headquartered in Atlanta, GA and with a globally distributed workforce spanning 28 locations with 5,500+ employees, First Advantage performs over 93 million screens in over 200 countries and territories annually.

**Who You Are**


We are looking for a team member who considers themselves:

* **Self-motivated** – you love to lead others but are also ready to “roll up your sleeves." You can spearhead a project and see it through from start to completion.
* **A team player** – you navigate cross-functional teams and work well with team members across groups toward a common goal. While you are an independent contributor, you appreciate the value in collaboration.
* **An innovator** – you see gaps in current processes or workflows as an opportunity to improve and try something new.
* **A lifelong learner** – you seek opportunities to learn and upskill, you understand the importance of thorough and secure screenings, and are interested in the Human Capital sector and the confluence of people, process, and technology.

**What You'll Do**


The **Associate Product Owner** will work alongside our leaders across FA, and will receive on-the-job training to become accountable for the end-to-end lifecycle of portfolio of products. Specifically, this individual will oversee and operationally support strategic clients as related to their vision, charter, planning, requirements, development, testing, integration (FADV or partner systems), deployment, usage, adoption, client satisfaction and continuous improvement. The Associate Product Owner will facilitate and plan all aspects of strategic clients onboarding, and will actively drive the activities of the corresponding teams who will build, integrate or enhance any new or existing products in their respective portfolio aligned to the product roadmap using Agile methodology. Additionally, they will coordinate & initiate appropriate vertical / product strategy and action planning, coupled with the right SWAT POD with QA, Scrum Master, Architects and Developers. They will maximize product reusability and repeatability & focus on revenue growth to enable new logo strategic client acquisitions, improved customer experience & teamwork. In more detail, the person in this role will:

* Work closely with Product leadership to plan and coordinate the execution and delivery of the product roadmap.
* Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to translate business requirements, breaking them down into epics, themes, and features and creating actionable user stories with acceptance criteria for the design team to conceptualize and the development team to implement.
* Validate specifications with internal and external stake-holders to ensure they are consistent with articulated business requirements and deliver the expected results.
* Actively measure and analyze existing products for opportunities to innovate and improve.
* Document new features and communicate functionality to end users.
* Integrate performance metrics, usability studies, research and market analysis into product requirements to enhance user satisfaction.
* Demonstrate a willingness to experiment, iterate, innovate, and fail quickly.
* Communicate effectively and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders across multiple functions and geographic locations.
* Keep abreast of the competitive landscape, industry trends, and digital innovation within the marketplace.

**What You May Need to Be Successful:**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience (technical or analytical field a plus)
* 0 to 1 year experience, knowledge of business analysis, requirements gathering, etc.
* Familiarity with product and software development tools, techniques and agile methodologies
* A passionate commitment to user-centered design and development
* Strong listening and question-based knowledge gathering skills
* Ability to synthesize and analyze data from a variety of sources, identify issues, draw conclusions, and craft solutions
* Solid grasp of web design principles and an understanding of front-end web technologies
* Excellent problem-solving, organizational, analytical, and communication skills.


This is a fully remote position (Work from Home) based in the US.

**Why First Advantage is Your Next Big Career Move**


First Advantage is going through a technology transformation! We are looking for experts who are excited to work with advanced technologies and provide best-in-class user experiences, drive the development and deployment of scalable solutions, and smoothly guide our agile teams and clients through meaningful changes as we continue to expand our impact.

**Additional benefits offered to our eligible people include:**

* Ability to work remotely with occasional business travel
* Medical, Vision, Dental, and supplementary benefit plans
* 401k with an employer match, and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
* Competitive and flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) and 8 paid company holidays
* Access to tech and growth opportunities, and leaders who want you to succeed!

**More About Our Values Code**

* Honor Honesty, Consistency, Responsibility: Do the right thing
* Cultivate an environment of dignity: Show respect for the individual
* Take an Outside-In approach: Put the client first
* Think out-of-the-box: Innovate and create
* Stay Team-Oriented: Collaborate and appreciate each other

**What Are You Waiting For? Apply Today!**


You have learned a little about us today – we want to learn about you! If you think this position and our company are a great fit for your areas of interest and expertise, tell us about you by applying now!


United States Equal Opportunity Employment:


First Advantage is proud to be a global leader in removing barriers and supporting our community members to ensure the changing demographics of the workforce are reflected in our hiring and employment practices. We value all of our candidates, employees, and clients, and place great emphasis on hiring and supporting qualified individuals in each role. We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other area protected by applicable law.

title: K-12 Education Product Manager
description:
An Opportunity to use your skills to impact generational poverty while you work from your home office!  

  

If you are a certified Product Manager with the experience of managing products that were not solely tech, and you have a calling to use your skills for meaningful work, this position may be for you.  

  

Instructional Empowerment's social mission is is to end generational poverty and eliminate racial achievement gaps through transformed core instruction. You can be part of this effort.  

  

The product manager will manage a line of product that is a hybrid of in-person professional development, in-person coaching, virtual experience resources, digital resources and tech platforms. If you are the right candidate, you have a thirst to collaborate with professional educators in product development.  

  

You know how to take initiative and have a proven history in product management. You demonstrate the ability to think strategically about business, products, and product marketing with a deep understanding and curiosity for continued learning about what the market needs and how it will react and integrate the product. Your background is a unique mix of professional experience in education, business acumen, product marketing, KPI management, product strategy, and excellent soft skills. On the business side you can connect product adoption with measurable business value  

  

You look forward to spending a substantial portion of your time interacting with external customers and internal stakeholders, including technical product managers, team leads, front-line faculty, and executive leaders.
  

  

*The* **goal of a** ***Product Manager's****job is to successfully bring a product to market and ensure its success. Product managers are responsible for overseeing the entire lifecycle of a product, from conception to development, launch, and ongoing improvement.*  

  

***Measures of Success*** *include qualitative insight and quantitative metrics on revenue growth, customer satisfaction, product adoption, return on investment, and continued evidence of strategic alignment of the product to the organization’s strategic plan*  

  

**What you will do*** Collaborate effectively with cross functional teams, ensuring alignment to the strategic plan as evidenced though effective execution of Agile/Scrum methodologies.
* Efficiently bring products to market within the planned time limit and planned budget as evidenced by metrics specific to the launch and the early adoption revenues.
* Planning and designing a multistage product roadmap, inclusive of key milestones, features, and customer journey.
* Plan for resource allocation, design sprints, revenue modeling, market strategy and continuous improvement
* Develop and own voice of customer systems, such as customer interviewing, to collect feedback, analyze it, and iterate on the product based on user input as evidenced by analytics related to user experience.
* Represent the voice of the customer (K-12 administrators, educators, and students) and have a validated understanding of customer goals, opportunities, and problems.
* Based on market research and understanding, customer alignment and available resources, prioritize product features and communicate the WHY to the stakeholders
* Create pilot programs to run prototypes and assess outcomes for continuous improvement.
* Set goals for product strategy and lifecycle, define product analytics.
* Create and manage a go to market (GTM) strategy communicated with all internal stakeholders.
* Alignment and collaboration with technical product team
* Collection and analysis of all metrics, qualitative and quantitative specific to success of the product.

  

**The Skills You Bring to the Table*** **Strategic thinker-** you can think long-term, set a vision, and align product goals to overall business strategy.
* **Business and Financial Acumen** – you think in business terms and understand budgeting, forecasting, and the financial implications of product decisions.
* **Customer Empathy-** You get the customer- You know how to learn about the customer to understand user needs, and ensures product meets real pain points.
* **Market Knowledge**- You stay informed about industry trends, market dynamics, and the competitive landscape.
* **Data Analysis**- A lover of data! You analyze data to derive insights, track key performance indicators and guide data driven decision making.
* **Collaborator-** You collaborate effectively with diverse teams, including engineering, marketing, sales, and design.
* **Problem Solver**- Quickly you address challenges and solve problems during the lifecycle.
* **Adaptable-** You recognize you must stay flexible to market conditions, user needs and business priorities.
* **Intellectually curious-** you have a continuous desire to know more and continue to learn.
* **Risk management-** You identify and mitigate potential business risks.
* **Results oriented**: You lean into action; you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals. You are well organized, able to multitask and able to prioritize your work.
* You are **Intellectually Curious** – You ask why, you explore, you are comfortable with ambiguity, and possess a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges.

  

**Your Education and Experience*** Bachelor’s degree in business administration, management, or related field
* Master of Business Administration (MBA) a plus
* Agile/Scrum certification
* Minimum five years’ experience in a product role collaborating effectively with cross functional teams.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Education or Ed Tech industry a plus
* Experience using the following tools.
	+ Jira
	+ Design tools such as Figma, Lucid, Miro
	+ MS Suite
	+ Salesforce experience a plus

  

**Where you will work**  

This position will work from a remote home office.  

  

**When you will travel**  

This position requires up to 30% travel which may include trips to schools, school districts, company offices and our annual conference.  

  

**When you will work**  

This is a full-time position. Business hours are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5 p.m. (EST). Depending on location, these hours may be flexible to coincide with other time zones. There may be times when early morning/evening/weekend work is necessary to meet the needs of the internal and external customer.  

  

**Physical Demands**  

The physical demands described here are representative of those that an employee must be able to do to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and listen. This position requires the ability to occasionally lift office products and supplies, up to twenty pounds.  

  

**Other Duties**  

Please note this job description does not contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  

  

**EEO Statement**  

Instructional Empowerment provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, age, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.
