title: Product Manager, Content Fulfillment
description:
Los Gatos, California
Product Management
Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.  

Content Promotion & Distribution (CPD) sits at the intersection of the consumer experience and the Netflix Studio. Our team is integral to making the Netflix experience feel personal and relevant by developing innovative approaches to how we catalog, promote, localize, and distribute content. Because our products touch both members and content creators, we seek someone who can fluidly move between both worlds, applying strong product principles and strategic frameworks to the member experience while deeply empathizing with the art and craft required to create great content.  

The Role
We are looking for a Product Manager to advance our portfolio of products that manage all the playable media assets consumed by over 260 million members worldwide. The Content Fulfillment PM is responsible for the systems and services that enable our business users around the world to order, route, prepare, deliver, validate, process, and track over 3M VOD assets annually; the critical content systems needed to ensure the accurate and timely fulfillment and evaluation of each and every playable media asset. You’ll develop innovative solutions to further scale how media assets are delivered, managed, and assembled for playback, including live streaming technology to support a growing programming slate of live events. You’ll optimize our quality control systems and workflows while innovating on how we protect the Netflix experience. You’ll partner closely with product managers across Globalization, Promotional Media, Marketing Technology, and adjacent Studio product areas.  

This will be a remote-friendly role, with the freedom to set a flexible work-from-home schedule. This role would be best for candidates located in the Pacific time zone, as bi-monthly in-person travel may be necessary to collaborate with stakeholders and partners in Los Angeles, CA, and Los Gatos, CA. That said, we can always make exceptions in location for the right candidate.  

About Our Team
We innovate on a portfolio of products, services, and data models responsible for the setup, preparation, fulfillment, and distribution of titles. Our goal is to make launching titles on Netflix as easy as pressing a button on your remote. We work with diverse and globally distributed groups of business users and vendors. We also build the foundational capabilities and technology for the next generation of Netflix experiences, like games, ads, and live.  

Our team’s primary superpower is the ability to work creatively and collaboratively in highly technical environments – from core services that power Netflix search and discovery to industry-leading content management platforms.**What You Will Do**
--------------------

* Devise and communicate a vision and strategy for the domain broadly throughout the organization.
* Own the content fulfillment and QC portfolio of products that manage media assets and orchestrate workflows from creation to playback.
* Develop and deliver a roadmap that balances the needs of our partner teams and prioritizes what is most impactful for our members and the business.
* Lead cross-functional teams, including design, engineering, and data science, to discover and execute opportunities through automation, including transforming workflows using ML and AI.
* Partner with different teams responsible for launching titles and new and emerging experiences, including Product Discovery & Promotions, Encoding Technologies, and Studio teams.
* Author strategy memos and presentations and represent your team’s work to senior executives.
* Operate with true transparency and autonomy. Our culture is unique and is key to how we innovate
**What We’re Looking For**
--------------------------

* 6+ years of experience as a Product Manager within the media, content, and/or live streaming systems with a proven record of successfully prioritizing, ideating, and launching impactful products and solutions.
* Ability to inspire, motivate, and lead a cross-functional team - your ability to build strong relationships is critical to success.
* Exceptional analytical skills and ability to balance short-term goals and long-term vision.
* Deep experience using data and metrics to influence business decisions, inform priorities, and evaluate impact of initiatives.
* Demonstrated experience working effectively across different technical teams and with data scientists, machine learning engineers, statisticians, etc.
* Excellent communication skills; timely communication with clear expectations whether in written documents, small group discussions, large-scale presentations, or to executives.
* An ideal candidate is a highly motivated, self-starter with the ability to work independently and drive alignment amid ambiguity.

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $240,000 - $725,000.  

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.  

Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

title: Technical Product Manager
description:
**About us**


Do you believe that every individual deserves affordable and reliable access to their health information? So do we. Function Health was founded with a singular focus: to empower you to live 100 healthy years. A Function membership starts with routine whole-body lab testing (100+ tests) and personalized evidence-based insights from the world's top doctors. It puts your health in your hands and eliminates layers of noise and complexity. Function is an annual subscription designed to serve people throughout their lifetime.
  

  

This is the first layer of a new type of digital health system built around you, growing towards a future of AI-enabled ownership and understanding of your health, now and in the future.
  

  

Our team is led by seasoned technology founders and renowned doctor Mark Hyman MD (Cleveland Clinic, 15x NYT Best Selling author). As a pragmatic Technical Product Manager, you're probably interested in knowing about our tech team.
  

  

The product team is lead by engineers behind machine learning systems built and deployed at scale, including a former tech lead from Google Research. We're a scrappy team of about 45 full-time engineers/designers/PMs and we're looking to add a few more exceptional people to our team to help us scale our systems and impact.

  

**The role**


We are seeking confident, competent, and gritty Technical Product Manager to join our dynamic team. As a TPM at Function, you'll be part of a team that's dedicated to using technology to improve healthcare. You'll work on a cutting-edge platform that enables our members to access their health data in real-time, and you'll be challenged to make a difference in people's lives. You will work with our product and engineering teams to create scalable and robust solutions that are user-friendly and highly secure


The ideal candidate will be meticulous in their attention to detail, self-motivated, resourceful, and capable of thriving in a fast-paced environment. As an early member of our tech team, your contributions will play a critical role in shaping the future of our systems as we scale from tens of thousands of members to millions. There is no ceiling for growth or impact in this role.


Applicants seeking an easy job, a big corporation, a slow pace, or predictable 9-to-5 hours need not apply. This role requires energy, talent, and a genuine passion for Function's mission.


**Responsibilities**


* You must provide clarity across engineering, design, marketing, and operations when no one else can.
* You'll be working directly with engineering leadership as well as engineers to deliver high impact projects. Every project you're involved in will move the needle.
* Identify and resolve technical issues, sometimes you'll be the only person with context to solve project-specific issues, so you'll be expected to own those or provide engineers with the necessary context to fix them.
* You will act as the owner of delivery on key projects that will include data engineering, 3rd party API integrations, UI/UX, and mobile apps.
* Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies, tools and trends, and apply them to solve business problems.

**Requirements**


* Bias toward action. Every call should end with next steps of action.
* Understand leverage points of our business and how to the highest impact outcomes there.
* Clear and direct communication. It's your responsibility to ensure there is no ambiguity about the desired outcomes.
* A passion for improving people's lives and desire to empower them to own their health.
* Strong background in software engineering, preferably with experience as a lead where you had to communicate up, down, and across the organization.
* Strong knowledge of at least one programming language like Python, GO, Rust, or Java.
* Experience with cloud-based platforms, such as AWS or Google Cloud, and containerization technologies, such as Docker.
* Strong understanding of software engineering principles and best practices, including Agile methodologies, test-driven development, and continuous integration and deployment.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to understand complex systems and break them down into manageable components.
* Comfortable with remote work.
* Willing to question assumptions and committed to continuous improvement.
  

  

**Nice-to-haves**

  

* Experience designing & building systems at-scale.
* Data Engineering experience
* Start-up experience. We especially love former founders or early Eng hires.
* Knowledgeable about popular health technologies (e.g., Oura, Whoop, Apple Watch, CGMs).
* A background with some of the following technologies - Python, React, React Native, GCP, and Postgres.
  

  

**Location -** Anyone is welcome to apply regardless of location as this is a remote position. However Fluent English is a requirement in order to be considered.


**Your first 3 months**


* **Month 1**
	+ Rapid onboarding and ramp up. You'll work directly with our lead TPM to absorb all existing business and system context.
	+ You'll tag-team PRDs for key projects.
	+ Be introduced to other key team members in engineering and operations.
	+ Shadow most cross-function meetings that involve current or future projects you'll be involved with.
* **Month 2**
	+ At this point, you will own a full project and work directly with engineering leads on delivery.
	+ You'll be expected to own a piece of our development process, likely handling inbound bug reports, and triage them into actionable steps for engineers and engineering leads to look into.
	+ You'll begin to work more autonomously, but continue to interface heavily with engineering leadership.
	+ By the end of this month, you will be fully aligned with business goals and understand how our product organization delivers against them.
* **Month 3**
	+ You'll be expected to operate more autonomously, but continue to have regular check-ins with leadership.
	+ By the end of this month, you will understand the components of our micro-service system that relate to your projects, and how to provide product input to technical system designs

**Some projects you'll be involved with, or lead**


* Integration of wearables data
* Conversion optimization
* Product analytics
* Integration of medical history
* AI-based health products
* Biological Age
* New diagnostic test integrations
* Integration of R&D projects as they migrate from incubation to production

We value our team at Function and offer a competitive salary and benefits package, flexible working hours, and a dynamic work environment where creativity and innovation are encouraged. If you are a highly motivated and experienced TPM who is passionate about using technology to improve people's lives, we would love to hear from you. Join us on our mission to revolutionize the health technology industry!


**FAQ's**


* What is Function's approach to remote work? Function is 100% remote across the United States, from Austin to New York to San Francisco. We meet up in person on occasion.
* Who works at Function? We're small but growing! The team includes: Mike (https://www.linkedin.com/in/mikenemke/), Dr. Hyman (https://www.instagram.com/drmarkhyman/), Sean (https://www.linkedin.com/in/seano314/), Max (https://www.linkedin.com/search/results/all/?fetchDeterministicClustersOnly=false&heroEntityKey=urn%3Ali%3Afsd\\_profile%3AACoAABRM-IABMLpErHcRwF3SiG8RwYFpLkrpJSo&keywords=maximiliano%20castrucci&origin=RICH\\_QUERY\\_SUGGESTION&position=0&searchId=a2307e14-f98a-4d74-a9ff-850e91986fc5&sid=aop), Shea (https://www.linkedin.com/in/shea-sulkin/), Jonathan (https://www.linkedin.com/in/jonathanswerdlin/), Pranitha (https://www.linkedin.com/in/pranithapatil/), Sara (https://www.linkedin.com/in/sara-blenkhorn/), Tova (https://www.linkedin.com/in/tova-morgan-gelfond-66a64028/), Amy (https://www.linkedin.com/in/amy-crees-rd-cdces-8354b165/), Kiara (https://www.linkedin.com/in/kiara-conde/), Whitney (https://www.linkedin.com/in/whitneyherline/), Erika (https://www.linkedin.com/in/erikabrickley/) and many more.
* What's the interview process like? First, you'll interact with our recruiters as an initial screening. Then, we'll have a quick intro call with our Lead Product Manager, John Elam. Then, you'll meet with our Cofounder & CTO, Mike Nemke. On these calls, we're looking to understand your interests, experience, and if you're a culture fit. After that, you'll meet with the product leadership team to figure out your technical experience and capacity. Finally, we'll send an offer. If we don't give an offer, we'll provide feedback.
* Do I need to match all requirements (e.g. x years of experience, healthcare background)? Function Health welcomes applicants from diverse backgrounds and experiences. While it is not necessary for candidates to possess expertise in all areas, we are seeking individuals with exceptional talent in building and managing software. At Function, we prioritize continuous learning and growth for all team members. We strongly encourage individuals from traditionally underrepresented communities, including women, people of color, LGBTQ+ individuals, veterans, and people with disabilities, to apply.

*At Function, we celebrate diversity and are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender identity, ancestry, religion, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, marital status, Veteran status, or any other occupationally irrelevant criteria.*

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
This role is part of our AddSearch team, one of our growing brands at saas.group.



AddSearch offers a superior search experience, increased engagement for website visitors and boosts revenue-critical conversion rates of our clients.


**Profile overview**



As a Senior Product Manager, you will own the entire product roadmap and play a crucial role in defining the product vision, strategy, and roadmap and ensuring the delivery of an innovative, cutting-edge personalized search solution to our customers.



You will own both strategy and execution, reporting directly to the CEO in this key position. You will have a chance to make an impact by taking over all ongoing product projects, delivering quickly and already making a real difference early on.


**The role is based in GMT+0 - +4 time zone.**


**Your responsibilities:**


* Collaborate closely with senior leadership, develop and communicate a clear product vision, strategy and roadmap for our innovative product offering which is aligned with our company goals.
* Conduct research and gather feedback from customers to identify their pain points, needs and enrich them with data.
* Define and execute a roadmap based on tough decisions and balanced competing priorities.
* Work cross-functionally with design, engineering, data, marketing and customer success to ensure effective delivery of product features and improvements.
* Define and track key performance metrics to make informed decisions and improvements.
* Work closely with product design to create user-friendly, modern and visually appealing experiences for our customers.
* Develop and maintain a strong relationship with key stakeholders across the company including marketing, customer success and the leadership team, and bring the product insights to customer acquisition and success


**What You bring to the table:**


* Ability to independently own product strategy and execution in a highly technical and dynamic environment. You have delivered and optimized several successful products already.
* Strong technical background gathered in a SaaS and E-commerce product environment. Search and content discovery experience is an advantage.
* Solid experience with agile delivery methods (we use Scrum), prioritization and roadmapping
* Strong product-sense, user-centricity, ability to drive ideation and wireframing with your Product Designer
* Outstanding communication skills and influence in a cross-functional team
* Strong analytical skills and ability to gather insights from market and competitive research, as well as customer feedback and behavior. Experience with product analytics will be a great addition


**What's in it for you:**


* **Ultimate flexibility:** We’re 100% remote. You can work from wherever you like, whenever you like. European timezone is preferred.
* **Freedom and autonomy:** We’re a high-trust team, and you’ll be given lots of independence to solve problems in your own way — with plenty of help from the team when you need it.
* **Minimum bureaucracy:** We don’t like to get bogged down with meetings and red tape. We like to be efficient and keep momentum steady & sustainable.
* **Our network:** We are a community of entrepreneurial SaaS professionals that regularly exchange ideas, knowledge, learning and expertise with each other internally.
* **Small and friendly team:** We help each other out, have fun, and joke around. We love our culture, and it’s important to us to love what we do.


AddSearch is part of saas.group and we have a shared goal of succeeding together.


### **What is saas.group?**



Think of us as the driving force behind your favorite software success stories. saas.group, established in 2017, is on a mission to turbocharge promising B2B SaaS ventures, unlocking their full potential. As a Software-as-a-Service portfolio powerhouse, we specialize in acquiring small software treasures and polishing them into industry stars. With a dynamic, fully remote team of nearly 300 colleagues spanning 44 countries we are truly global and we are rewriting the playbook on SaaS innovation and collaboration. We grow 17 exciting brands under our umbrella.Feel free to explore our Candidate's Hub to get an insider's view, dive into our culture, gain valuable insights into our teams and how we work.



We don’t just simply offer you to “take a job with us” but rather to “join us on this journey” *to build the world's largest platform of independent SaaS companies.*



Sounds like something you’re up for? Feel free to apply even if you don’t check all these boxes. We believe in the power of diversity and fresh perspectives to spice up our team. Your application might just be the missing ingredient!

  


—


*SaaS.Group is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. If you're passionate about working with a team that values innovation, excellence, and fairness, we encourage you to apply.*

title: Director, Product Management
description:
**Our Mission**

As the world’s number 1 job site\\*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.

(\\*comScore Total Visits, September 2023)

**Responsibilities**

* Create and drive the vision for Indeed Flex’s Worker Retention including Browse experience, Matching & Offering, Status Program, and Machine Learning products.
* Manage and grow a team of product managers.
* Build a roadmap and define execution strategies with the team by utilizing data, user research, and business priorities. Work closely with stakeholders, including the Fulfillment & Worker Retention service group and Indeed Flex’s Senior Leadership Team.
* Define metrics to measure the success of the features your team builds. Possess a drive for velocity, be highly adaptable, and demonstrate an ability to take a big idea and distill it into a clear and consistent plan that’s backed by data.
* Build relationships and partnerships with people and teams across the company, align on strategy, vision, and execution.

**Skills/Competencies**

* Experience in a fast-paced/startup environment
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field
* 7+ years of Product Management experience or its equivalent
* 3+ years of 2-sided Marketplace experience building machine learning or ranking / matching products
* 2+ years managing a team and are deeply committed to coaching, mentoring, and supporting future leaders. You’re not afraid to be hands on and act as a player-coach when needed.
* Proven track record of cross-functional partnering to execute on strategy.
* Experience presenting to executive audiences.

**Salary Range Transparency**

* United States - Remote - $178,000 - 258,000 USD per year
* Austin Metro Area - $178,000 - 258,000 USD per year
* New York City Metro Area - $208,000 - 302,000
* Seattle Metro Area - $222,000 - 322,000

**Salary Range Disclaimer**

Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range(s) listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. We care about what you care about. We have a multitude of benefits to support Indeedians, as well as their pets, kids, and partners. Select your country and learn more about our employee benefits, program, & perks at https://benefits.indeed.jobs!

Indeed is deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. **Fair Chance Hiring**

**Indeed’s Employee Recruiting Privacy Policy**

title: Manager of Product Design
description:
**Who we are:**



EverTrue is the leading advancement software that supports fundraising efforts at educational institutions and non-profit organizations. EverTrue merged with ThankView in October 2021 in an effort led by Rubicon Technology Partners. We are a fun, smart, mission-driven team that is passionate about the work we do!



Our mission is to build relationships, inspire generosity, and improve lives. By connecting institutional data with dynamic insights from various integration partners, we provide education fundraising professionals with everything they need to engage alumni, raise support, and measure success. Today, hundreds of higher-education and K-12 institutions rely on EverTrue to better engage, identify, prioritize, and manage their fundraising prospects.



While we are a remote-first, U.S.-based company supporting employees in over 30 states with our team striving to share knowledge, celebrate accomplishments, think creatively, and have fun along the way, this position is eligible for employment in the following states: South Carolina, Florida, Pennsylvania, and Texas.



At EverTrue, we recognize it's unrealistic for candidates to fulfill 100% of the criteria in a job posting. We encourage you to apply if you meet the majority of the requirements because we know that skills evolve over time. If you're willing to learn and evolve alongside us, join our team!

  



EverTrue is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to building a company that embraces and celebrates diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion to enhance employee engagement, client satisfaction, and external partnerships/relationships. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better we will be together. Diversity is not something we do, it's who we are.


**Who you are:**


* **(Required)** You have at least 5 years of relevant experience as a Product Design Professional, ideally working with enterprise SaaS products
* **(Required)** You have at least 2 years of demonstrated experience in mentoring, coaching or managing Product Designers, Researchers, or Analysts
* You have experience across a number product design disciplines and are eager to apply that knowledge to improve customer outcomes
* You have worked with a variety of tools, design systems, and tech stacks - you can evaluate the pros and cons aligned the business needs
* You are excited about the opportunity to have an outsized impact on an organization, making your mark through your team's growth & professional development
* You have excellent verbal and written communication skills, and can use them to build support across your team and organization around vision, strategy, and process
* You crave collaboration, work well with cross-functional teams, leave ego at the door and promote team first principles
* Working experience in the Education/Non-Profit Sectors and/or have experience with Advancement or Fundraising is a nice to have


**How you'll contribute to the team:**


* You will develop and lead a team of 3 product design professionals while contributing to team output in a player/coach model
+ 75% - managing & developing the product design department
+ 25% - directly supporting specific product design initiatives

* Collaborate with product leadership to improve our delivery of industry-leading advancement solutions in an agile, empowered team model
* Serve as the Product Design Leader - working cross-functionally throughout the organization to foster alignment, build relationships, and educate stakeholders
* Evaluate the current design practice, processes and tools - applying a strategic lens on how we achieve our objectives, desired customer experience, and business outcomes
* Develop and define department goals, processes, and metrics to improve consistency and drive continuous improvement
* Provide strategic oversight of your team's work - through consistent feedback, individual coaching, and team skills development
* Mentor individual designers to improve their skills, effectiveness, and to provide professional development opportunities as they grow & learn
* Impact specific initiatives through individual work, modeling best practices
* Never stop learning - track the competitive landscape, stay abreast of industry trends, seek out new opportunities, try out new tools and embrace change


**Why you'll love to join our team:**


* We offer competitive compensation, the base salary range for this role is **$115K - $120K**, we also cover 80% of your healthcare premium, we're a remote first environment with no plans to return to office, and our happiness and well-being perks are valued at **$25K**.
* Take a **True Adventure** on us, after your first year we'll give you $2,000 to go on vacation, and enjoy your **True Birthday**, where you'll get your birthday off, and EverTrue will donate to a charity of your choice.
* Develop yourself with our **True Growth** perk which allows you a stipend to invest in yourself personally and professionally
* When it comes to work life balance, we offer discretionary time off, 12 holidays, 8 sick days, half-day summer Fridays, a recharge week at the end of the year, and monthly Flex Fridays
* We want to ensure that you are excited, happy, and find fulfillment in your work.

title: Sr. Product Manager (Remote)
description:
**About Roo**  

Happy vets make for happy pets.  

Roo is on a mission to create a world of increased opportunity, professional empowerment, and improved animal care for animal hospitals and veterinarian professionals. By connecting hospitals in need with professionals with a new groundbreaking platform, our goal is to optimize hospital talent staffing and improve quality of life for veterinarians, all while giving pets a chance to have access to safe, high-quality care.  

  

Over the next decade, Roo will unlock millions in economic opportunities, improve quality of life for tens of thousands of veterinarians, and facilitate millions of hours of pet care. We've been growing tremendously since launching in early 2019 and now seeing even more traction as we scale up fast. **What We Do**  

Roo (www.roo.vet) has created the first B2B labor marketplace in animal healthcare that connects veterinary professionals with hospitals through innovative technology, with opportunities to expand and offer more opportunities for both our demand & supply of users.  

Our dynamic platform enables hospitals to fulfill personnel needs in real time, while allowing high-quality veterinary professionals to secure work at the click of a button. Beyond the platform, Roo represents a growing opportunity to help hospitals meet all-things staffing, and a growing community of resilient vet industry professionals who value flexibility and work-life balance, in addition to providing the best possible outcomes for clients and their pets.  

Our aim is to combine experienced healthcare expertise with Silicon Valley talent to shake up this industry and change the way veterinarians and hospitals work! **About the Role**  

As a Sr. Product Manager at Roo, you will lead a cross functional team of engineers, designers, analysts, marketers and more in a quest to achieve a major company objective. You will craft the strategy, define the north-star metric, ensure the dashboarding to help guide your execution, and keep the company informed of progress through your written updates. Your north-star metric will directly tie to the “Roo Equation”, the equation that defines our business model, so you’ll always know you’re having an impact. You and your team will operate with significant autonomy as you take a growth-minded, iterative approach to learning, moving fast (almost uncomfortably so) and ultimately driving a measurable outcome by building levers for our customers and internal users.  

This role reports directly to the SVP of Product, Growth, & Design and while the role will operate on a remote basis, you will be required to occasionally be onsite in our San Francisco coworking space for meetings and team events.
### **Your Responsibilities**

+ Unite your team behind a strategy to tackle your initiative goals.
+ Ensure the measurability of the impact of your efforts.
+ Lead the product process and maintain a rolling roadmap with emphasis on always finding the best project to drive maximum impact toward your north star metric.
+ Devise creative product solutions to the core problems facing your team.
+ Track metrics impact of projects and develop insights that inform the rolling roadmap.
+ Ensure that the projects delivered are improvements to the user experience.
+ Write weekly updates to the executive team and key stakeholders summarizing your team’s impact, insights, and plans.

### **Qualifications**

+ **Marketplace experience.** You have 4+ years working on core, supply or demand teams of a growing marketplace product.
+ **Impact focus** and a consistent history of delivering measurable results for both users and the business.
+ **Strong writing skills**, especially in strategic communication.
+ **Verbal communication** that is clear and effective.
+ **Ability to think big and small** to build a portfolio of experiments and larger features. You are as comfortable white boarding a completely new experience as you are optimizing an existing flow and know when to do which.
+ **Data-informed**. You deeply understand how your products work and how to measure long-term impact. You know every step of the funnel. You can design, run, and interpret experiments and A/B tests, and probably know a bit of SQL
+ **Natural leadership.** You know how to influence people to get things done across any job function. People love working with you.
+ **Prioritize UX.** You think deeply about how the product fits into the life of the customer and can prototype solutions as a method of communicating your ideas for improvement.
+ **Understand startup velocity.** You easily adapt to shifting priorities, evolving strategies, and resource constraints, knowing that it’s a natural part of scaling a product at this stage.

$130,000 - $200,000 a year
Base salary is commensurate with experience and geographic location.
We have diverse, passionate & driven team members from a variety of backgrounds. For permanent, full time employees, we offer:* Accelerated growth & learning potential
* Stipends for home office setup, continuing education, and monthly wellness
* Comprehensive health benefits to fit your needs with base medical plan covered at 100% with optional

premium buy up plans.* 401K
* Unlimited Paid Time Off
* Paid Maternity/Paternity and reproductive care leave
* Gifts on your birthday & anniversary
* Opportunity for domestic travel, including for regional team building events

  

Overall, you would be part of a mission-driven company that will significantly empower the lives of all veterinary professionals and the health of the overall animal industry that seeks massive innovation.  

We believe in diversity of experience and background, and understand that your individual experience may not check every box. We still encourage you to apply even if you are not confident in every expectation listed.  

Ready to join the Roo-volution?!  

We have diverse, passionate & driven team members from a variety of backgrounds. For permanent, full time employees, we offer:* Accelerated growth & learning potential.
* Stipends for home office setup, continuing education, and monthly wellness.

premium buy up plans.* 401K

title: Product Manager
description:
**Location: Remote, USA (EST hours preferred)**
-----------------------------------------------



Wealthbox, a maker of CRM software for financial advisors, is seeking a Product Manager. Highly visible in our organization, Product Managers at Wealthbox are technically oriented, work closely with internal and external stakeholders to bring delight to end-users and build systems and features that increase revenue and retention.

  


**Responsibilities:**
---------------------


* Collaborate with the Head of Product to define and prioritize the product roadmap.
* Analyze feedback from customers, join calls with team members and customers, stay up-to-date on industry trends, and more — to make informed product decisions.
* Author and present product requirement documents. At Wealthbox, these documents typically combine words and imagery to communicate what will be delivered when completed.
* Work with business leaders to understand and contribute to the financial aspects of the product, including billing, subscriptions, and pricing.
* Work closely with engineering, QA, and design team members during the product development lifecycle.
* Prioritize work within the product development lifecycle to help the team release more quickly.
* Collaborate with marketing, sales, success, and support teams to define and support the go-to-market strategy.
* Help the team ship great work.

  


**Desired Skills & Experience**
-------------------------------


* 3+ years of experience in product management in the fintech space or adjacent industry.
* Familiarity with CRM systems and the competitive landscape.
* Enjoys working with distributed teams in a remote work environment and has a proactive approach to problem-solving in a remote context.
* Strong ability to prioritize and find the critical path through complex work.
* User-centric design thinking, strong analytical skills, effective at building consensus, and customer focus.
* Ability to adapt as new information is discovered.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills, especially email and video conferencing.
* Prior product management experience in CRM or other SaaS products is a big plus.

  


**Work Schedule**
-----------------


* Weekdays, during business hours.
* No travel required.

  


**Benefits**
------------


* Competitive compensation
* Comprehensive health plan coverage
* 401k plan
* Paid time off

  




Interested? Email us a note with your resume and a link to your Linkedin profile to jobs@wealthbox.com.

title: Product Manager
description:
Comcate is looking for a Product Manager to join our team. The Product Manager manages the successful development and implementation of the product from beginning to end. This person sees strategic ideas from design and testing to execution and market introduction.


The ideal candidate will have the ability and desire to identify customer and market needs and lead the delivery of new products and features.

* Can you engage an old-school, paper-loving inspector to move to a mobile app?
* Can you figure out a way to integrate Twilio and Business Intelligence Tools to better communicate with agency staff and the executive team?
* Can you help citizens have a positive experience with their government?


Responsibilities:

* **Customer journeys and user funnels** – ability to learn, empathize, and add value to core customer journeys and user funnels in the product
* **Manage product releases** – Draft and distribute product briefs to ensure the smooth introduction of each new release. Answer questions and troubleshoot issues throughout the release lifecycle. This includes partnering with the client success organization to drive awareness.
* **Practice customer-centric development** – Work with clients to understand their unique needs and pain points. Capture and share client feedback with the team to best investigate ways to create a solution. Collaborate cross-functionally to ensure features and functionality are meeting market needs in new and innovative ways. Report the success of the products and strategize improvements needed.
* **Agile Management** – Excited about rolling up your sleeves and working tactically with the team. This means running daily rituals like scrum, backlog grooming, planning, and retrospective for a cross-functional team. Monitor the progress of issues and provide solutions for the development team.
* **Prepare and deliver product requirements:** lead all aspects of sprint deliverables. This includes creation requirements, grooming stories, creating tickets, UAT and communicating to team deliverables.


What you need to focus on to be successful in this role:

* Your ability to add value to the core product funnels in a way that adds value for our customers
* Your ability to ship meaningful and valuable work on a predictable and consistent basis
* Your ability to collaborate with customers in a way that builds partnership, transparency, and trust
* Your ability to develop deep product and industry expertise
* Your ability to lead your development team to execute against the goals of the company


Requirements:

* Bachelor's degree preferred.
* 4+ years experience in product management. We’re open to exploring a Senior Product Management position for the right candidate
* Proven results influencing stakeholders and displaying improvements
* Ability to translate complex problems and ideas into easily understood descriptions


Other considerations:

* This is a remote position in the US
* We offer health care, 401k, paid time off, and benefits for full-time employees
* We are open to contract hires for the right candidate
* This position does not offer visa sponsorship


About us:


Comcate was founded in 2000 with the mission of supporting local municipalities with technology solutions to serve their communities more efficiently and effectively. Today, Comcate empowers over 25,000 staff members in hundreds of public agencies across the country with our comprehensive suite of products for Customer Relationship Management, Code Enforcement and Inspections and Citizen Mobile Access software.


An important element of our solutions and processes includes helping agencies create a culture of feedback, having citizens feel heard, and providing city managers with visibility into their organizations. This helps agencies produce deeper, more trusted relationships over time, helps managers and citizens stay tuned in to issues and great ideas as they arise, and ultimately helps everyone win by creating more transparency and accountability. This leads to citizens who are more engaged and municipalities that perform at a much higher level.




dZTQEUGm8E

title: Technical Product Manager
description:
**The Role:**


The world’s largest restaurant company is seeking a talented and motivated Technical Product Manager to drive the ongoing evolution of Yum’s next-generation Point of Sale solution. As a Product Manager at Yum!, you will be accountable for the strategic and tactical execution of technical solutions tailored for KFC, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill.


The ideal candidate will possess a proven background in planning, prioritizing, and delivering complex technical software solutions in concert with engineering and design counterparts. Experience in managing a diverse set of stakeholders and their sometimes-competing production-critical needs is key. To be successful, Product Managers at Yum! must be willing to dive in and become experts on the products we’re producing and how we architect and create them.


**Key Responsibilities:**


**Strategy & Planning:**


* Think big picture.


* Balance an intake of requests from production clients across the globe.


* Manage and communicate quarterly product and capacity planning.


* Be accountable for the Poseidon Evolution roadmap and all that goes along with roadmap ownership.


* Work with the discovery teams to plan for new market launches and set expectations.


* Become a trusted partner to the global brands we support.


**Delivery & Execution:**


* Partner with stakeholders and other product teams to gather top-level scope and requirements.


* Drive the development team in understanding, refining, and executing on a roadmap.


* Be an invaluable partner to your engineering and design peers.


* Capture, track, and provide status on top risks, actions, issues, and dependencies.


* Anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make trade-offs, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints.


* Identify key decision points for escalation and maintain decision logs.


* Proactively provide regular updates to stakeholders and the Yum! Leadership Team.


**Qualifications:**


* Minimum of 4-6 years of Technical Product Management or equivalent product experience.


* Highly organized.


* Experience with Jira & Confluence.


* Ability to read and author system diagrams and technical documents.


* Exceptional prioritization skills; you know how to organize execution and sell the prioritization decisions.


* Proven written and verbal communication skills.


* Deep experience in stakeholder management, dealing with multiple stakeholders at varied levels of the organization.


* Excellent problem-solving skills.


*Salary Range: $108,700 to $149,930 annually + bonus eligibility.* ***This is the expected salary range for this position. Ultimately, in determining pay, we'll consider the successful candidate’s location, experience, and other job-related factors.***

  

  

  

*At Yum!, one of our core values is to Believe in ALL People. This means seeing the value in everyone and unlocking their full potential to be their best self. YUM! Brands, Inc. (including its subsidiaries Yum Restaurant Services Group, LLC (“YRSG”) and Yum Connect, LLC (“Yum Digital and Technology”)(collectively, “Yum”) is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to equity, inclusion, and belonging for all dimensions of diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other protected characteristic. Yum! is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities or special needs.*

  

  

*[Employment eligibility to work with Yum! in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for this position.]*


The Yum! Brands story is simple. We have the four distinctive, relevant and easy global brands – KFC, Pizza Hut, Taco Bell and The Habit Burger Grill - born from the hopes and dreams, ambitions and grit of passionate entrepreneurs. And we want more of this to create our future!  

  

As the world’s largest restaurant company we have a clear and compelling mission: to build the world’s most love, trusted and fastest-growing restaurant brands. The key and not-so-secret ingredient in our recipe for growth is our unrivaled talent and culture, which fuels our results.  

  

We’re looking for talented, motivated, visionary and team-oriented leaders to join us as we elevate and personalize the customer experience across our 48,000 restaurants, operating in 145 countries and territories around the world!  

  

Employees may work for a single brand and potentially grow to support all company-owned brands depending on their role. Regardless of where they work, as a company opening an average of 8 restaurants a day worldwide, the growth opportunities are endless. Taco Bell has been named of the 10 Most Innovative Companies in the World by Fast Company; Pizza Hut delivers more pizzas than any other pizza company in the world and KFC’s still use its 75-year-old finger lickin’ good recipe including secret herbs and spices to hand-bread its chicken every day.  

  

Yum! and its brands have offices in Chicago, IL, Louisville KY, Irvine, CA, Plano, TX and other markets around the world. We don’t just say we are a great place to work – our commitments to the world and our employees show it. Yum! has been named to the Dow Jones Sustainability North America Index and ranked among the top 100 Best Corporate Citizens by Corporate Responsibility Magazine in addition to being named to the Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index. Our employees work in an environment where the value of “believe in all people” is lived every day, enjoying benefits including but not limited to: 4 weeks’ vacation PLUS holidays, sick leave and 2 paid days to volunteer at the cause of their choice and a dollar-for-dollar matching gift program; generous parental leave; competitive benefits including medical, dental, vision and life insurance as well as a 6% 401k match – all encompassed in Yum!’s world-famous recognition culture.

title: Senior Product Manager, Personal Loans
description:
**About Upstart**



Upstart is a leading AI lending marketplace partnering with banks and credit unions to expand access to affordable credit. By leveraging Upstart's AI marketplace, Upstart-powered banks and credit unions can have higher approval rates and lower loss rates across races, ages, and genders, while simultaneously delivering the exceptional digital-first lending experience their customers demand. More than two-thirds of Upstart loans are approved instantly and are fully automated.



Upstart is a digital-first company, which means that most Upstarters live and work anywhere in the United States. However, we also have offices in San Mateo, California; Columbus, Ohio; and Austin, Texas.



Most Upstarters join us because they connect with our mission of enabling access to effortless credit based on true risk. If you are energized by the impact you can make at Upstart, we’d love to hear from you!


**The Team:**



Upstart’s **Personal Loans** team maps the future of Upstart’s largest business unit. We work closely with dedicated engineers, designers, and marketers to enable effortless credit based on true risk.



As the **Senior** **Product Manage**r, you will drive relentless, continuous improvement in our current customer experience and also to conceive our next moonshots. The right candidate for this role should be highly ambitious, able to organize both ideas and people, and excel at problem solving of all kinds. You should have a bias toward action and be able to break down complex problems into steps that drive rapid measurable improvements. We value intellectual honesty and take a clear-eyed, analytical approach to product enhancements. You should have a creative streak to see through the unstated assumptions that continue to make lending so much more daunting and expensive than it ought to be.


* **Position Location** - This role is available in the following locations: Remote, San Mateo, CA, and Columbus, OH.
* **Time Zone Requirements** - This team operates in all US time zones.
* **Travel Requirements** - This team has regular on-site collaboration sessions. These occur 2-3 days per quarter at our San Mateo or Columbus office. If you need to travel to make these meetups, Upstart will cover all travel related expenses.


**How you’ll make an impact**


* Identify market opportunities and define product vision and strategy for Upstart’s core customer.
* Scrutinize the performance of our current application and identify ways to improve the experience.
* Manage KPIs and goal-setting for Personal Loans’ ongoing operations
* Understand customer needs thoroughly; gather product requirements through quantitative and qualitative methods.
* Engage closely with the engineering team to help determine the best technical implementation methods as well as a reasonable implementation schedule.


**Minimum Qualifications**


* BA/BS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 4-10 years of product management experience.
* Demonstrated ability to achieve strategic goals in an innovative and fast-paced environment, and to evolve product strategy based on research, data and industry trends; excellent problem-solving, organizational and analytical skills.
* Passion and aptitude for credit and financing-related economic concepts.


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Track record of building a successful product testing paradigm. The ideal candidate has already run dozens of A/B tests and is comfortable leading the creation of an experimental backlog.
* Experience bringing teams together using Agile development methodology.
* Knowledge of multiple functional areas such as Product Management, Engineering, UX/UI, Sales Customer Support, Finance or Marketing; understanding of full funnel conversion best practices (e.g. distribution strategies, funnel conversion, operational go-to-market).
* Experience building online finance products, and/or knowledge of the consumer finance market.
* MBA preferred


**What you’ll love:**


* + Competitive Compensation (base + bonus & equity)
	+ Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage with Health Savings Account contributions from Upstart
	+ 401(k) with 100% company match up to $4,500 and immediate vesting and after-tax savings
	+ Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
	+ Life and disability insurance
	+ Generous holiday, vacation, sick and safety leave
	+ Supportive parental, family care, and military leave programs
	+ Annual wellness, technology & ergonomic reimbursement programs
	+ Social activities including team events and onsites, all-company updates, employee resource groups (ERGs), and other interest groups such as book clubs, fitness, investing, and volunteering
	+ Catered lunches + snacks & drinks when working in offices

#LI-REMOTE



#LI-MidSenior


At Upstart, your base pay is one part of your total compensation package. The anticipated base salary for this position is expected to be within the below range. Your actual base pay will depend on your geographic location–with our “digital first” philosophy, Upstart uses compensation regions that vary depending on location. Individual pay is also determined by job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.



In addition, Upstart provides employees with target bonuses, equity compensation, and generous benefits packages (including medical, dental, vision, and 401k).


United States | Remote - Anticipated Base Salary Range
$162,100—$224,500 USD
Upstart is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer. We are dedicated to ensuring that underrepresented classes receive better access to affordable credit, and are just as committed to embracing diversity and inclusion in our hiring practices. We celebrate all cultures, backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences, and know that we can only become better together.
