title: Software Engineering Manager
description:
**WHAT YOU'LL DO**
------------------

  

As a Chapter Lead – Software Engineering, you will work with the Product Owner to ensure adequate alignment of squad members to initiatives* Be accountable to the Solution Architect for adoption of agreed upon design and suggested changes, to strike a balance between business needs and technical priorities.
* Reduce defect leakage/improve release quality/reduce time to fix defects
* Increase sprint velocity by introduction of modern engineering practices like DevSecOps, Cloud
* Contribute towards hands-on design and development
* Develop and nurture technical resources


You will act as pioneer, thought leader, problem solver, and be sought out for your expertise by product teams, enabling them to go faster, safely.  

  

You will work closely with the Solution Architect and Product Owners to optimize against many requirements such as functional needs, quality attributes (e.g., security, usability), cost, and enterprise-wide goals (e.g., cloud and API enablement). You will also bring best practices for the team by being a part of the Chapter Leads guild.  

**YOU'RE GOOD AT**
------------------

  

To be successful, you should bring sound design and development experience leveraging technologies to drive technical governance, innovation, integration and cloud-oriented strategies. Ideally, you thrive in a work environment that requires strong problem solving, analytical and decision making skills, and independent self-direction, coupled with an aptitude for collaboration and open communication.
* Verbal and written communication at a business and technical level
* Servicing customers with a strong business orientation and connecting with skilled engineers
* High level of initiative, self-motivation, resourcefulness and collaboration
* Exceptional people leadership ability
* Building relationships and reliable team player, displaying consideration and respect for others
* Performing successfully in a fast-paced, multi-cultural and service-oriented environment
* Interpreting rules and guidelines flexibly to enhance the business and aligning with BCG’s values and culture
* Exhibiting ownership and accountability for the squad deliverables
* Attention to detail, well organized, and able to set priorities and take decisions
Being flexible to be available outside of normal business hours for international calls as needed  
* 

  

**YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)**
-------------------------------------------

  

* Education and Certifications
	+ BA/MS degree in computer or information sciences or similar field
	+ 10+ years of relevant experience in delivering complex IT solutions with strong technical background, preferably in large international organization
* Functional/Technical Skills
	+ Strong experience in application development in complex and heterogeneous environment
	+ Solid experience of designing end-to-end solutions on Microsoft stack
	+ Experience in leading agile development teams in reviewing application design and implementation against quality standards
	+ Ability to develop process documentation, technical manuals and instructions
	+ Solid experience in Object-Oriented design SOLID principles and modern design patterns
	+ Experience in design and implementation of REST APIs and micro-services
	+ Working knowledge of on-premise/cloud-based infrastructures, SDLC pipelines, and deployments/configurations and definition
	+ Experienced in software delivery including CI/CD and related DevSecOps practices, working with cloud based platforms such as Azure or AWS
	+ Strong software design & development principles, with a focus on system stability, reusability and performance optimized for a global audience
	+ Strong understanding of application testing, diagnostics and performance tuning
	+ Strong understanding of TDD and BDD methodologies.
	+ Working experience with AI/ML is nice to have
* And familiar with
	+ Scrum and Kanban development methodologies.
	+ Automation, performance and load testing tools

**YOU'LL WORK WITH**
--------------------

  

BCG’s information technology group collaboratively delivers the latest digital technologies that enable our consultants to lead and our business to grow. For our IT jobs, we seek individuals with expertise in the areas of IT infrastructure, application development, business systems, collaborative and social technologies, information security, and project leadership.

title: Software Engineer
description:
At Polaris Inc., we have fun doing what we love by driving change and innovation. We empower employees to take on challenging assignments and roles with an elevated level of responsibility in our agile working environment. Our people make us who we are, and we create incredible products and experiences that empower us to THINK OUTSIDE.
JOB SUMMARY:  

The Software Engineer will work on functional and technical role with Blue Yonder hosted solution. At Polaris, we optimize our whole goods supply chain along with our parts & accessories business using a hosted instance of Blue Yonder Planning systems.  

The Software Engineer is responsible for the code creation, unit testing, maintaining of the software and proving production support. The Software Engineer needs to effectively partner with product manager, scrum master, system analysts, other application developers and end users.  

This individual will analyze existing business processes and design technical specifications to develop systems, deliver code and integrations to other systems. This person must demonstrate passion for strengthening and enhancing business results through software development.  

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES :  

Software development* Transforms software design into executable Blue Yonder SCPO objects in accordance with Polaris standards.
* Write test scenarios, perform unit testing, system testing and document the results.
* Collaborate with other Software Engineers to implement the project.
* Ensures compliance with SOX.


System and Team Support* Provides day-to-day application support to project team and business users.
* Troubleshoots production problems and works to fix issues.
* Understands technology and systems infrastructure.
* Work with project teams on technical requirements, development, and implementation plans
* Value and embrace teamwork and collaboration and be responsible for successful completion of tasks.
* Help to keep the standard up to date and include innovative technology and learning.


Code and Process Review* Review code for ease of understanding and maintainability
* Review code and process with Project teams to assist in the understanding and flow.
* Create install distribution sets for monthly installs with Blue Yonder SCPO
* Ensures compliance with SOX


SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE* Bachelor’s degree in computer science/software design, Computer Information Systems or equivalent
* 8-10 years of experience in a Software Engineer/Developer role performing system analysis, writing technical specifications, coding, QA/testing
* Blue Yonder Planning (SCPO) – Demand, Enterprise Supply Planning, Inventory Optimization, Order Optimization, S&OP module development experience.
* Functional and technical experience with integration of Blue Yonder applications with ERP and Data Warehouse platforms.
* Strong database skills.
* Thrives in a fast-paced environment with multiple project assignments.
* Ability to effectively execute tasks while under pressure.
* Ability to work independently with minimum supervision.
* Excellent analytical and creative critical thinking skills
* Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
* Possesses strong organizational skills.
* Strong customer service orientation


Preferred* Azure/.net development
* SQL / Snowflake development
* Functional knowledge with manufacturing and supply chain business processes and data
* Experience with Agile Methodology.
* Experience with Jira or similar application.

*We are an ambitious, resourceful, and driven workforce, which empowers us to THINK OUTSIDE.**Apply today!*
About Polaris
As the global leader in powersports, Polaris Inc. (NYSE: PII) pioneers product breakthroughs and enriching experiences and services that have invited people to discover the joy of being outdoors since our founding in 1954. Polaris' high-quality product line-up includes the Polaris RANGER®, RZR® and Polaris GENERAL™ side-by-side off-road vehicles; Sportsman® all-terrain off-road vehicles; military and commercial off-road vehicles; snowmobiles; Indian Motorcycle® mid-size and heavyweight motorcycles; Slingshot® moto-roadsters; Aixam quadricycles; Goupil electric vehicles; and pontoon and deck boats, including industry-leading Bennington pontoons. Polaris enhances the riding experience with a robust portfolio of parts, garments, and accessories. Proudly headquartered in Minnesota, Polaris serves more than 100 countries across the globe.
EEO Statement  

Polaris is an Equal Opportunity Employer and will make all employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, familial status, status with regard to public assistance, membership or activity in a local commission, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law.

title: Product Owner
description:
**Position:** IT Product Owner

**Job Type:** Full-time


**Location:** HYDERABAD, TELANGANA, INDIA

**Salary:** DOE

**SUMMARY:**

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for overseeing the creation, breakdown, and prioritization of work at the scrum team level.
* Communicates the product vision to scrum teams and makes decisions regarding feature prioritization in line with the Product Roadmap.
* Collaborates with the Product Manager as necessary to refine features and confirm desired outcomes.
* Leads one or more scrum teams in conjunction with Scrum Masters and Delivery leads. Oversees grooming and prioritization of feature-ready backlogs and ensures backlog adequacy to sustain high scrum team productivity.
* Drives the decomposition of features into user stories and aligns the backlog of user stories, acceptance criteria, and tasks with the scrum team.
* Works with the scrum team to align highest value features to sprints included in each planning cycle.
* Collaborates with Release Train managers to ensure alignment of feature and user story delivery across dedicated and non-dedicated agile teams.
* Guides cross-functional teams in product creation, development, and implementation. Analyzes and provides reporting metrics to leadership on product growth and development.

**Leadership & Supervision:**

* Supports and advances the Companys Mission, Vision, Values, and strategic objectives and key results.
* Assists in the recruitment process by conducting interviews and providing timely feedback in the candidate selection process.
* Plans and hosts quarterly engagement team activities, whether virtual or in person.
* Approves semi-monthly time reporting for all team members, including PTO requests, etc.
* Fosters a strong sense of customer focus and professionalism throughout the team.
* Motivates the team in a calm and positive manner to ensure their success while providing development opportunities.
* Recognizes team members regularly, both personally and within the larger organization.
* Creates and supports a culture of trust, engagement, and inclusion for all employees.
* Monitors individual team member performance and quality, taking necessary actions to address issues promptly.
* Writes and delivers performance reviews and develops goals for each team member.
* Monitors individual growth and development to ensure optimal performance.
* Promotes training opportunities to enhance team members' skills.
* Proactively works to solve problems and overcome challenges, including root cause analysis.
* Management Reporting: monitors workload progression daily and reports as needed, escalating issues immediately as required.

**Requirements and Skills:**

* Bachelors degree in business, economics, communication, engineering, or related field, or equivalent experience.
* At least 2 years of Product Owner experience in a highly technical space.
* Experience managing the creation and maintenance of user stories and business requirements.
* Working knowledge of Atlassian Product Management tools such as Jira and Confluence.
* Ability to understand basic and complex architectural diagrams and data flows.
* Exposure to agile software development methodologies.
* Broad knowledge of process control theory and principles.
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal. Proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint, Visio, Excel, Word, and Office.
* Ability to interact and cooperate with all employees.
* Experience in the healthcare industry is advantageous.

**Privacy and Security:**

* Compliance with the company's information security and privacy policies
* Access, use, and disclosure of only the minimum necessary covered information.
* Safeguarding the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of covered information at all times.

**Essential Functions:**

* Physical Requirements: Extended periods of typing, data entry, sitting, reading, and writing.
* Lifting up to 20 lbs.
* Mental Requirements: General, visual, and numerical intelligence.
* Analytical skills.
* Willingness to occasionally work a flexible schedule.
* For remote work, employees must meet specific requirements outlined in the Teleworking Security (HITRUST-21) Policy, including a private workspace and a home internet network that meets minimum speed requirements.

title: Business Project Manager
description:
Job description
Some careers shine brighter than others.


If you’re looking for a career that will help you stand out, join HSBC and fulfil your potential. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further.


HSBC is one of the largest banking and financial services organisations in the world, with operations in 64 countries and territories. We aim to be where the growth is, enabling businesses to thrive and economies to prosper, and, ultimately, helping people to fulfil their hopes and realise their ambitions.


We are currently seeking an experienced professional to join our team in the role of Senior Project Manager


In this role, you will:


* Arrange business workshops for managing/clarifying the requirements. This will require excellent product knowledge and regulatory reporting exposure.
* Manage all aspects of multiple related projects to ensure the overall program is aligned to and directly supports the achievement of strategic objectives
* Play a key role in arranging discussions with Key operational users to understand and document Standard Operating procedures of the Current state solution
* Ability to scale, flexible and provide guidance and expertise to support across workstreams as per project needs
* Ability to be flexible with regards to dealing with multiple systems / Downstream data flows etc across all the entities reported by the platform
* Ability to think out of box solutions in certain circumstances as not all systems follow set protocols
* Prepare Solution proposals with Requirement and getting them approved in Technical Design Review Forum.
* Supporting the development and testing stages of the change request through to implementation.
* Able to comprehend and translate complex and advanced functional, technical, and business requirements into executable architectural designs.
* Creating and maintaining documentation for the requirements in JIRA.
* Understand interdependencies between technology, operations and business needs
* Demonstrate a functional acumen to support how solutions will address client goals while maintaining alignment with industry best practices
* Oversee BAs located across different location
* Adopt Tools and Utilities to improve the efficiency of BA & other teams.
Requirements
To be successful in this role, you should meet the following requirements:


* Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment demonstrating teamwork, innovation and excellence
* Build and maintain relationships by engaging business stakeholders to establish credibility, solve problems, build consensus and achieve objectives
* Excellent leadership, communication (written, verbal and presentation) and interpersonal skills
* Self-motivated, decisive, with the ability to adapt to change and competing demands
* Adept at conducting research into project-related issues and products
* Must be able to learn, understand and apply new technologies
* Support diverse and inclusive work environment
* Hands-on experience on JIRA is Mandatory

You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC.


www.hsbc.com/careers


HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website.


Issued by – HSBC Software Development India

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
**About Commvault**


Commvault (NASDAQ: CVLT) is the gold standard in cyber resilience. The company empowers customers to uncover, take action, and rapidly recover from cyberattacks – keeping data safe and businesses resilient. The company’s unique AI-powered platform combines best-in-class data protection, exceptional data security, advanced data intelligence, and lightning-fast recovery across any workload or cloud at the lowest TCO. For over 25 years, more than 100,000 organizations and a vast partner ecosystem have relied on Commvault to reduce risks, improve governance, and do more with data.

**JOB DESCRIPTION:**

**Job Description Overview:**
Lead technical projects that streamline, automate, and scale our business applications at Commvault. You are expected to help drive the strategy and execution of a business applications roadmap within our business operations. Advise a team of business systems analysts, manage executive stakeholders, and drive meaningful improvements through an agile development methodology. This position reports to the Senior Director, Business Applications.

**Who you are?*** Lead a diverse team of business systems analysts responsible for Human Resources and Legal applications.
* Develop strategic relationships with executive partners to define, prioritize, and help implement our go-to-market strategy and customer journey objectives through our business applications. Handle priorities and demands in collaboration with senior partners from various backgrounds.
* Cultivate external relations, encouraging partnerships with consulting partners or vendors to enhance our business operations. Collaborate closely with PMO, Enterprise Architecture, & Development teams on IT-related projects, ensuring their timely delivery and high quality.
* Take a hands-on approach for select strategic projects, involving yourself in defining business requirements, application configuration, testing, training, and enablement.
* Drive project teams through the design and definition of business processes, ensuring that technology serves as an empowering tool rather than merely a solution.
* Lead all project delivery processes, including resource allocation, progress tracking, issue resolution, and adoption and change management.
* Promote operational excellence, stability, and scalability through adherence to strict change control and best practices for project management, issue mitigation, stakeholder management, data governance, and release management.
* Implement consistent best practices across the group, fostering an inclusive culture of collaboration and standardized documentation and processes.
* Foster the development and growth of team members, ensuring that all personnel have equal opportunities for development and efficient operation.

**What you'll be doing..,*** Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or related field.
* 5+ years of experience as a business systems analyst and 3+ years of management experience, or proven leadership capabilities in a team environment.
* Configuration/administration experience with Workday is a must.
* Good communication and facilitation skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders. Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and efficiency in problem-solving.
* Experience with Agile software development or similar methodologies, promoting flexibility and adaptability in project execution.
* Certifications related to business analysis or project management are preferred.
* Professional services/consulting experience is preferred, providing valuable insight into client-centric solutions and industry best practicesPrior experience working in the software industry is preferred.

**You’ll love working here because...*** Employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)
* Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing
* Annual health check-ups, Car lease Program, and Tuition Reimbursement
* An inclusive company culture, an opportunity to join our Community Guilds
* Personal accident cover and Term life cover


Commvault is an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are always committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status and we will not discriminate against on the basis of such characteristics or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we work.


Commvault’s goal is to make interviewing inclusive and accessible to all candidates and employees. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to participate in the interview process or apply for a position at Commvault, please email accommodations@commvault.com For any inquiries not related to an accommodation please reach out to wwrecruitingteam@commvault.com.

title: Senior User Interface Designer
description:
**This is where you save and sustain lives**


At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You'll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.


Baxter's products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.


Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.


Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives—where your purpose accelerates our mission.


Senior Specialist IT UI/UX CoE


Reporting to Sr Manager, UI-UX CoE, the Senior Specialist IT UI/UX Center of Excellence, you will be responsible for leading and implementing our organization's UI/UX efforts in close collaboration with other IT teams and business stakeholders. Your role will be critical in driving a user-centered design approach while ensuring alignment with business objectives and technical feasibility.


Responsibilities:

* Research and evaluate user requirements/needs in collaboration with product managers and engineers using Design Thinking Methodology
* Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps, wireframes and prototypes (low to high fidelity)
* Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like
* Perform Prototype Testing and use feedback from stakeholders and end users to improve designs
* Identify and troubleshoot UX problems by performing UI & Accessibility Testing (e.g. responsiveness, UI)
* Ensure Portals are harmonized re-using already applied styles according to the branding guidelines
* Ensure design components and files are properly organized in Sketch and Invision
* Support Design Center of Excellence in building and maintaining a design system
* Support Design Center of Excellence with Design Reviews from other agencies


Requirements:

title: IT Engineer
description:
**This is where you save and sustain lives**


At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You'll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.


Baxter's products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.


Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.


Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives—where your purpose accelerates our mission.

**About Us**

Nothing changes if nothing changes, which is why Baxter is transforming our global IT function—into one that will strengthen partnerships and enable smarter, more efficient and connected business processes. In the dynamic healthcare industry, we need to be ready to face new challenges and opportunities. As we learn, we must be agile and innovative to reveal new ways of working. Technology and our digital capability will help create a more efficient and innovative ecosystem to enable our employees, customers and products to drive better outcomes for patients worldwide.


We are at the critical intersection where robust IT infrastructure and networking support meets the physicians, nurses and care givers who save and sustain lives. Together, we can build upon Baxter’s rich heritage to advance the next generation of transformative healthcare innovations. Together, we can change how IT meets healthcare. Together, we are Baxter.


This is where technology fuels purpose-driven work. Where your purpose accelerates our mission.

**Title: Spec, IT –** **PAM Centrify Engineer**

**Location: Bangalore**

**Your Role**


Subject matter expert in the design, development and implementation of identity and access management (IAM) solutions as well as Privileged Access Management (PAM) solutions to support critical systems, products, and business programs. Responsible for information security processes & controls to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of personal and health information, as well as corporate data. Hands-on, active member of the team, helping to drive business and security objectives forward.

**What you’ll be doing**

* Taking the lead on the execution of enterprise-wide identity and access management strategy, design and implementation of authentication, authorization, and administration capabilities of end-user and privileged accounts (admin, service etc.) in products, systems and infrastructure in the enterprise and cloud.
* Provide subject matter expertise on IAM specific capabilities to help customers design and implement Identity solutions such as but not limited to: Access Management, Governance and Attestation; Privileged Access Management, Multifactor/Single Sign On
* Leading the automation and implementation (including writing codes & scripts) of account provisioning, access review, sign-on, multi-factor authentication capabilities with identity protocols (SAML 2.0, WS-Federation, OpenID Connect, OAuth, SCIM, API etc.) to support identity federation and robust access control models (RBAC, ABAC).
* Define, review and onboarding of group/role, access policies (least privilege, step-up MFA with conditions) across multiple platforms, including but not limited to AWS, Delinea (Centrify +Thycotic ), Active Directory etc...
* Subject matter expert on security design and solution development in various security technologies (IAM, Encryption, SailPoint, Certificate Manager, Security Compliance tool etc.)
* Experience with AWS Cloud Security, Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system, AMI, scripting experience - preferably with Python, PowerShell and Perl.
* Support the access governance and periodic access review & recertification of privileged accounts (admin, service) in management portal, operating systems and databases in AWS, Azure and on-Prem
* Lead and/or participate in the evaluation and testing of new & emerging (disruptive) security technology (e.g. blockchain) both “on paper” and technical “proof of concept”.
* Architectural review of the application tools as per the Baxter standards and deployment of the same in Dev, Test and Prod environments.
* Stay educated on new product technology, tangential team capabilities, and other specific offerings or programs emerging within our company and within the IAM industry
* Identify areas for continued advancement of strategies aligned with Industry direction, client need, practice scope and present solutions to leadership.

**What you’ll bring**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or higher, and/or equivalent experience.
* At least 6+ years of relevant technical experience in IT.
* 3+ years of experience with AWS IAM, KMS & security, identity, & compliance services, and Delinea (Centrify + Thycotic secret server ) or similar COTS tools is preferred.
* 3+ years of software development and coding experience in any programming languages such as Python, Java, .NET, PowerShell, JSON. Experience with various open source software and development tools.
* Experience in automating & implementing identity & security solutions for cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure), SaaS deployment (Office 365, SailPoint, Salesforce, Workday) and on-premise IT landscapes. DevSecOps experience is a plus
* Knowledge of typical enterprise identity life cycle management processes and standards.
* Excellent analytical, problem solving, time management and task prioritization skills.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills including ability to interact effectively with developer community, technical staff, vendors, project stakeholders and senior management.
* Ability to work independently and cross-functionally supporting various integration and implementation projects.
* Experience working in large, complex, global environment, healthcare industry and regulatory controls such as HIPAA, GDPR, FDA, GxP, SOX is a plus.  

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
* Deployed, managed and supported any enterprise level IAM and PAM application and tools
* Demonstrated ability to communicate complex technical matters clearly and concisely orally and in writing.
* Familiar with enterprise IT processes for asset, configuration, change, incident and problem management
* Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly

**EEO (Equal Employment Opportunity)**

Baxter is an equal opportunity employer. Baxter evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.

title: IT Manager
description:
**About us**: We are passionate about driving financial inclusion and empowering rural communities across India. What sets us apart is our relentless commitment to continuous innovation and serving the underbanked and underserved sections of society.

Understanding the unique economic and social needs of rural populations, we strive to expand our reach and establish the largest micro ATM network in India. Our goal is to address the critical issue of limited access to ATMs and physical banking infrastructure in rural areas, ensuring equal access to financial services and opportunities for every individual. With cutting-edge technology and a dedicated team, we provide secure, reliable, and innovative financial solutions that drive positive change in the lives of millions of people.

**Job Description**:

We are looking for an innovative and strategic Product Manager with a background in the fintech industry to drive our product offerings.

As a Product Manager you will be responsible for developing and enhancing our suite of modern banking solutions.

**Responsibilities:**

* End-to-End ownership for creating product design, acquisition plan, journey integration and engagement.
* Lead cross-functional engineering projects to build and launch our new product, find product market fit, and grow the product.
* Develop an understanding of multiple financial services products and synergies between them
* Work with the UX team to create the entire customer journey on various channels.
* Lead the entire lifecycle of product development around this new product. This encompasses everything from researching, shaping the strategy, prioritizing the right MVP scope, creating detailed specs, to managing the execution and timeline of releases.
* Proactively working with the Internal teams include technology teams, design team, marketing, customer service etc.
* Actively work with internal and external stakeholders in order to ensure that the processes are well defined and implemented
* Discover deep customer insights to identify, evaluate, scope, and launch compelling new features to find product market fit.

title: Marketer
description:
We are seeking a dynamic and analytical MBA fresher to join our team as a Product Analyst. As a Product Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing market trends, assessing product performance, and identifying opportunities for product enhancement. This role offers an exciting opportunity to apply your business acumen and analytical skills to drive product strategy and success.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Market Analysis:**

Conduct market research to identify industry trends, competitive landscape, and customer preferences.

Analyze market data to assess potential market opportunities and threats.

Provide insights and recommendations to support product positioning and differentiation.

**Product Performance Evaluation:**

Analyze product performance data to identify areas for improvement and optimization.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement strategies to enhance product performance.

**Competitive Analysis:**

Track competitor activities and product offerings.

Benchmark product features and pricing against competitors.

Identify competitive strengths and weaknesses to inform product strategy.

**Product Strategy Support:**

Assist in developing product roadmaps based on market insights and business objectives.

Provide analytical support for product pricing, positioning, and go-to-market strategies.

Collaborate with product managers to prioritize features and enhancements based on market demand and business impact.

**Reporting and Presentation:**

Prepare reports and presentations summarizing key findings and insights.

Present analysis and recommendations to internal stakeholders, including senior management.

**Qualifications:**

MBA degree from a reputable institution in (Marketing, IT, Digital Marketing) or related field required.

Strong analytical skills with proficiency in Excel, data analysis tools, and statistical techniques.

Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.

Passion for technology and innovation.

This role offers an excellent opportunity for a recent **MBA graduate** to gain hands-on experience in product management and strategic analysis. If you are a motivated and analytical individual with a passion for driving product success, we encourage you to apply.

title: IT Manager
description:
**Centre Intro**
----------------


About \\_VOIS:


\\_VOIS (Vodafone Intelligent Solutions) is a strategic arm of Vodafone Group Plc, creating value and enhancing quality and efficiency across 28 countries, and operating from 7 locations: Albania, Egypt, Hungary, India, Romania, Spain and the UK.Over 29,000 highly skilled individuals are dedicated to being Vodafone Group’s partner of choice for talent, technology, and transformation. We deliver the best services across IT, Business Intelligence Services, Customer Operations, Business Operations, HR, Finance, Supply Chain, HR Operations, and many more.Established in 2006, \\_VOIS has evolved into a global, multi-functional organisation, a Centre of Excellence for Intelligent Solutions focused on adding value and delivering business outcomes for Vodafone.

**\\_VOIS Centre Intro**
-----------------------


About \\_VOIS India:  

In 2009, \\_VOIS started operating in India and now has established global delivery centres in Pune, Bangalore and Ahmedabad. With more than 14,500 employees, \\_VOIS India supports global markets and group functions of Vodafone, and delivers best-in-class customer experience through multi-functional services in the areas of Information Technology, Networks, Business Intelligence and Analytics, Digital Business Solutions (Robotics & AI), Commercial Operations (Consumer & Business), Intelligent Operations, Finance Operations, Supply Chain Operations and HR Operations and more.

**Job Responsibility**
----------------------


Role purpose:  

The New Company Code squad is a team dedicated to creating new SAP company codes. All new company codes will be a roll out of the existing EVO SCM template and will enable the Vodafone Core Business Process model.  

The EVO S/4 Digital Core is the Vodafone digital Platform for Finance and SCM. EVO runs on S/4 HANA.. The SCM scope goes across multiple SAP S4 modules and SAP cloud solutions such as SCM, Ariba and Fieldglass.  

The product manager will support the business in tailoring the EVO template to the new company code requirements. This support goes from Design to Go-Live. Furthermore, the product manager ensures the internal System integrator will deliver according to agreed requirements and the implementation follows the Vodafone template. In data migration the role owner will consult business and the migration team.  

In the company squad the product manager is the Single Point of Contact for everything regarding EVO Finance. However, the product manager is also part of the wider Product Management Team. A close align with the other product managers will allow the role owner to gather additional input and support whenever needed. Furthermore, the alignment with the other product managers, will allow the role owner to be informed about ongoing initiatives further enhancing the EVO digital core.  

Expectations:  

We are looking for a self-driven individual who can consult the business and who can challenge solutions provided by the SI to ensure Vodafone standards are achieved. The candidate will have comprehensive knowledge of SAP S4 Finance solutions and a strong knowledge how finance processes are implemented with SAP S4.


Must have technical / professional qualifications:

* Extensive experience of SAP/ERP implementations and methodologies. Agile training or experience is a plus.
* SAP Certified.
* Experience (over 5 years) in in large-scale and complex Business Transformation Programmes across multiple countries.
* Good understanding of several of the following SAP FI modules: GL, AR, AP, Assets, Overhead Cost Management, COPA, TCM.
* Strong knowledge of HP Quality Centre, SAP Solution Manager, Microsoft Office Applications and Microsoft SharePoint.
**\\_\\_VOIS Equal Opportunity Employer Commitment**
--------------------------------------------------


India: \\_VOIS is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We celebrate differences and we welcome and value diverse people and insights. We believe that being authentically human and inclusive powers our employees’ growth and enables them to create a positive impact on themselves and society. We do not discriminate based on age, colour, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender identity, gender expression, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.  

As a result of living and breathing our commitment, our employees have helped us get certified as a Great Place to Work in India for four years running. We have been also highlighted among the Top 5 Best Workplaces for Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion, Top 10 Best Workplaces for Women, Top 25 Best Workplaces in IT & IT-BPM and 14th Overall Best Workplaces in India by the Great Place to Work Institute in 2023. These achievements position us among a select group of trustworthy and high-performing companies which put their employees at the heart of everything they do.  

By joining us, you are part of our commitment. We look forward to welcoming you into our family which represents a variety of cultures, backgrounds, perspectives, and skills!


Apply now, and we’ll be in touch!

title: Social Media Specialist
description:
Social Media Expert / IT Professional

**Job Description**

Updating of Social Sites / Posting on Face Book, Instagram, Twitter, Youtube & Other Plat Form of Social Media and Comfortable for SEO & SMO / Websites Ranking.

A Social Media Specialist is a skilled professional responsible for developing and executing Social Media Strategies. Who create engaging Content, Optimize Company Pages, and foster community interaction. With expertise in Social Media Marketing and Analytics, Who drive Customer Engagement, Website Traffic & Revenue Growth.

Social media specialists are knowledgeable in various social media platforms and utilize analytics to drive customer engagement, website traffic, and revenue growth. Who having ful fledge knowledge of

· Social media management tools (e.g., Hootsuite, Buffer)

· Advertising platforms (e.g., Facebook Ads Manager, Google Ads)

· CRM systems (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce)

· Trend monitoring tools (e.g., Google Trends, Trendspottr)

The responsibilities of a social media specialist include building and executing social media strategies, generating and publishing daily content, optimizing company pages on various platforms, moderating user-generated content, analyzing social data, and collaborating with other departments to manage reputation and coordinate actions. They possess expertise in social media marketing, strong consulting and communication skills, and knowledge of web design and online marketing. A social media specialist is customer-oriented, detail-oriented, and capable of multitasking effectively.

**JOB Summary** 

- Updating of Social Sites.

- Posting on Social Sites

- Online Updating

**DESIRED CANDIDATE PROFILE**

- Having Great Experience in Same Field

- Good Communication Skills.

- Smart Personality.

- Ready to Travel.

- On-line Marketing

**Requirements-**  
**Educational Qualification :** Graduate/Post Graduate/MBA/Mass Communication –

**Responsibilities**

· Build and execute social media strategy through competitive research, platform determination, benchmarking, messaging and audience identification

· Generate, edit, publish and share daily content (original text, images, video or HTML) that builds meaningful connections and encourages community members to take action

· Set up and optimize company pages within each platform to increase the visibility of company’s social content

· Moderate all user-generated content in line with the moderation policy for each community

· Create editorial calendars and syndication schedules

· Continuously improve by capturing and analyzing the appropriate social data/metrics, insights and best practices, and then acting on the information

· Collaborate with other departments (customer relations, sales etc) to manage reputation, identify key players and coordinate actions

**Requirements and skills**

· Proven working experience in social media marketing or as a Digital Media Specialist

· Excellent consulting, writing, editing (photo/video/text), presentation and communication skills

· Demonstrable social networking experience and social analytics tools knowledge

· Adequate knowledge of web design, web development, CRO and SEO

· Knowledge of online marketing and good understanding of major marketing channels

· Positive attitude, detail and customer oriented with good multitasking and organisational ability.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
Job Requisition ID #
24WD75899
Position Overview  

Autodesk is the world's leading 3D software company. Being the leader requires a lot of data, coordination, and the information technology and support to lead that success. Autodesk is looking for someone to join our support organization to help us achieve our big data strategy and our product analytics.
You will be part of a multi-functional team providing production support for internal Autodesk data technologies from our Data Lake ingestion to analytics and reporting. Your knowledge of cloud computing and cloud services will help us provide a better experience to our product and IT projects. From troubleshooting and root cause analysis to code deployment to monitors and automation to cost optimization. Your career at Autodesk will be a blend of strategic support, engineering, and data provisioning. You will report to the manager. It's a hybrid work model.
Responsibilities
Data Reliability & Data Availability* Incident Management
* Issue resolution
* Facilitate Post Incident Analysis
* Continuous improvement


Cost Optimization* Identify the areas of improvement
* Right pricing model
* Measure, monitor and improve
* Infrastructure scaling


Day to day activities* Product Usage data pipeline support
* Optimize the utilization of the resources
* Automate the process of deployment
* Monitoring dashboards and alerting

  

Minimum Qualifications* 2+ years experience with Spark 3, Parquet, Hive, and other big data technology
* 2+ years experience with Snowflake
* 2+ years experience with integration tools (Airflow, FiveTran, Matillion)
* 4+ years experience working with Amazon (AWS) and other cloud operation models
* 3+ years working in a tech or data support position
* 2+ years experience with reporting tools (Preferably: Looker, Power BI, QlikView, Business Objects)
* 2+ years experience with AWS (Lambda, EC2, EKS, S3, IAM, CloudFormation, etc.)
* Experience with Git or other code control systems


Preferred Qualifications* Strong time management skills
* Strong troubleshooting skills
* Stakeholder Management & Mentorship skills
* Familiarity with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins
* Good experience with issue/ticket management tools like Service Now
* Strong communication skills, both written and oral
* Ability to work as part of a team, including sharing effort and information
* Experience working in Agile project patterns
* Design experience with any of the above required skills
* 5+ years working in information technology positions

  

#LI-KS2
Learn More
About Autodesk  

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.
We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – our Culture Code is at the core of everything we do. Our values and ways of working help our people thrive and realize their potential, which leads to even better outcomes for our customers.
When you’re an Autodesker, you can be your whole, authentic self and do meaningful work that helps build a better future for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!
Salary transparency
Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, we also have a significant emphasis on discretionary annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock or long-term incentive cash grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.
Diversity & Belonging

title: Software Engineer
description:
At Polaris Inc., we have fun doing what we love by driving change and innovation. We empower employees to take on challenging assignments and roles with an elevated level of responsibility in our agile working environment. Our people make us who we are, and we create incredible products and experiences that empower us to THINK OUTSIDE.
JOB SUMMARY:  

The Software Engineer will work on functional and technical role with Blue Yonder hosted solution. At Polaris, we optimize our whole goods supply chain along with our parts & accessories business using a hosted instance of Blue Yonder Planning systems.  

The Software Engineer is responsible for the code creation, unit testing, maintaining of the software and proving production support. The Software Engineer needs to effectively partner with product manager, scrum master, system analysts, other application developers and end users.  

This individual will analyze existing business processes and design technical specifications to develop systems, deliver code and integrations to other systems. This person must demonstrate passion for strengthening and enhancing business results through software development.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES :  

Software development* Transforms software design into executable Blue Yonder SCPO objects in accordance with Polaris standards.
* Write test scenarios, perform unit testing, system testing and document the results.
* Collaborate with other Software Engineers to implement the project.
* Ensures compliance with SOX.


System and Team Support* Provides day-to-day application support to project team and business users.
* Troubleshoots production problems and works to fix issues.
* Understands technology and systems infrastructure.
* Work with project teams on technical requirements, development, and implementation plans
* Value and embrace teamwork and collaboration and be responsible for successful completion of tasks.
* Help to keep the standard up to date and include innovative technology and learning.


Code and Process Review* Review code for ease of understanding and maintainability
* Review code and process with Project teams to assist in the understanding and flow.
* Create install distribution sets for monthly installs with Blue Yonder SCPO
* Ensures compliance with SOX


SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE* Bachelor’s degree in computer science/software design, Computer Information Systems or equivalent
* 8-10 years of experience in a Software Engineer/Developer role performing system analysis, writing technical specifications, coding, QA/testing
* Blue Yonder Planning (SCPO) – Demand, Enterprise Supply Planning, Inventory Optimization, Order Optimization, S&OP module development experience.
* Functional and technical experience with integration of Blue Yonder applications with ERP and Data Warehouse platforms.
* Strong database skills.
* Thrives in a fast-paced environment with multiple project assignments.
* Ability to effectively execute tasks while under pressure.
* Ability to work independently with minimum supervision.
* Excellent analytical and creative critical thinking skills
* Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
* Possesses strong organizational skills.
* Strong customer service orientation


Preferred Skills:* Azure/.net development
* SQL / Snowflake development
* Functional knowledge with manufacturing and supply chain business processes and data
* Experience with Agile Methodology.
* Experience with Jira or similar application.

*We are an ambitious, resourceful, and driven workforce, which empowers us to THINK OUTSIDE.**Apply today!*
About Polaris
As the global leader in powersports, Polaris Inc. (NYSE: PII) pioneers product breakthroughs and enriching experiences and services that have invited people to discover the joy of being outdoors since our founding in 1954. Polaris' high-quality product line-up includes the Polaris RANGER®, RZR® and Polaris GENERAL™ side-by-side off-road vehicles; Sportsman® all-terrain off-road vehicles; military and commercial off-road vehicles; snowmobiles; Indian Motorcycle® mid-size and heavyweight motorcycles; Slingshot® moto-roadsters; Aixam quadricycles; Goupil electric vehicles; and pontoon and deck boats, including industry-leading Bennington pontoons. Polaris enhances the riding experience with a robust portfolio of parts, garments, and accessories. Proudly headquartered in Minnesota, Polaris serves more than 100 countries across the globe.
EEO Statement  

Polaris is an Equal Opportunity Employer and will make all employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, familial status, status with regard to public assistance, membership or activity in a local commission, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law.

title: Senior Developer
description:
If you are a current DSV employee and interested in a position in another country, please contact your Human Resource representative to discuss the process and requirements of applying.


Job Req Number: 77593  

Time Type: Full Time


**Senior Software Developer with microservices experience**


**Ready to help build the IT future of DSV Solutions, one microservice at the time?**

  


We’re growing fast, making large acquisitions on the regular, and are transitioning to becoming a digital freight forwarder by introducing digital in everything that we do – and you will take on a central role in this.

  


**Join the evolution of IT at the core of DSV**  

At DSV Solutions, we partner with our customers to design and deliver logistics solutions for hundreds of logistics facilities across the world. We cover 4 vital delivery areas, including warehouse management systems, automations solutions and a host of connected and core applications that enable freight invoicing and settlement, customs. duty management and much more.

  

“You would join a new ‘Digital Product’ program and play a vital part in us developing strategic digital products and building a 2030-ready IT landscape. Herewith, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your own role, as well as the software architecture and developer experience in DSV Solutions IT” says Sander Bastiaens, Manager, Digital Product

  


**Software development with impact**


To spearhead the ‘Digital Product’ team, we are looking for a senior software developer, with hands-on experience with programming microservices. Your preferred microservice frameworks are Java - Spring Boot or C# .NET - ASP.NET.


On a typical workday, you would be:


* Implementing best-of-class microservices, in the context of
	+ A monolith-to-microservices conversion project
	+ New products that deliver business value
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to co-build.
* Providing technical guidance on doing-microservices: practices, patterns, ….
* Wearing different developer hats (architectural analysis to code implementation), if this is something you like to do.


**Great responsibilities, great influence**


Working on strategic and global focus projects will come with ample responsibility, visibility to senior management, and impact. We do work with relatively open deadlines, as to have time to experiment and develop better software.


“In this role, you will be empowered to voice your opinion, take decisions and execute on our exciting mission.” – Sander.

  


**You build best-in-class microservices that will bring business value.**


A software developer background is required to be successful in this role. We envision someone, who:


* Enjoys coding.
* Is a pragmatic **doer** with a mindset and drive that fits our digitalisation initiative.
* Has strong programming proficiency and experience with microservices frameworks.
* Has a proven track record of developing high-quality, secure microservice-based products.
* Might even have worked on a monolith-to-microservices conversion of a high-load, critical system (this is a plus).
* Has expertise with, or affinity for quickly adopting, related tools and technologies: Cloud (Azure), CI/CD, (Open)API, containerisation, event architecture, … just to name a few.


Our ideal candidate brings 3+ years of relevant experience.

  

**Want to know more and apply?**

We will happily answer any questions you may have regarding the position and about your options in DSV. You are welcome to mail Sander Bastiaens, Manager, Digital Products on sander.bastiaens@dsv.com.


We look forward to receiving your application via the link below as soon as possible. We will process the applications as we receive them.

  

**DSV – Global Transport and Logistics**


DSV is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. We conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. When you join DSV, you are working for one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. You’ll join a talented team of approximately 75,000 employees in over 80 countries, working passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high-quality services. DSV aspires to lead the way towards a more sustainable future for our industry and are committed to trading on nature’s terms.


We promote collaboration and transparency and strive to attract, motivate and retain talented people in a culture of respect. If you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we’ll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career.


Visit dsv.com and follow us on Facebook and Twitter.

description:
GAQ224R78



At Databricks Information Technology, we are a product led organisation transforming the way we work from how easy it is to use our IT services to the applications we develop that help us scale seamlessly in face of incredible growth.



You will join a growing IT Data Analytics, Engineering & Integration team that supports SaaS business applications, working with other integration and systems engineers to support scaling our business operations.



You will develop integration infrastructure and improve the operation and maintenance of our existing integration systems through iterative upgrades, streamlining, and adoption of standard methodology. You will also support company-level programs for transforming Databricks business processes and provide integration expertise and solutions.


**The impact you will have:**


**Design/Strategy:** The Application Integration Engineer designs and supports the application integration between multiple business applications and systems. In this capacity, the Application Integration Engineer will design and develop systems of high availability integration architecture with future expansion in mind.


**Collaboration:** The role that the Application Integration Engineer plays is collaborative and works with business and application team members in an attempt to gather data integration requirements.


**Analytics:** You will play an analytical role in quickly and thoroughly analyzing requirements for reporting and analysis and subsequently translating the emanating results into good technical data designs. In this capacity, the Integration Engineer establishes the documentation of integration, develops, and maintains technical specification documentation for all processes.


**What we look for:**


* 4+ years of demonstrated expertise in implementing creative enterprise application integration solutions and meeting requirements
* 2+ years of experience with Mulesoft OR any other integrations tool
* **Programming experience with Python is highly preferred**
* Experience deploying **APIs** using **SOAP and REST**
* **Experience working with business and application partners and product managers to gather data integration requirements and to translate into good technical data designs**
* Experience developing, profiling, and troubleshooting custom applications, including experience with JEE, JMS, and Tomcat
* Experience in RDBMS and Distributed databases
* Proficient in modern SaaS DevOps and CI/CD tools and operating environments
* **Programming experience in Python, Golang or Scala**
* Experience with big data tools, such as Spark
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies for development, security, maintenance, operations, monitoring, and updates


**Benefits**


* Benefits allowance
* Employee's Provident Fund
* Equity awards
* Gym reimbursement
* Annual personal development fund
* Work headphones reimbursement
* Business travel insurance

**About Databricks**



Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.


**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**



At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.


**Compliance**


**If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.**

title: IT Analyst
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 **Risk Consulting - Protect Tech – Manager (IT Risk - SAP)**

**Key responsibilities**  

The purpose of this role will be to supervise delivery, provide technical and project leadership to your team members, as well as build relationships with clients. While delivering quality client services and enabling high-performing teams, you will drive high-value work products within expected timeframes and budget. You will monitor progress, manage risks and ensure key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes. Additionally, you will:

* Foster an innovative and inclusive team-oriented work environment. Play an active role in counselling and mentoring junior consultants within the firm.
* Consistently deliver quality client services. Drive high-quality work products within expected timeframes and on budget. Monitor progress manage risk and ensure key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes.
* Use knowledge of the current IT environment and industry trends to identify engagement and client service issues and communicate this information to the engagement team and client management through written correspondence and verbal presentations. Stay abreast of current business and industry trends relevant to the client's business.
* Foster relationships with client personnel to analyse, evaluate, and enhance information systems to develop and improve security at procedural and technology levels.
* Assist with cultivating and managing business development opportunities. Understand EY and its service lines and actively assess/present ways to serve clients.
* Demonstrate deep technical capabilities and professional knowledge. Demonstrate ability to quickly assimilate to new knowledge.

 **To qualify for the role, you must have**

* A bachelor or master’s degree and at least 5-7 years of related work experience
* Deep understanding of SAP business processes (e.g., purchase-to-pay, record-to-report, order-to-cash). SAP ECC/S4 Experience:
	+ Experience in Internal controls within SAP ECC/S4 Applications and their integrations and strong understanding of IT application controls, IT general controls and interface controls. Build or design security around SAP ECC, APO, BW, GRC, HANA, BOBJ, BPC, S/4 & FIORI AND/OR
	+ Strong understanding of Segregation of Duties and User provisioning, experience implementing and supporting SAP GRC - Access Risk Analysis (ARA) and Emergency Access Management (EAM) modules AND/OR
	+ Experience implementing and supporting multiple SAP ECC, S/4 implementations in a Functional role. Have an understanding of configurations, and set ups, and security architecture
* Excellent leadership and teaming skills, with ability to train, coach and manage staff
* A willingness to travel to meet client needs
* Professionals with SAP certification preferred, Good to have additional Industry related certification such as CISA, CISM etc.

 **EY | Building a better working world**

  

  

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

  

  

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

  

  

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Product Owner
description:
**About the IT Hub at Nestlé**


We are a multicultural and diverse team of IT professionals driving the biggest IT operations landscape of the FMCG industry, and a Digital Transformation at scale. We work with leading technologies and top external partners to provide solutions to enable Nestlé to engage with millions of consumers and customers worldwide. We transform how we use data with machine learning, advanced analytics, and introduce automation to drive Industry 4.0 opportunities.  

  

We look for people who are curious, courageous, innovative, collaborative, and passionate about new technologies. If this is you and you want to make an impact globally, join us and there will be no limits to your career.

 **Position Summary**


To strengthen our IT Hub in Bangalore, we are looking for an **IT Product Owner** within our **Data Analytics Products and Services** (DAPS) product group for HR. In this position, you will work closely with IT, portfolio management and the HR function, internal & external development teams and business teams to specify, plan, design and develop, deploy and sustain high-performing HR analytics products at scale, in order to delight our business stakeholders and receivers.

  



**What you will do**

* Engage with Product Managers, Business Analysts and Architects of IT and ADI Streams for understanding the data and analytics needs of Nestlé HR.
* Partner with IT HR Stream and Corporate Function, Zone and markets to understand, analyse, translate, and document business requirements, pain points or opportunities.
* Work with external partners, to design and build data and analytics products that deliver business value as efficiently as possible. You will deliver data models using a range of On-premise and Cloud toolsets, including SAPBW with HANA, new generation analytics platforms such as Azure, Snowflake, and PowerBI.
* You will create data and analytics products to support both standard reporting and more advanced analytics and machine learning use cases.
* You will work using waterfall and agile development methodologies, sometimes acting as Scrum Master, sometimes as Project lead, sometimes also being the lead solution designer.
* Be the custodian of the data models and flows within your scope, ensuring they remain compliant with policies around data security and solution design standards and best practices.
* You will work with external and internal colleagues to ensure training materials for the Product area are documented, as well as oversee the handover to deployment and sustain teams.
* Support the development and curation of data products in the data catalogue
* Support Product Managers/Product Group Managers through the full product lifecycle from new product initiation through to product retirement.

 **What will make you successful**

* Bachelors or Masters degree in computer science, engineering, maths, finance, statistics or related discipline.
* Most likely you will come from a developer background, with 10+ years experience of building data assets and pipelines to serve analytics use cases.
* Whilst capable of performing hands-on development, you are keen to progress to leading and coaching others. You are keen to drive the work of developments teams or pods to be able to create solutions at scale.
* You have a track record of delivering analytics products at scale using SAP-BW, plus newer-generation data warehousing platforms e.g. Azure services and Snowflake. Ideally you have experience of using modern front-end analytics tools such as PowerBI and SAP SAC.
* Project Management experience would be desirable, working in dispersed teams in multiple locations and using both waterfall and agile/DevOps development methodologies.
* A good understanding of data engineering and architecture standards.
* Strong experience with effective communication at different levels in the organization and in English.
* An appreciation for data democratization and the F.A.I.R data principles.
* It is preferable to have some exposure to Portfolio management and financial KPIs and domain knowledge, particularly in relation to analytics.
* Be autonomous and proactive in proposing action plans, establishing relationships and engaging with different areas of the IT organization and the business.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
Every career journey is personal. That's why we empower you with the tools and support to create your own success story.
Be challenged. Be heard. Be valued. Be you ... be here.
Job Summary
The System Analyst 3 will write technical requirements and optimize technical solutions for a specific program or project in a domain or cross-domain. This role will participate in the quarterly increment planning with the Technology Intake Analyst. Additionally, this role will break out user stories for the Scrum Team as part of the planning process. The System Analyst III works closely with the engineering, quality engineers, product management, and business stakeholders to elicit and document technical requirements. This role conducts process analysis, needs assessments, and technical solution analysis in an effort to align information technology solutions with initiatives and stays up to date with new technologies, processes, and industry standards. Additionally, this role will look for new ways to optimize systems and protocols and will monitor technical debt, utilizing business partnerships. The System Analyst III will support the System Analysis Community of Practice, and contribute and maintain materials in the confluence knowledge base. This role will serve as domain mentors to System Analysts 1– 2.
Job Description
Essential Job Functions:*Project Management -* Be a trusted advisor in their specific assigned domain, which is comprised of several application systems. As the subject matter expert in these application systems, answer questions and provide guidance about current state system functionality, and assist in testing, production research, configuration updates, production remediation and integration. Lead certain phases of large-scale projects to ensure the delivered product will effectively meet the business need and oversee the end-to-end implementation of the technology solutions.*Requirement* *Elicitation/Documentation* *-* Conduct functional process analysis, needs assessments, and elicit functional requirements in order to recommend technical solutions that deliver value. Collaborate with internal and external customers to document user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify systems. Write clear requirements and demonstrate the ability to communicate to all levels of stakeholders to ensure the requirements are understood. When utilizing Agile Methodology, document requirements via user stories and acceptance criteria in the Gherkin format. When utilizing Waterfall Methodology, document requirements via traditional requirement statements. Be the technical liaison between Information Technology (IT) developers and end users for internal and external team projects.*Application Analysis -* Demonstrate technical aptitude by understanding current state functionality. Understand application environment, interfaces between applications, and interfaces with third party vendors, including APIs. Work with core mainframe systems and digital systems. Recommend technical solutions for application enhancements to meet needs. Create and maintain system documentation.*Data Analysis –* Understand database structure and identify relationships. Identify and recommend database enhancements to support needs. Map data across multiple systems. Write and execute SQL queries to analyze data and use SAS as applicable. Demonstrate attention to detail and accuracy by analyzing data and drawing conclusions based upon the data. Create and maintain configuration settings, system documentation, and generate and report on metrics.*Infrastructure Analysis –* Understand current state infrastructure environment related to each project. Understand the details of functions in order to identify, develop, and implement effective technology solutions that address small to medium complex issues. Identify system requirements that impact infrastructure. Communicate infrastructure changes to project stakeholders.*Information Security Policy Analysis -* Understand current state informational and data security policies and procedures. Identify informational security and data requirements based upon project and system needs. Collaborate with Information Security (IS), IT governance, IT Risk, Global Audit, and Continuity partners to ensure that applications comply with all policy and procedures.*SDLC Support -* Provide requirement traceability and support from concept to project delivery. Advise in the creation of test plans/scripts to ensure compliance of requirement specification. Validate program designs, unit testing, and integration test results to ensure compliance with requirements. Understand defect management and use JIRA. Demonstrate ability to organize and prioritize work in order to work on multiple projects over the same period.*Communications –* Demonstrate foundational knowledge of credit card operations, banking, financials, loyalty rewards, and credit card regulatory while working with various areas of the business. Work with clients and Client Partnership for integration for onboarding new clients and new product capabilities. Demonstrate leadership by driving projects to meet milestone dates, utilize critical thinking skills to help analyze problems and recommend solutions, and collaborate with stakeholders to resolve problems and gain consensus on the best solution.
Reports To:
Technical Head - Systems Analysis (Senior Manager or Director, System Analysis)
Direct Reports:
None
Working Conditions/ Physical Requirements:* Normal office environment.


Minimum Qualifications:* Diploma or Graduate or Post-Graduate.
* 4+ years of experience working in Technology.
* 4+ years of experience working in a System Analyst role.


Preferred Qualifications:* Bachelor's degree in computer science, management information systems, or engineering.
* Experience in the financial services domain.
* Experience working in an Agile development environment.
* Experience working within a finance organization, using strong functional knowledge around financial systems and processes (budgeting, consolidation, forecasting, reporting, financial statements, analytics to achieve results).


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:* Product knowledge
* Business acumen
* Agile lifecycle management
* Lean principles
* Agile estimation and forecasting
* Application testing support
* Tracking and reporting
* Expert user story creation
* Change management
* Backlog management/grooming
* Risk management
* Stakeholder relationship management
* Written and verbal communication
* Critical thinking
* Influence
* Emotional intelligence
* Conflict management
* Cross-functional leadership


This job description is illustrative of the types of duties typically performed by this job. It is not intended to be an exhaustive listing of each and every essential function of the job. Because job content may change from time to time, the Company reserves the right to add and/or delete essential functions from this job at any time.
About Bread Financial
At Bread Financial, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your career, give back to your community, and be a part of our award-winning culture. We’ve been consistently recognized as a best place to work in many markets and we’re proud to promote an environment where you feel appreciated, accepted, valued, and fulfilled—both personally and professionally. Bread Financial supports the overall wellness of our associates with a diverse suite of benefits and offers boundless opportunities for career development and non-traditional career progression.
Bread Financial is a tech-forward financial services company providing simple, personalized payment, lending and saving solutions. The company creates opportunities for its customers and partners through digitally enabled choices that offer ease, empowerment, financial flexibility and exceptional customer experiences. Driven by a digital-first approach, data insights and white-label technology, Bread Financial delivers growth for its partners through a comprehensive product suite, including private label and co-brand credit cards, installment lending, and buy now, pay later (BNPL). Bread Financial also offers direct-to-consumer solutions that give customers more access, choice and freedom through its branded Bread Cashback American Express® Credit Card and Bread Savings products.
Headquartered in Columbus, Ohio, Bread Financial is powered by its 7,500+ global associates and is committed to sustainable business practices.* All job offers are contingent upon successful completion of credit and background checks.
* Bread Financial is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
