Information Technology
Job Type:
Regular

title: Trading Manager
description:
3M has a long-standing reputation as a company committed to innovation. We provide the freedom to explore and encourage curiosity and creativity. We gain new insight from diverse thinking, and take risks on new ideas. Here, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter.
Job Description:
Trade Compliance IT Product Manager (m/f/\\*) (New Health Care Company)
3M is establishing two industry-leading companies, creating value through the spin-off of its Health Care business, while 3M will continue to be a global material science leader, focusing our innovation to win in favorable global megatrends and attractive end markets. This new Health Care Company will be a leading global diversified health technology company with:* Proven category leadership
* Exposure to attractive end-markets
* Innovation mindset driving improved patient outcomes
* Collaborative customer relationships
* Deep global regulatory experience
* Operational excellence and strong cash flow
* Strong sales growth and profitability with significant recurring sales


We expect the creation of the two companies will be completed by the end of Q1 2024. For now, we will continue to operate as one global company. This role is positioned to drive the success of the "New Health Care Company”.
This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military experience to a 3M career.
The Impact You’ll Make in this Role
As a Trade Compliance IT Product Manager, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:* Taking IT responsibility for all SpinCo Trade Compliance IT platforms
* Working across the function to ensure successful and timely exit from relevant TSA’s (Transitional Service Agreements)
* Engaging in the global cross-functional blueprinting of the new ERP eco-system to drive realization, work to include:
	+ learning ERP solution functionality;
	+ alignment of business requirements with system capabilities;
	+ process design, proof of concept, input to functional design development that compliments technical capabilities of the system, and development testing.
* Supporting the Go-Live and System Stabilization activities during deployment.
* Working with relevant stakeholders to develop value propositions and prioritise the development of future solution capabilities.
* Managing vendor relationships including estimating requirements, providing work direction and holding vendors accountable


Your Skills and Expertise
To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications:* Bachelor’s Degree or higher from an accredited university


OR* High School Diploma/GED from an accredited institution and a minimum of (14) years of experience in IT project management, system deployment or system support.

* Five (5) years of experience in IT project management, system deployment or system support in a private, public, government or military environment


Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:* Experience with designing, developing, supporting and deploying trade compliance solutions
* Experience with SAP GTS or GTS in S/4HANA
* Experience managing third party software providers.
* Proven track record of successfully leading global or regional, complex IT system implementations.
* Familiar with supply chain systems within an Healthcare environment.
* In-depth knowledge of cloud technology.
* Excellent project management skills, including the ability to manage timelines, resources, and risks effectively.
* Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate across departments and lead cross-functional teams.


For current employees, internal transfer restrictions may not apply. For more details, contact your local recruiter/HR team.
Work location:* Work Your Way Eligible (Employee choice to work remote, on site, or hybrid)


Travel: May include up to 20% domestic/international
Relocation Assistance: May be authorized
Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).
Supporting Your Well-being
3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.
Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.
3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement  

Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.
Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the  

 terms.

title: Developer
description:
Flex is the diversified manufacturing partner of choice that helps market-leading brands design, build and deliver innovative products that improve the world.
We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion and cultivate a workplace culture of belonging that views uniqueness as a competitive edge and builds a community that enables our people to push the limits of innovation to make great products that create value and improve people's lives.
A career at Flex offers the opportunity to make a difference and invest in your growth in a respectful, inclusive, and collaborative environment. If you are excited about a role but don't meet every bullet point, we encourage you to apply and join us to create the extraordinary.
Job Description
To support our extraordinary teams who build great products and contribute to our growth, we’re looking to add an Automation Developer - IT in Chennai, India.  

What a typical day looks like:* Develop complex Web applications & Automations for Flex Business teams.
* Work directly with business domain experts and solution managers to understand the business needs and design software solutions that meet the business needs.
* Develop complex software solutions using Agile Methodology
* Perform code reviews and evaluate the work of other individuals to ensure artifacts meet quality standards. Provide feedback on code reviews and evaluations.
* Work with compliance team on adherence of compliance.
* Perform quarterly/monthly security audits.
* Ensure that project tasks are completed within established time frames.
* Stay current on technologies, current issues, trends and tools affecting software application development. Assist in the evaluation and implementation of new tools and skills for the organization.
* May perform other duties as assigned by management.

  

The experience we’re looking to add to our team:* 3-5 years of experience in VBA, PowerApps or any Low code Platform, C#, Tableau, UiPath
* Demonstrated expert knowledge of the Applications Development for large enterprise/customers - VBA, PowerApps or any Low code Platform, Tableau, UiPath
* Solid experience with Application Development Platforms and Tools – VBA, C#, PowerApps, Tableau
* Sound experience of developing complex automation solutions using VBA & C#
* Experience with Agile and Scrum methodologies.
* A good understanding of formal software development practices and procedures, Source code management process using Azure Devops or GitHub


What you’ll receive for the great work you provide:* Health Insurance
* PTO

title: IT Assistant
description:
As an IT Sales Executive, you will play a pivotal role in driving the sales of Information Technology (IT) products and services. Your primary responsibility will be to cultivate and expand relationships with clients, understand their business needs, and strategically promote and sell IT solutions. This position requires a combination of technical knowledge, excellent communication skills, and a strong ability to understand and convey complex IT concepts to clients.

Responsibilities:

Client Relationship Management:

Build and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential clients.

Understand client requirements and business objectives to propose suitable IT solutions.

Sales Strategy Development:

Develop and implement effective sales strategies to achieve and exceed sales targets.

Collaborate with the sales team and other departments to align strategies with overall business goals.

Product and Industry Knowledge:

Stay updated on the latest IT trends, products, and services.

Clearly articulate the features and benefits of IT solutions to clients.

Lead Generation and Prospecting:

Identify potential clients and generate leads through various channels.

Conduct market research to identify new opportunities and stay ahead of industry trends.

Proposal and Presentation:

Prepare and deliver compelling presentations and proposals to clients.

Work closely with technical teams to ensure accurate and effective solution proposals.

Negotiation and Closing:

Negotiate terms and conditions with clients to ensure a win-win outcome.

Close sales deals and achieve revenue targets within established timelines.

Sales Reporting and Analysis:

Provide regular sales reports, forecasts, and updates to management.

Analyze sales performance data to identify areas for improvement and optimization.

Customer Satisfaction:

Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction by addressing client concerns and providing excellent post-sales support.

Foster long-term relationships to encourage repeat business and referrals.

Requirements:

Proven experience in IT sales or a related field.

Strong understanding of IT products, services, and solutions.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.

Proactive and result-oriented approach to sales.

Familiarity with CRM software and sales analytics tools.

Education and Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, IT, or a related field.

Additional certifications in sales or IT are a plus.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: ₹11,035.62 - ₹40,000.00 per month

Schedule:

* Day shift

Supplemental pay types:

* Commission pay
* Performance bonus

Experience:

* total work: 2 years (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Chandigarh, Chandigarh (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Chandigarh, Chandigarh: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Field Marketer
description:
SonicWall delivers Boundless Cybersecurity for the hyper-distributed era in a work reality where everyone is remote, mobile, and unsecure. SonicWall safeguards organizations mobilizing for their new business normal with seamless protection that stops the most evasive cyberattacks across boundless exposure points and increasingly remote, mobile, and cloud-enabled workforces. By knowing the unknown, providing real-time visibility and enabling breakthrough economics, SonicWall closes the cybersecurity business gap for enterprises, governments and SMBs worldwide. For more information, visit https://www.sonicwall.com/ or follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, and Instagram.  

  

Ready to do your part in the cyber arms race? SonicWall offers fun, high-energy work environments at the leading edge of technology, networking, and cybersecurity. Whether you're in sales, marketing, engineering, product management, technical support, or finance, you'll have real opportunities to help protect more than 500,000 organizations across the globe. If you're ready for a career that can impact change — and not just another job — join one of committed and enthusiastic SonicWall teams in offices around the world.


Title : Field and Partner Marketing Manager



Location : Bangalore OR Mumbai OR Delhi - Remote


**General Responsibilities:**



SonicWall is looking for Field and Partner Marketing Manager owning the planning, development and execution of all field marketing activities, both direct and indirect via resellers and distributors in the India market. The role reports to the Field and Partner Marketing, Senior Manager APJ.


**NOTE:** Preferably with experience with Cyber/Network Security in IT firm/Tech Vendor.


**General Requirements:**



The individual will work closely with the APJ and India sales leadership, as well as the global and APJ regional marketing team to develop a marketing plan supporting India and pan-APJ's business goals and targets.


**Responsibilities:**


* Own the planning, developing, and implementing of marketing programs in the India market to drive lead generation, partner recruitment and enablement - implemented directly by SonicWall and indirectly as through-partner activities.
	+ Collaborate closely with India sales leadership and global marketing team, develop an annual field marketing plan and quarterly programs to support the sales team in delivering pipeline and revenue goals for the India market.
	+ Evaluate, prioritize and manage field events (onsite and digital), ensuring an end-to-end pre-event, at-event, and post-event strategy to increase engagement, response rates and ROI.
	+ Manage and execute MDF-financed partner marketing activities for the India market.
	+ Work closely with global demand gen, social media and PR team to execute the programs in the India market and drive optimal results.
	+ Manage and own field marketing budget for the India market.
	+ Work closely with SDR to timely manage sales leads obtained from in-market marketing programs.
	+ Monitor campaign results and optimize campaigns for the India market to drive optimal ROI.
	+ Manage marketing agencies and 3rd parties in the execution of programs.
	+ Develop new customer case studies and video testimonials for the India market.
	+ Provide support for pan-APJ marketing programs on a function or project-basis as defined.

**Requirements:**


* The role will own the strategic planning as well as tactical execution and analysis of marketing programs
* Tactics cover the complete marketing mix, including but not limited to digital campaigns, social media, webcasts, events and PR.
* The position requires a blend of strong marketing execution and communication capabilities along with
* The ability to build and manage relationships with both internal and external (partner) marketing, sales and executive teams.
* Looking for an energetic, upstart marketing professional, that can
* + work autonomously but loves to interact with others
	+ doesn't hesitate to build relationships across countries, continents and cultures and
	+ brings a strong team spirit.
* This role is based in either Bangalore, Mumbai or Delhi and offers a hybrid working arrangement (travel when required)


**Education and Experience:**


* 5+ years of experience in B2B marketing, experience in channel environments and IT security industry is advantageous.
* Demonstrates autonomous, proactive and structured way of working.
* Actively collaborates with the various functions and stakeholders across the organization.
* Drives collaboration with external partners and internal teams to ensure flawless execution
* Possesses excellent organizational and time management skills.
* Effective communication and presentation skills
* Displays a results-driven and problem-solving mindset.
* Maintains an open mindset and has experience in a cross-cultural matrix organization.
* Fluent in written and oral English is a must.


#LI-NR5



#Field Marketing #Channel Marketing #Partner Marketing #Event Management #Information Technology

title: Environmental Analyst
description:
About BNP Paribas India Solutions:


Established in 2005, BNP Paribas India Solutions is a wholly owned subsidiary of BNP Paribas SA, European Union’s leading bank with an international reach. With delivery centers located in Bengaluru, Chennai and Mumbai, we are a 24x7 global delivery center. India Solutions services three business lines: Corporate and Institutional Banking, Investment Solutions and Retail Banking for BNP Paribas across the Group. Driving innovation and growth, we are harnessing the potential of over 10000 employees, to provide support and develop best-in-class solutions.


About BNP Paribas Group:


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank and key player in international banking. It operates in 65 countries and has nearly 185,000 employees, including more than 145,000 in Europe. The Group has key positions in its three main fields of activity: Commercial, Personal Banking & Services for the Group’s commercial & personal banking and several specialised businesses including BNP Paribas Personal Finance and Arval; Investment & Protection Services for savings, investment, and protection solutions; and Corporate & Institutional Banking, focused on corporate and institutional clients. Based on its strong diversified and integrated model, the Group helps all its clients (individuals, community associations, entrepreneurs, SMEs, corporates and institutional clients) to realize their projects through solutions spanning financing, investment, savings and protection insurance. In Europe, BNP Paribas has four domestic markets: Belgium, France, Italy, and Luxembourg. The Group is rolling out its integrated commercial & personal banking model across several Mediterranean countries, Turkey, and Eastern Europe. As a key player in international banking, the Group has leading platforms and business lines in Europe, a strong presence in the Americas as well as a solid and fast-growing business in Asia-Pacific. BNP Paribas has implemented a Corporate Social Responsibility approach in all its activities, enabling it to contribute to the construction of a sustainable future, while ensuring the Group's performance and stability


Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion


At BNP Paribas, we passionately embrace diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where all employees are valued, respected and can bring their authentic selves to work. We prohibit Discrimination and Harassment of any kind and our policies promote equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants, irrespective of, but not limited to their gender, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, colour, national origin, age, religion, social status, mental or physical disabilities, veteran status etc. As a global Bank, we truly believe that inclusion and diversity of our teams is key to our success in serving our clients and the communities we operate in.


About Business line/Function:


ALMT function is responsible for Asset Liabilities management and treasury activity of BNP Paribas. It also handles Bank’s funding needs and risk management activities. ALMT IT is a Deal Capture & Deal Processing Application catering to IT demands of ALMT functions within the bank.


**OMR** is a settlement application used to handle the settlement and associated functionality of local booking within ALMT world in BNP Paribas. OMR IT team supports the above functionality through customizations on the vendor product OMR, design and development of interfaces that communicate with other applications as part of the settlement lifecycle and also through a set of Business Objects reports that provide insights and necessary control for the Operations and Business

**Direct Responsibilities**


The role of the Environment & DevOps Analyst within the organization is to understand the design of environments and execute the activities necessary to the delivery of the environments. They will be involved in the understanding the processes and toolsets to setup, monitor non-prod environments, troubleshoot environment related issues, automate non prod management tasks through use of available CI/CD tools and scripts, share environment status reports as required.


**Contributing Responsibilities**


* Understanding the non prod environment infrastructure and application components


* Help understand all technical aspects of non-prod environment setup and various components of the application including the setups needed for filesystem, MQ, Oracle DB, Linux, inhouse application components Implementing the environments for each application with associated configuration items and interfaces (provisioning of infrastructure and database, deployment of software, installing/refreshing data, setting up the interfaces, setting up the required access rights)


* Work closely with the environment manager to understand the needs of the project teams and plan and setup the environments as per the criteria requested. Environment Build and Setup would include the hardware, software, integrations and data required to support the environment setup


* Help assist with application patches to be deployed on one or more environments as necessary


* Run application batch cycles as necessary and requested for the environment setup


* Assist in the setup and maintenance of DevSecOps pipeline for all components of the non prod environment setup.Should have basic knowledge on CI/CD tools like Jenkins, artifactory, autosys, cyberark

* Coordinate with Infrastructure and Application teams to resolve environment issues and fulfil requests to provide a stable working non-prod environment in accordance with the requirements.


* Perform housekeeping and regular maintenance activity on the non-prod environments. Improve efficiency in doing so through automation in the maintenance activities


* Understanding the tools within the environment, it`s basic operations and the required integrations


* Work closely with the environment manager to build governance around environment reservations, maintaining SLA`s, establishing best practices, setting up of selective and safe self servicing mechanisms for users thus enabling smoother non-prod environment setups and management.


* Drawing upon specialist skills (such as a configuration management subject matter expert) within the organization, orchestrating their activities


* Create build books and document SOPs for Test environment build/setup and all kind of requests


* Following the defined standard operating procedure for delivery of test environments.


* Following the standard procedures to monitor, support and report on each environment availability


* Root cause analysis and Long term solution for problems


* Identify service improvements and focus on continuous improvements in the non prod env. management.

---------------------------------------

* Hands on experience in non-prod environment setup and maintenance


* Advanced Unix Shell scripting knowledge to be able to write shell scripts on demand as per requirement

title: IT Manager
description:
**Roles and Responsibilities**

* We are looking for a Sales Manager who will be involved in new client acquisitions in the enterprise Hi-Tech/Technology vertical.
* The right individual must be a self- starter, comfortable with ambiguity and have a can do growth mindset

**Desired Candidate Profile**

* Drive new pipeline opportunities by hunting using inside sales, marketing, direct prospecting etc. Experienced sales and service professional within the high-tech industry Knowledgeable in multiple technical areas specifically in SAAS Based products

**Qualification**

* Must have (3+) Years of IT Sales/Business Development Experience, particularly in the IT Services and sales management experience including software solution selling. Previous experience in a technology services organization and have system strong presentation and communication skills, make frequent contact with potential clients, established clients, and local/national business leaders to promote in house IT software solution/Product. Experience working in a cross-functional environment, working with Multiple Stakeholders -Delivery, Practice/pre-sales, etc.
* Identify Project Sales (IT Services) opportunities and use market intelligence to pre-empt competition in target accounts.
* Establishes and maintains business relationships with internal and external customers closes new business deals by coordinating requirements; developing and negotiating contracts; integrating contract requirements with business operations.
* Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations. Enhances organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.
* Following up on new business opportunities and setting up meetings.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: ₹25,722.44 - ₹60,990.30 per month

Schedule:

* Day shift

Experience:

* IT Sales: 5 years (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Hyderabad, Telangana: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: IT Executive
description:
Dear Applicants,  
Greetings!!

PTS is one of the fastest-growing SAP Partners in India. We are continuous working towards timely delivery of intricate solutions to Large, Small,

and Mid-Sized Enterprises (SMEs) in diverse industry verticals. PTS is managed by highly experienced professionals.

With an objective to provide the management of business enterprises with more value, control, and visibility through the successful

implementation of ERP and business management solutions that bring tangible and measurable benefits with improved operational efficiency,

profitability, and growth.

**RESPONSIBLE FOR:** Business Growth, Appointment with leads, Revenue Generation, team handling and management

**ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

Reporting to the Chief Business Head, you will be responsible for leads and manages all sales operations and oversees activities of the junior sales management team.

The key objective is responsible for the overall planning, strategy, direction and control of all sales in the allocated accounts; achievement of agreed sales targets; and the development of future sales plans. Responsible for building and maintaining sales pipeline in CRM and submitting required sales forecasts.

grow incremental and new sales for the business while simultaneously reducing customer turnover. You will also identify areas of business under-performance and influence leaders to adapt to the needs of a structured IT-based reporting system.

This is a great opportunity to join a PTS and be a key player. It is a perfect opportunity for someone wanting to understand all areas of

business performance and to become the go-to person for analysis and insight.

**Key Responsibilities-**

* Must have 3+ Years of experience in ERP Sales and SAP services
* Achieve growth and hit sales targets by successfully managing the sales team
* Design, Develop and implement a strategic business plan that expands company’s customer base and ensure its strong presence
* Should have a strong network of contacts for new business opportunities with top leading corporate
* Must be able to identify Business opportunities, creating a well-qualified Sales Pipeline, Develop and execute strategic plans to achieve sales targets, and expand customer base
* Should be able to independently plan and execute the entire sales cycle i.e. from lead generation to deal closure
* Should be able to identify and tap-in to current market industry trend
* Identifying and contacting potential clients to determine their needs and assess their interest in the company’s products or services
* Managing an existing sales & Sales & Marketing Team, providing ongoing coaching and feedback to help them increase their performance
* Ensuring that company services are represented accurately in advertising and marketing materials
* Negotiating contracts and managing relationships with vendors, suppliers, partners, and other external parties to ensure compliance with legal requirements
* Providing leadership, training, and motivation to the sales team to help them meet their goals
* Exceed sales targets and close new business deals
* Communicating regularly with senior management about the status of projects and issues that could impact performance
* Analysing data from internal systems and external sources to identify opportunities to improve sales performance

Interested Candidate kindly drop their resume on **hrcommunications@ptssystems.co.in** or can contact us on 9136477343.

Regards,

Sangita

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: Up to ₹800,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Cell phone reimbursement
* Provident Fund

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Weekend availability

Supplemental pay types:

* Performance bonus
* Yearly bonus

Experience:

* ERP Sales: 2 years (Preferred)
* CRM software: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

**Job Description:**

**Job Description**

***Business System Analyst***


Who we are? Sun Life is a leading financial services company with history of 150+ years that helps our clients achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives. We serve millions in Canada, the U.S., Asia, the U.K., and other parts of the world. We have a network of Sun Life advisors, third-party partners, and other distributors. Through them, we’re helping set our clients free to live their lives their way, from now through retirement. We’re working hard to support their wellness and health management goals, too. That way, they can enjoy what matters most to them. And that’s anything from running a marathon to helping their grandchildren learn to ride a bike. To do this, we offer a broad range of protection and wealth products and services to individuals, businesses, and institutions, including: • Insurance. Life, health, wellness, disability, critical illness, stop-loss, and long-term care insurance. • Investments. Mutual funds, segregated funds, annuities, and guaranteed investment products • Advice. Financial planning and retirement planning services • Asset management. Pooled funds, institutional portfolios, and pension funds With innovative technology, a strong distribution network and long-standing relationships with some of the world’s largest employers, we are today providing financial security to millions of people globally. Sun Life is a leading financial services company that helps our clients achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives, with strong insurance, asset management, investments, and financial advice portfolios. At Sun Life, our asset management business draws on the talent and experience of professionals from around the globe.

**Your scope of work / key responsibilities:**


Business System Analyst with 3-5 years total exp to perform the following : Elicitation, Requirements Analysis and Documentation , Gap Analysis & Functional Specification Document Ongoing support of business applications by problem analysis , resolution , reporting and escalation as required Work closely with virtual teams (Business Users , Development , QA and Project Managers) to ensure timely delivery of tasks /projects Participating and sharing Functional knowledge with rest of the team. Participates in conference calls and able to communicate effectively Should be willing to provide on call support as and when required Occasional weekend and / or off-hour work in support of project implementations May be responsible for conducting a test plan review and acquiring test plan signoff. Designs and creates test case documentation including test situations, data setup, execution steps and expected results.

**https://sunlifefinancial.sharepoint.com/sites/ASC/ECF**

**Key Qualifications and experience:**


3-5 years of Business System Analyst experience in IT. College graduate degree from reputed organization Good communication skills. Team Player. Strong Analytical , Mathematical and logical capabilities Exposure to Customer Communication and Management

**https://sunlifefinancial.sharepoint.com/sites/ASC/ECF** 

**Technical Credentials:** **BSA, Gap Analysis, LOMA Certified**

**Primary Location:** **Gurugram**

**Job Category:**


Business Analysis - Systems**Posting End Date:**


29/06/2024

title: Product Owner
description:
**About Unilode**

  



Unilode owns and manages the world’s largest fleet of approximately 160,000 unit load devices (ULDs), for use in the aviation industry, and owns and operates the largest global network for the maintenance and repair of ULDs and inflight food service equipment. Unilode provides management, repair, short term leasing and digitalisation solutions to over 90 airlines through a network of more than 550 airports, 18 regional offices and 50 certified repair stations, supported by 700+ employees. For more information visit unilode.com.

  


**Position Overview**

  

As a key contributor the IT Product Owner - FSL & STL will take on a pivotal role in shaping and enhancing our IT & Digital. The focus will be on Leasing business solutions regarding 'Full-Service Leasing' and 'Short Term Leasing'. This position focuses on all stakeholders that will be involved or impacted by the product delivery, particularly our (internal) customers, and collaborates with cross-functional teams, including IT, Operations, Customer Service Management and Finance, to ensure that our technology solutions meet the business’ needs.

 **General Responsibilities**

  

* Understand, document, and prioritize high level business requirements.
* Convert high level business requirements into executable, detailed user stories to enable development.
* Document key business processes and systems and understand how they operate/integrate.
* Maintain reporting dashboard of all change requests and statuses.
* Facilitate review of all IT change requests via the Change Review Board.
* Manage the relationship between IT and key stakeholders and management teams including subsidiaries leadership, meeting on a regular basis, and identifying all business initiatives and future projects.
* Proactively identify opportunities to leverage technical solutions and emerging technologies to facilitate business solutions.
* Provide expertise and advice to business unit owners, IT leaders, project teams, and other support teams.
* Identify gaps in the application functionality and work with the technical team to provide solution.
* Add approved changes to the IT development backlog to include epics and user stories.
* Provide ways to identify and understand customer needs, gaps and opportunities using customer-centric design approaches.
* Improve the quality of product ideas.
* Play a crucial role in the agile development process, participating in sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives.
* Assist in product testing, analysis, and diagnosis.
* Document procedures, standards, best practices, configuration settings and sequences.
* Evolve the understanding of customers and the marketplace to solidify a strong product vision.
* Additional duties as assigned.

  


**Qualifications**

  

* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Aviation  

Management or related field. Master's degree preferred.
* Proven experience as a Product Owner or similar role, preferably in Aviation, Logistics and/or Leasing.
* Experience working within an Agile Scrum Environment.
* Scrum certification (e.g., Certified Scrum Product Owner)
* Ability to process information, take direction and deliver actionable results with minimal supervision.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
* Ability to summarize complex concepts into business terms.
* Ability to understand customer and business needs and convert them into a compelling  

product vision.
* High attention to detail including precise and effective communication and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.
* Ability to create detailed, well-written documentation for a variety of audiences.
* Excellent stakeholder management and influencing skills.
* Results driven and can lead/drive solutions.
* Experience initiating and driving projects to completion with minimal guidance.
* Highly self-motivated and keen to work in a fast-paced organization with a passion for working on new technologies.
* Enthusiasm to proactively coordinate and act within a team environment.
* Ability to work independently as well as under the direction of product managers.
* Business process re-engineering and optimization skills, experience with business process modeling or use case modeling is a plus.
* Strong understanding of data analytics, a working knowledge of data mining and OLAP tools is a plus.
* Also experience with mobile application development is a plus.

title: Mobility Specialist
description:
**This is where you save and sustain lives**


At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You'll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.


Baxter's products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.


Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.


Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives—where your purpose accelerates our mission.

**About Us**

Nothing changes if nothing changes, which is why Baxter is transforming our global IT function—into one that will strengthen partnerships and enable smarter, more efficient and connected business processes. In the dynamic healthcare industry, we need to be ready to face new challenges and opportunities. As we learn, we must be agile and innovative to reveal new ways of working. Technology and our digital capability will help create a more efficient and innovative ecosystem to enable our employees, customers, and products to drive better outcomes for patients worldwide.


We are at the critical intersection where robust IT infrastructure and networking support meets the physicians, nurses and care givers who save and sustain lives. Together, we can build upon Baxter’s rich heritage to advance the next generation of transformative healthcare innovations. Together, we can change how IT meets healthcare. Together, we are Baxter.


This is where technology fuels purpose-driven work. Where your purpose accelerates our mission.

**Title: Analyst for Java J2EE**

**Location: Bangalore**

**Your Role:**


Reporting to Manager, Java & Mobility architect team, the Specialist IT JAVA J2EE architect, you will be responsible implementing our organization's Java/J2EE efforts in close collaboration with other IT teams and business stakeholders. Your role will be critical in driving a user-centered design approach while ensuring alignment with business objectives and technical feasibility.

* Work closely with various business stakeholders and with your Lead to develop different programs and leverage cloud native services in a large global environment that supports both business and customer needs.
* Technical depth in customer facing systems from an application, development, operations, scalability, availability, performance, people, process, and tooling perspective.
* Work with a global team to understand requirements and implement solutions.

**What you’ll be doing**

* Design/develop & Support solutions based on a strategic business and technical requirements.
* Selecting the appropriate services based on best practices of java development and implementations. Estimate costs and identify cost feasible options.
* Technical leadership in the full life cycle of the software environment. Working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies.
* Adhering to the defined best practices for building secure and reliable custom development of integrations.
* Drive scope definition, requirements analysis, functional and technical design, application build and production deployment
* Ensure delivered solutions meet/perform to technical and functional/non-functional requirements
* Provide support and technical governance, expertise related to cloud integrations architectures, deployment, and operations
* Act as the coach and mentor to team members and technical staff on their assigned project tasks

**What you’ll bring**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science/MCA, systems analysis or a related study, or equivalent experience
* 8-10 years of experience spanning at least two IT disciplines application development, database management or operations
* Exposure to multiple, diverse technologies and processing environments
* knowledge in Java/J2EE technology.
* Open liberty
* Spring/Spring Boot, microservices/api’s
* ORM Tools (JPA or hibernate)
* Database – Oracle/Postgres
* React/Node js, angular js , or any JavaScript framework
* Knowledge on AWS cloud services
* Able to troubleshoot and resolve application defects.

**Soft Competencies:**


Strong verbal and written communication skills (content creation such as whitepapers, proof of concepts, patents, etc.). Ability to explain complex technology decisions to both technical and non-technical audiences at all levels in the organization.

**Reasonable Accommodations**  

  

Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

**Recruitment Fraud Notice**  

  

Baxter has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Baxter employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice.

title: Development Operations Engineer
description:
***About Unlimit***
*Founded in 2009, Unlimit is a global fintech company that offers a large portfolio of financial services, including payment processing, Banking as a Service (BaaS), and an on-ramp fiat solution for crypto, DeFi, and GameFi. The company’s mission is to deliver solutions that eliminate financial borders, enabling businesses to operate locally and internationally easily across Europe, the UK, LatAm, APAC, India, and Africa. Unlimit has over 500 employees across 16 offices and five continents, including London, Frankfurt, Singapore, São Paulo, Hong Kong, and Mexico. For further information, please visit* ***https://www.unlimit.com*** **About The Job**  

We’re looking for **DevOps Engineer.** This job is assigned and dismissed by Head of IT. The direct and reporting manager is Head of IT.
Automation of cloud provisioning, as well as design, implementation, and deployment scalable, multi-tenant micro-services environments. **We offer:**  

Attractive monthly salary paid in line with experience
Vacation, sick, and paid holidays
Flexible working hours
Full-time: 5/2 office in Gurgaon
Modern workplace with all necessary equipment
A team of top international professionals to learn from
Multicultural working environment
### **Requirements**

* Terraform: strict understanding of risks, problems, solutions and best practices:
* related to working in the team environment
* related to complex infrastructure provisioning on one of major cloud providers: AWS, GCP, Azure
* AWS Security basics
* Basic understanding of AWS Well Architected Framework
* Familiarity with following AWS services
* Networking: VPC, Subnets, Gateways and routing
* EC2, Autoscaling, Load Balancing
* Container ecosystem: EKS, ECR
* RDS, Aurora & Aurora Serverless (PostgreSQL capability)
* ElastiCache
* S3 and CloudFront
* Monitoring, logging and analytics
* Kubernetes & Docker:
* Understanding of basic operational primitives
* Experience, or good understanding of following tools: Kustomize, ArgoCD, Helm
* Strict understanding of risks, problems, solutions and best practices in containerised environments
* RabbitMQ, PostgreSQL, Oracle operations basics
* Good knowledge of GitLab CI
* Jenkins basics
* Bash and Python scripting, debugging and troubleshooting
* Motivated, self-starter, creative thinker
* Good written and verbal communication skills

### **Responsibilities**

* Contribute to company goals and objectives by improving products and services time to market, security, scalability, reliability, and cost effectiveness
* Work in functional team, and cross-functional project workgroups in cooperation with architecture, development & QA teams members
* Design, provision, and operate development & testing environments for multiple products & teams
* Support products lifecycle by designing, implementing and supporting build/publish/delivery pipelines and automation
* Perform other duties of a similar nature or level.

***Join Unlimit Team now!*** *Unlimit is an equal opportunity employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.*

title: Senior IT Analyst
description:
**Careers that Change Lives**  

  

We believe that when people from different cultures, genders, and points of view come together, innovation is the result —and everyone wins. Medtronic walks the walk, creating an inclusive culture where you can thrive.  



Bring your talents to an industry leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions – we’re a market leader and growing every day. You can be proud to be a part of technologies that are rooted in our long history of mission-driven innovation. You will be empowered to shape your own career. We support your growth with the training, mentorship, and guidance you need to own your future success. Together, we can transform healthcare.


Join us for a career in IT that changes lives.


**A Day in the Life****Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned.**

**·** **Engages with business leaders to understand how strategies and data-driven changes can improve efficiencies and add value.**

**·** **Work with data sets to define use cases to improve products, processes and/or services.**

**·** **Collaborates business stakeholders and IT Product Owners / Managers to develop business requirements for product or system changes.**

**·** **Drives business agenda during solution delivery process.**

**·** **Functional Skills: Ability to analyze data and trends in order to develop recommendations to solve business problems.**

**Additional Skills: Problem Solving, Detail Oriented, Cross-Functional Collaboration, Customer Service, Process Improvement, Communication.**

**T** **echnology: Understanding of systems, software and technological concepts, Familiarity with data analysis tools and data modeling methodologies.**

**Must Have: Minimum Requirements**

**·** **Requires advanced knowledge of job area combining breadth and depth, typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience.**

**·** **May have practical knowledge of project management.**

**·** **Requires a Baccalaureate degree (or for degrees earned outside of the United States, a degree which satisfies the requirements of 8 C.F.R. § 214.2(h)( 4)(iii)(A) and minimum of 4 years of relevant experience, or advanced degree with a minimum of 2 years relevant experience.**

  

**Nice to Have****·** **Familiar with Agile/Scrum development methodology**

**·** **Experience in working across global teams**

**·** **Ability to understand end-audience needs and requirements**

**·** **Detail oriented and organized with the ability to manage multiple priorities.**

**·** **Strong oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills**

**·** **Healthcare industry / business knowledge or experience**

**·** **Experience with CRM and Quality Management Platforms such as Sparta Systems TrackWise/TrakcWise Digital, Veeva Vault, Salesforce and SAP CRM**

  

**About Medtronic**  

  

  

**Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.**  

  

**We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.**  

  

**Physical Job Requirements**  

  

**The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)****#MEICITJOBS**

title: Sales
description:
We are looking for an ambitious and energetic Business Development Manager to help us expand our clientele. You will be the front of the company and will have the dedication to create and apply an effective sales strategy.

The goal is to drive sustainable financial growth through boosting sales and forging strong relationships with clients.

Responsibilities

* Develop a growth strategy focused both on financial gain and customer satisfaction
* Conduct research to identify new markets and customer needs
* Arrange business meetings with prospective clients
* Promote the company’s products/services addressing or predicting clients’ objectives
* Prepare sales contracts ensuring adherence to law-established rules and guidelines
* Keep records of sales, revenue, invoices etc.
* Provide trustworthy feedback and after-sales support
* Build long-term relationships with new and existing customers
* Develop entry level staff into valuable salespeople

* Proven sales track record
* Experience in customer support is a plus
* Proficiency in MS Office and CRM software (e.g. Salesforce)

* Market knowledge
* Communication and negotiation skills

title: Business Development Manager
description:
**Job Summary:**

We are in search of a dynamic and versatile Sales Manager & Business Developer to lead our sales efforts and spearhead business growth initiatives, particularly within the Information Technology (IT) sector. This role requires a proactive leader with a knack for sales management, a keen understanding of IT solutions, and a proven ability to drive revenue through strategic business development efforts. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in shaping our sales strategy, fostering client relationships, and expanding our market presence in the IT industry.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Sales Strategy and Planning:**
* Develop and execute comprehensive sales plans to achieve revenue targets and penetrate new markets within the IT sector.
* Analyze market trends, competitor activities, and customer insights to identify business opportunities and refine sales strategies accordingly.
* Collaborate with senior management to align sales objectives with broader company goals and initiatives.
* **Team Leadership and Management:**
* Lead, motivate, and mentor the sales team to drive performance excellence and exceed sales targets.
* Provide ongoing coaching, training, and support to enhance the team's selling skills, product knowledge, and customer relationship management abilities.
* Foster a collaborative and results-driven sales culture that emphasizes accountability, innovation, and continuous improvement.
* **Business Development and Client Relationship Management:**
* Identify and pursue new business opportunities within the IT industry, including strategic partnerships, client acquisitions, and market expansions.
* Cultivate and nurture relationships with key clients, stakeholders, and industry influencers to maximize business growth and drive customer satisfaction.
* Leverage insights into client needs and market dynamics to develop tailored solutions and value propositions that address specific business challenges and opportunities.
* **Sales Operations and Performance Optimization:**
* Oversee all aspects of sales operations, including pipeline management, forecasting, budgeting, and reporting.
* Utilize data analytics and key performance indicators (KPIs) to track sales performance, evaluate trends, and make data-driven decisions to optimize sales effectiveness and efficiency.
* Implement best practices, processes, and technologies to streamline sales workflows, enhance productivity, and drive operational excellence.
* **Product and Market Expertise:**
* Maintain a deep understanding of our IT product portfolio, industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitive landscape.
* Collaborate closely with product management and marketing teams to effectively position our offerings, differentiate our value proposition, and capitalize on market opportunities.
* Act as a subject matter expert on IT solutions and services, providing insights, thought leadership, and guidance to clients, prospects, and internal stakeholders.

**Qualifications and Skills:**

* Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, information technology, or a related field; Master's degree preferred.
* Proven track record of success in sales management and business development roles, with a minimum of 5 years of experience in the IT industry.
* Strong understanding of IT solutions, services, market dynamics, and customer needs.
* Exceptional leadership, communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to inspire and motivate cross-functional teams, drive collaboration, and foster a customer-centric sales culture.
* Proficiency in sales CRM software, sales forecasting tools, and Microsoft Office Suite.
* Willingness to travel as needed to meet with clients, attend industry events, and support sales initiatives.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Fixed shift

Experience:

* total work: 10 years (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Hyderabad, Telangana (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Hyderabad, Telangana: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

**Speak with the employer**  
+91 7760540007

title: Zone Manager
description:
**Schneider Electric** (SE) is the global specialist in energy management and automation. SE develops connected technologies and solutions to manage energy and process in ways that are safe, reliable, efficient and sustainable. SE provides an integrated approach, designed for the reality of digital economy (Plant-to-Plug). The versatile product portfolio addresses all energy needs of industries as well as residential.


**About the group (SD):** All IT needs for SE are managed by a group called Schneider Digital (SD); spread across 303 locations in 60 countries with over 2300 staff; along with various engagements with all major Global IT Service Providers.


**About the role - ‘Business Relationship Manager - Schneider Digital’:** There are various Business as well as Digital transformation initiatives within Schneider Digital for making it agile as well as best in class. This role’s pivotal responsibility would be to interface with Business to collaboratively identify and prioritize the Digital Transformation roadmap for Business Units in the Greater India zone


**Brief Roles & Responsibilities**


* Build and maintain strong relationships with key business stakeholders.


* Act as a liaison between the business and Enterprise IT, translating business requirements into IT / Digital requirements.


* Develop and implement Digital / IT strategies that align with business goals and objectives


* Ensure effective and efficient delivery of IT services, including monitoring and improving IT processes and managing vendors.


* Lead a team of business analysts, helping them develop domain and digital transformation expertise


* Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices, and leverage this knowledge to improve business outcomes.
  




**Qualifications** **Candidate Preferences**


* 10+ years of overall experience


* Excellent communication, coordination, and team leadership skills


* Tier 1 / Tier 2 MBA graduates with a consulting background preferred


* Exposure to R&D Digital Enablement / Transformation preferable


* **Strong communication skills**: Ability to build and maintain strong relationships with business stakeholders, translate business requirements into IT initiatives, and communicate IT plans and strategies effectively


* **Business acumen**: Strong understanding of business operations, goals, and objectives to develop and implement IT strategies that align with business needs and provide value to the business


* **Project management skills:** Ability to manage IT budgets, resources, timelines, and vendors to deliver IT projects and initiatives successfully


* **Technical knowledge**: Good understanding of IT systems, software, and infrastructure to communicate effectively with IT teams and make informed decisions about IT initiatives


* **Continuous learning mindset:** Desire to stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices to identify opportunities to improve business outcomes and drive innovation.


**Primary Location****:** IN-Karnataka-Bangalore

**Schedule****:** Full-time**Unposting Date****:** Ongoing

title: IT Manager
description:
**Job description:** Looking for an IT Sales Manager with over 7 years of experience in selling IT Services, specifically in ServiceNow or other SaaS product lines. This role is performance-driven, with targets and incentives, and you will be tasked with driving business growth and achieving the monthly/quarterly objectives.


Your primary emphasis will be on establishing a presence in untapped markets and acquiring new clients. You will play a pivotal role in constructing your sales pipeline and steering prospects toward successful closures, aiming to surpass sales targets. Consequently, a demonstrated history of effectively finalizing high-value technology solutions is essential.


**Roles and Responsibilities**


* Scout/hunt new business opportunities, and acquire new customers to enhance sales.
* Set Meetings with prospects, and establish and maintain relationships with new/existing customers.
* Find/develop new markets and potential customers to meet business targets- software products and services (end-to-end client handling)
* Planning and overseeing new marketing initiatives.
* Developing quotes and proposals for Customers.
* Lead team and help them to complete their targets.
* Contacting potential Customers IT Managers and IT Heads of Corporates, to establish rapport and arrange meetings.
* Finding and developing new markets and improving sales.


**Requirements**


* Minimum 7 years experience in B2B IT Sales – Direct Sales and out of the total experience min 2 years should be in a Supervisory Role.
* Ability to sell complex services that span service lines, geographies, and delivery methodologies.
* Excellent Persuasive & Communication Skills**.**
* Proficient in Word, Excel, Outlook & PowerPoint.
* Business Goal Oriented, ability to achieve business targets consistently.
* Willingness to travel frequently during the month.
* Should have past or current experience in selling either Software, SaaS, IT Services or Hardware Products.
* Person must have dealt with IT Heads in the Corporate industry.


**Education**


* MBA in Sales and Marketing, BE, B.Tech, BCA in Computers, B.Sc. or any other Graduate.
**Job Type:** Full Time
**Job Location:** Hyderabad Telangana

title: IT Manager
description:
Are you an innovative IT Product Manager with a passion for delivering cutting-edge solutions? Do you have a track record of managing and enhancing enterprise software platforms? We are seeking a dynamic IT Product Manager to lead the development and optimization of our ServiceNow (SNOW) and Unily platforms. In this pivotal role, you will be responsible for the supporting product life cycle, from conception to deployment, ensuring that our internal tools align with business goals and deliver exceptional user experiences.  

  

**Main Responsibilities and Duties:**  

  

* Define and prioritize product roadmaps, balancing business needs with technical capabilities, to drive continuous improvement in SNOW and Unily platforms.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, HR, Communications, and other business units, to gather requirements, define scope, and deliver solutions that meet or exceed stakeholder expectations.
* Manage the full product lifecycle for both platforms, including strategic planning, development, launch, support, and eventual sunsetting, as necessary.
* Oversee and coordinate the work of internal teams and external vendors to ensure timely and high-quality delivery of platform enhancements and projects.
* Act as a subject matter expert on SNOW and Unily platforms, providing guidance and support to users and stakeholders.
* Measure and report on the platforms' performance, using data to make informed decisions about future developments and improvements.
* Ensure adherence to best practices, quality standards, and regulatory compliance for all platform-related activities.

  

**Required Qualifications:**  

  

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field.
* Professional certifications in ServiceNow and/or Unily are highly desirable.
* **A minimum of 5 years of experience in product management, with specific experience managing enterprise software platforms.**
* Demonstrated success in deploying and managing ITSM tools, particularly ServiceNow, and intranet platforms such as Unily.
* Strong understanding of IT operations and the role of digital workplace solutions in enhancing employee productivity and engagement.

  

**Desired Skills and Knowledge:**  

  

* **Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to articulate both technical and business concepts to diverse audiences.**
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies and experience working in an Agile environment.
* **Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet tight deadlines.**
* Experience with change management and the ability to drive adoption of new tools and processes.

  

**Tools Required:**  

  

* Proficiency in the ServiceNow platform, including ITSM, ITOM, and ITBM modules.
* Expertise in managing and configuring Unily or comparable intranet platforms.
* Familiarity with project management tools such as JIRA, Confluence, or similar.
* Knowledge of analytics and reporting tools to measure platform performance and user engagement.
* Comfort with collaboration and communication tools like Slack, Microsoft Teams, or similar to facilitate effective team interaction.

  

If you are eager to shape the future of our company's digital landscape and possess the skills and qualifications listed above, we would love to hear from you. Join us in this exciting role as an IT Product Manager for SNOW and Unily, and become an integral part of our success story.

title: Senior R&D Engineer
description:
About Mozarc Medical
  
  

At Mozarc Medical, our vision is to reimagine the future of holistic kidney health technology. Established in 2023 out of equal investments from DaVita, a leading provider of kidney care services, and Medtronic, one of the world’s largest medical device companies, Mozarc Medical offers an exciting and unique start-up experience backed by the support of two long-time industry and market leaders.
  
Driven by our mission and values, we put our patients at the center of all we do. Our employees play a key role in developing technology solutions that enrich patients’ lives and create meaningful progress in the treatment of kidney disease. Find your purpose and passion at Mozarc Medical.
  
**Position Title:** Sr IT Business Analyst - R&D
  
  

A Day in the Life
  
  

The R&D IT Business Analyst is a key member of global IT with responsibility for functional requirements definition and configuration of systems supporting product development capabilities (CAD, LIMS, Software Development tools, Risk/Requirements mgmt., Calibration mgmt., etc.. ). This hands-on role works closely with internal customers, process owners, development teams, support teams, and other stakeholders to ensure that end-to-end solutions are delivered with quality and that expectations are met for functionality, reliability, and availability. You will participate in the development and help drive the adherence of relevant standards, guidelines, and procedures. In addition, you will Identify best practices and facilitates their use.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

* Support projects and initiatives to deploy new functionality and/or enhance existing functionality.
* Partner with business owners and development teams to define and implement solutions that drive business value.
* Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and internal IT team members both in the US and offshore locations to drive the work.
* Facilitate discussions among business owners to understand problem statements and gather, refine, and prioritize requirements.
* Translate business requirements to functional and technical solutions on commercial system and the adjacent ecosystem.
* Document the solution design with specific business and technical details, including but not limited to process flow diagrams, functional specs documentation, use cases, impact analysis and decision decks.
* Develop and maintain end user training documentation and deliver training as required.
* Collaborate with development teams to define and implement solutions that adhere to accepted best practices and meet business requirements.
* Verify compliance through day to day analysis on work related to project demand, applications and architecture.
* Consults with business stakeholders to understand and evaluate current business processes and identify complex business problems and needs turning those needs into system requirements.
* Identify opportunities to build streamlined operational processes and tools to support customer needs
* Look for ways to optimize and reuse software components
* Gather and analyze data to identify issues, non-compliance and follow up required to ensure processes are followed
* Partnering with cross-functional development teams to identify opportunities to build streamlined operational processes and tools to support customer needs
* Complete analysis and requirements for ad hoc process improvement requests
* Participating in system design review, planning and prioritization
* Balance speed and reliability while assisting in defining service level objectives based on business and product need
* Provides technical expertise for system functional specifications, processes and procedures in a cost-effective manner
* May configure system settings and options; plan and execute unit, system, and integration testing to meet business requirements.
* May lead cross-functional linked teams to address business or systems issues.
* Provide timely and efficient communication to stakeholders


Must Have
  
  

* Requires a Bachelor degree and minimum of 4 years of relevant experience, or advanced degree with a minimum of 2 years relevant experience


Nice to Have
  
  

* Application experience with PTC Windchill and CREO for CAD management
* Experience with LIMS (Laboratory Information Management System) and equipment caliabration software
* Great analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills
* Resourcefulness and ability to decisive creative solutions to problems


Why Work with Us?
  
Working here is highly rewarding – we have the privilege of helping kidney patients experience greater freedom, improved outcomes and a renewed passion for life.
  
It’s essential our team members feel valued, supported and empowered too. That’s why we provide a comprehensive total rewards package and opportunities to grow, develop and give back to the communities where we live and work – helping you reach your potential and enjoy a career full of life-changing possibilities.
  
  

Physical Job Requirements
  
The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)
  
  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
  
  

Is this the position you were waiting for? Apply here!

Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. **Job Description:**

 **Who We Are:**


Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open opportunities with HPE.


HPE Global IT is a dynamic organization enabling the enterprise to innovate and lead the industry with our consumption-based IT transformation and our consulting, financial, educational, and operational support services. Join us as we develop innovative solutions that revolutionize how we help customers by simplifying their operations and move the world forward.

**What you’ll do:**

***Job Family Definition:***


Researches, designs, develops, configures, integrates, tests and maintains existing and new business applications and/or information systems solutions including databases through integration of technical and business requirements. Applications and infrastructure solutions include both 3rd party software and internally developed applications and infrastructure. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, analysis of business requirements, coding of modifications or new program, creation of documentation, testing and maintenance of applications, infrastructure, and information systems including database management systems. Works within the Information Technology function, obtaining resources and working in support of objectives and strategies. Provides required documentation and participates in architecture reviews to ensure that the solutions comply with standards and use approved technologies. Typical customers are company end users and various functional areas such as Supply Chain, Research and Development, Marketing, Finance, a business, or the company.

***Management Level Definition:***

**Unique mastery** and recognized authority on relevant subject matter knowledge including technologies, theories and techniques. Contributes to the development of innovative principles and ideas. Successfully operates in the most complex disciplines, in which the company must operate to be successful. Provides highly innovative solutions. Leads large, cross-division functional teams or projects that affect the organization's long-term goals and objectives. May participate in cross-division, multi-function teams. Provides mentoring and guidance to lower level employees. Routinely exercises independent judgment in developing methods, techniques and criteria for achieving objectives. Develops strategy and sets functional policy and direction. Acts as a functional manager within area of expertise but does not manage other employees as a primary job function.

***Responsibilities:***

* Participates as a member of and leads cross-functional development teams. Performs analysis of cross-functional and complex business requirements. Designs complex cross-functional solutions for others to code. Provides mentoring and guidance to other developers.
* Designs, prepares and executes Unit tests. Sets team strategy and direction; represents team to senior management and client/customers. Develops innovative multi-team solutions to complex problems.
* A preponderance of time is spent in strategic and creative problem solving. Demonstrates broad technical leadership, impacting significant technical direction; exerts influence outside of immediate team and drives change. Applies in-depth or broad technical knowledge to manage global maintenance services across various technology areas or functions. Performs solution design.
* Applies the company and 3rd party technologies and leads design of highly complex infrastructure and software solutions, while driving innovation. Independently implements end- user or enterprise infrastructure or services of significant complexity.
* Integrates technical expertise and business understanding to create superior solutions for the company and customers. Consults with team members and other organizations, customer and vendors on complex issues. Mentors others in the technology community; may publish or otherwise engage professionally outside of the company.

**What you need to bring:**

***Education and Experience Required:***

* Typically a technical Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience and a minimum of 12 years of related experience or a Master's degree and a minimum of 10 years of experience.

***Knowledge and Skills:***

* 8-10 years of working experience in SAP GTS, OTC , Supply chain module .
* End-to-end implementation experience for configuration related to SAP GTS, product classification.
* Advanced understanding of modern software development methodologies.
* Advanced understanding of Supply Chain Management and Trade services & Customs.
* Writing FDS, TDS, unit testing, regression and SIT testing. Support UAT and user trainings.
* Advanced understanding of Software Test methodologies, and an expert in testing tools. Strong General Project Management.
* Strong Customer/ Vendor Management.
* Strong Business Analysis.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills; demonstrated influencing skills, high level of technical and team leadership skills.

**What we can offer you:**


A competitive salary and extensive social benefits


Diverse and dynamic work environment


Work-life balance and support for career development
